loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara, the leader of this group, used to work as a schoolteacher. Her teacher’s salary was far less than sufficient, even for basic survival. She believed that there had to be another way of life, a more deserving one. Gulnara made a choice toward improving her life even though she knew that it would require some sacrifice.

Seven years ago she convinced her husband to sell their car. She invested the proceeds, about $1050, into setting up a business. She started trading in foodstuffs (candies, biscuits, canned food and cereals) in her own stall at a city market. Her family's quality of life has indeed improved. She is making $350 a month, which is one-third of the car’s selling price. Besides being able to pay for their children’s education, they have been able to buy a car, to open another shop near their house, and to put a refrigerator, a freezer and a rack in the shop .

Gulnara has three children. Her husband still works at the school. Her son, 19, works as an electrician. Another son goes to a law school. Their daughter, 14, goes to school, and after school she substitutes for her mother.

Gulnara wants to obtain a loan to purchase cereals, candies and vegetable oil, and to buy some winter clothes for winter trade. She is making plans about expanding her shop and making changes to attract more customers. Gulnara’s partners are: Gulnura, Shaiymkul, Anarkan and Gulnara. Gulnura, 36, has two children. Her husband is a welder and Gulnura helps him support the family by selling milk. Gulnura needs a loan to purchase two sheep and a calf and to put up new gates. Shaiymkul, 58, is a farmer’s wife. They have three children. Shaiymkul keeps some cattle and sells milk. Shaiymkul hopes to obtain a loan and buy a calf and with the rest of the loan harvest the clover. Anarkan, 46, has four children. She is a housewife and sells milk. Anarkan needs a loan to buy a calf. Gulnara, 46, has two children. Currently she is busy harvesting crops: clover, corn, pumpkin and sugar beets. She needs a loan to buy a calf. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, candies and vegetable oil and buy some winter clothes for winter trade

loans.name: Jonna May

texts.en:
Jonna May dreams of succeeding in life and wants to build a happy home with her husband and their one child.

Jonna May invested in rice farming and now owns 1.75 hectares (approx. 4.5 acres) of rice field. Her crops still need farm inputs so she has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other inputs she needs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: Doña María Menchú tiene 24 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chuisacmalja del  Cantón Xolsacmalja, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
María Menchú, 24, is married. She is a weaver, and she makes typical skirts. She lives with her husband. They both do the same work, and they have a small shop. They have been making skirts for some time. Their home is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase their sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong C. N. is a married 25-year-old village woman who currently sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She runs her business in the market and earns approximately $3 a day.  This humble couple has a lovely young child who isn't yet enrolled in school. Kong C. N. also owns a piece of land upon which she grows vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase a water pump for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to pump the water for her crop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
64-year-old Maria T. is managing both hog raising and rice farming businesses. She owns three hectares (7.5 acres) of land in Surallah, South Cotabato. She maximized every resource she has to become productive.

Maria joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan to raise capital for her businesses. She needs financial support at this time to have success in her businesses. She requested a loan of 15,000 Php to buy three more pigs and to pay for farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs and to pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Ishetu

texts.en:
Ishetu is a 32-year-old, married woman with no children. She trades in garment cloths and polyester, women's slippers and handbags. She normally buys her supplies on credit and pays back after the goods are sold. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased working capital. She wants to use the loan to purchase items in bulk, such as garment clothes, slippers and handbags to enable her to reduce her costs and raise a good income. 

She hopes to use part of her profit to build a decent shelter for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a young Palestinian woman, 28 years old. She is married with two young daughters aged 1.5 years and 3 months. Tamam and her husband are both employees: Tamam is a nurse while her husband is a police officer.

A year ago they established a grocery store to increase their income. While they are at their jobs Tamam’s brother-in-law manages the shop. In the grocery shop they sell candy, canned food, stationery, etc. The shop is near the UNRWA clinic and UNRWA School.

The UNRWA is the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for the Palestinian refugees who left their houses in Haifa, Yafa and settled in refugee camps in the West Bank and Gaza while some settled in refugee camps in Jordan, Lebanon and Syria. This UN agency provide education and health service in addition to many other services.

Since the grocery shop is located near a very busy area there is a huge demand and a good profit is coming from it. Tamam requested 2,000 USD to buy a freezer for frozen food in addition to buying other goods.

Because of cultural issues, Tamam's husband appears in the picture instead of her.

Tamam husbend appears in the photo at thier store.

loans.use: To buy goods for the grocery store and a freezer

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira DIAITE est une femme de 28 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KADIOR depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle achète en gros du poisson pour aller le revendre au détail dans son quartier. Elle assure une partie de la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Sira DIAITE is a 28-year old woman who is married with four children. She has been a member of the village bank in KADIOR for eight and a half years. She buys fish wholesale to sell it retail in her neighborhood. She assumes part of the family's responsibilities.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build up her fish selling business

loans.name: Moynatou

texts.fr: A. Moynatou est née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN.  Moynatou vit depuis 10 ans à Lom-Nava, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à AFFOTON Kabinar, Moynatou est mère de 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants et subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Pour soutenir son mari dans leurs dépenses, Moynatou exerce comme activité la vente d’alcool médical à 95°. C’est à pharmaquick, une pharmacie de Cotonou, et au NIGERIA, pays voisin du BENIN, que Moynatou s’approvisionne. Moynatou commercialise ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN. Moynatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école mais possède 15 années d’expérience dans son domaine. Moynatou est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé car ayant déjà bénéficié de 4 crédits  qu’elle a d’ailleurs tous bien remboursé. Dans l’optique de renforcer son commerce et de multiplier ses revenues, Moynatou souhaite obtenir un cinquième concours financier.
texts.en:
Moynatou A. was born in 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Kabinar AFFOTON, Moynatou is the mother of four children, all attending school. The couple lives together with their children and shares household expenses. To assist her husband with expenses, Moynatou has been selling medicinal alcohol (95°). She gets her supplies from Pharmaquick, a drugstore in Cotonou, and from neighboring Nigeria. Moynatou sells her product in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She has never attended school but has 15 years experience in her domain. Moynatou is a regular customer of ALIDé as she has previously been granted four loans, all well reimbursed. With the view of reinforcing her business and increasing her earnings, she is requesting a fifth loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy containers of medicinal alcohol and small bottles

loans.name: Igor

texts.en: Igor has a retail business selling shoes at Yulana market in the city of Zaporozhye. Igor has been in this business for five yeas. He enjoys selling shoes. His good prices and high quality attract many new as well as repeat customers. Igor's goal is to develop his business further. He wants to rent several more kiosks and increase his sales. Igor would like to receive a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase more inventory. Igor believes that with hard work he can develop his business and improve his life.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Julia María

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia María R. R. trabaja como enfermera en el centro de salud del Municipio de Somoto.

 Ella solicita un crédito el va a ser utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, ladrillos. Con esto ella tiene pensado remodelar su casa de habitación  y mejorar sus condiciones.

Ella empezó a trabajar como enfermera hace unos diez años una ves que se recibió de la secundaria y desde entonces se a dedicado a dicha labor, ella realiza este trabajo  de lunes a sábado  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Ella espera mejorar vivienda con el financiamiento que se le brinde en Ceprodel y de esta manera mejorar también su condición de vida así como la de  su familia.

Julia R. es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están en edad escolar y a los que le costea sus gastos escolares con el apoyo de su esposo.

Este es el crédito numero cinco que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de seis años, los que le han ayudado positivamente a ir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda así como la compra de electrodomésticos que le ha ayudado a facilitar las labores domesticas.
texts.en:
Julia María R. R. is a nurse in Somoto’s health center. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, bricks. She plans to remodel her house and improve its condition. She started working as a nurse about 10 years ago when she finished secondary school. Since then, she has been in this occupation. She works Monday through Saturday from 7 am until 5 pm. She hopes to improve her home with Ceprodel’s loan thus improving her and her family’s living conditions. Julia R. is married and has three children, two of whom are school-aged and for whom she, together with her husband, must provide for all educational expenses. This is her 5th loan with Ceprodel in a 6-year period. They have helped her to improve her home and to purchase home appliances that have eased her domestic chores.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam N. is widowed and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has had a business selling various kinds of fruits and also providing a money exchange service. She earns an income of $5 USD per day to help cover family expenses. The family is also assisted by one of her children who sells dry fish at a local market in the city. The family's standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. N. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to buy more dry fish for resale. This is her third loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.
The photograph shows Sam N.'s daughter with her dry fish stand at the market.

loans.use: To buy dry fish for resale

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh T. T. is 42 years old and lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She is married with three children.

Binh T. T. sells fruit in the market and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA for two years and has taken out loans. She wants to have a better life so she always tries to work hard.

Besides selling fruit, Binh T. T. breeds pigs and poultry. This time, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to invest in her business and buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To invest in her business and buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Yolany

texts.en:
Yolany F. is from the village of West Pob. Kal. Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Yolany is single and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolany sells clothing and shoes in the local community. Yolany has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Yolany joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolany has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. Yolany is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Yolany's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying supplies and equipment for repair work

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa B. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Elsa is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell and as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 49-year-old lady and is a single mother of five children. She lives in the small town of Hoima, in Uganda, where she sells dry foods such as beans, maize and groundnuts (peanuts).

Sarah is enjoying her business, she says, with no major hard ships so far, meaning: “so far, so good”. As for her business, she says she would like it to grow, with a big store of her produce, so as to be a large-scale produce dealer with higher returns.

This is Sarah’s second year in the business and she opted to obtain this loan from HOFOKAM so as to purchase more beans and groundnuts to sell at her food stall in Hoima.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, onions, and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour and beans to sell.  Rose is 31 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna S. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old and married with four school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lorna has been engaged in farming for over 10 years and also raises hogs. She was able to open a sari-sari store from her income selling products like vinegar, sugar and others.

Lorna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lorna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa T. is from the village of Usocan. She is 45 years old. Leonisa is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Leonisa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  Leonisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Leonisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wilma Zobeida

texts.es:
Wilma de 63 años, ella vende comida y también vende ropa, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, es madre soltera con cinco hijos. 

Desde que sus hijos eran pequeño ella  comenzó a trabajar  vendiendo ropa para poder solventar con los gastos familiares, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener suficiente clientela para comprar ropa y vender comida a sus vecinos. En la actualidad ella se dedica a la venta de comida y a la venta de ropa. Cada almuerzo lo vende a $1.25 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas y ropa para poder tener ingresos y así asegurar ya su vejez, en el futuro quiere tener un local para poder vender sus comidas y también la ropa.
texts.en:
Wilma is 63 years old, and sells food and clothing. She lives in an urban area in the Guayaquil suburbs. She is a single mother with 5 children.

Since her children were young she began selling clothes to help pay for family expenditures. Little by little, with hard work she was able to have enough customers to buy clothes and sell food to neighbors. As of now she sells food and clothes. Each meal sells for $1.25.

With this loan she plans to buy rice, beverages, and clothes to make profits and assure her future. In the future she wants to have a stand to sell meals and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of rice, beverages, and clothes.

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame Mariame K. est une  veuve qui mère de 8 enfants. Elle est née le 18 Avril 1957 à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle vit dans la maison de son défunt mari avec ses  enfants à Loulouni ville.
Matrone de son état au Centre de Santé Communautaire de Loulouni, elle mène parallèlement à cette profession, des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente du bois de chauffe depuis plusieurs années. De temps à autres elle vend aussi des tasses, des pagnes et des ustensiles de cuisine.
Expérimentée elle s’est procurée d’un âne, d’une charrette et a loue le service d’un charretier pour assurer le transport et la livraison du bois de chauffe. 
Elle est à son quinzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement dénoués. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt,  plusieurs chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe par semaine. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Loulouni.
Elle vend au comptant ou à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, et  très souvent sur commande.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne afin de pouvoir terminer sa construction.
texts.en:
Mrs Mariame K. is a widow and mother of 8 children. She was born on April 18, 1957 in Bamako (capital of Mali). She lives with her children in the house of her deceased husband in the town of Loulouni . She is a matron in the Community Health Centre of Loulouni, and for several years has also carried out income generating activities on the side, notably a business buying and selling firewood. She occasionally also sells kitchen utensils, cups, and loincloths. Quite experienced and much in demand, she bought a donkey and a cart, and rents the services of a cart driver to ensure transport and delivery of the firewood. This is her fifteenth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All her previous loans have been duly repaid. She intends to use her loan to buy several cartloads of firewood each week. She gets her supplies from the villages neighbouring Loulouni. She sells in retail or wholesale, cash or credit accepted, to a clientele of both men and women, and very often on order. She envisages making a monthly profit of 120.000FCFA of which one part will be used to increase her business activity, and the other part will be put in savings in order to complete construction of her house.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de  bois de chauffe.

loans.name: Brenes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Brenes está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Ana M. Brenes  quien tiene una tortillería negocio con el que ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos de los cuales solo dos están a su cargo.  

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Virginia M. Brenes  quien tiene una tortillería y María Isabel R. Machado vende helados, choco bananos y cuajada.
texts.en:
The Beres group is comprised of three hardworking and spirited women. One of them is Ana, who has a tortilla making business which has helped her and her three children, of whom two are in her care, to move forward in life. The other members of the group are Virginia, who has a tortilla making business, and María Isabel, who sells, ice cream, chocolate bananas and curd cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Ana Liza

texts.en:
Ana Liza M. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $38 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ana Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Ana Liza is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed for the pigs. This will be her 6th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for the pigs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is currently in the business of selling tea and cold drinks and is requesting a loan to stock more cold drinks and sugar.  Agnes is 24 years old and is married to a loader. She has one child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more cold drinks and sugar

loans.name: Pierso Ulises

texts.es:
En el Mercado Iván Montenegro en Managua, el señor Pierson Juarez se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como queso en su propio establecimiento. Es muy visitado por diversa cantidad de clientes y busca la forma de vender más queso para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El crédito que actualmente está solicitando es para la compra del queso seco, queso fresco, queso crema  y quesillo. Espera ser beneficiado y de esta manera continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar y atender la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr Pierson Juarez sells dairy products such as cheese from his own establishment in the Iván Montenegro Market in Managua.  He has a diverse quantity of customers and he is looking for ways to sell more cheese to satisfy the needs of his customers and support his household.

The loan which he is currently requesting will be used to buy 'queso seco' (a dry, aged cheese), 'queso fresco' (a crumbly, soft cheese), 'queso crema' (a heavy cream similar to crème fraiche) and 'quesillo' (a soft cheese).  He hopes that with his loan he will be able to keep fulfilling his household's needs and meet his customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy cheese

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur ibrahima S. est un jeune commerçant qui vend des articles de mercerie dans un petit marché de la place a quartier de grand mbour. Il a une expérience de prés de 3 ans dans son secteur d'activité. Ainsi, monsieur S. est venu solliciter ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités en cette période de fête pour avoir son gagne pain
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima S. is a young merchant who sells sewing notions at a small marketplace in the neighborhood of Grand Mbour. He has almost three years experience in this activity. 

Mr. S. is seeking a loan to strengthen his business and earn a living in this time of celebration.

loans.use: Trade

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, clothing, and food. 

She has operated a tailoring business for over six years from home. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Mwanaidi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own home in the future. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Brisa Del Este Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de la señora Blanca Oviedo, actualmente ex integrante, quien vive en Monday _C.D.E. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona.
El comité se denomina Brisa del Este. Están en el Séptimo Ciclo y está constituido por 15  integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable.
 Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, trabajan en conjunto en  la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento con la institución.
La presidenta del Grupo es la señora Felicia quien se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Comenta que está en una zona muy competitiva por la gran cantidad de negocios y ofertas que hay, y muchas veces es muy difícil vender las mercaderías con que cuentan, por lo que constantemente deben recurrir a técnicas de ventas.
Ella adquiere sus mercaderías de varios lugares, busca las ventajas de cada una uno para tener una buena ganancia en la hora de la venta.
Nuevamente solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sus mercaderías como vestidos, remeras, lencerías en general, zapatilla, bijouterie y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Blanca Oviedo who is no longer a member of the committee and lives in Monday, Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in her area.

The committee is called 'Brisa del Este'.  It is in its 7th loan cycle and has 15 members.  This is a group that stands out in the neighborhood because it is united and responsible.  The members have a great enterprising spirit and are up to date with their loan repayments.  They work together in their activities to make funds which can safeguard the committee if necessary.  They plan to end this stage by fulfilling their duties to the institution.

The group's president is Felicia who sells clothes.  She says that she is in a very competitive area because there are many businesses and offers.  It is often very difficult to sell her merchandise.  For this reason she must constantly employ different sales techniques.

Felicia acquires her merchandise in several places.  She looks for the advantages that each place offers so that she can make good profits when she comes to sell.  She is requesting a new loan to invest in buying merchandise suchy as dresses, t-shirts, underwear, sports shoes, jewelry, etc.

loans.use: To buy dresses, t-shirts, underwear, sports shoes, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa, trabaja como empleada en una tienda de atención de llamadas moviles; tiene una movilidad que trabaja de transporte publico, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa alquilada en la zona Santa Rosa de la ciudad de El Alto. Está separada del esposo.
El préstamo que solicita será utilizado en la compra de equipo de Gas Natural Vehicular, para la transformación de su movilidad para uso de gas en vez de gasolina. Esta acción dará como resultado un ahorro de casi el 60 % en el costo de combustible.
Este es el primer crédito que ella solicita de IMPRO y a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa works as an employee in a car repair shop. She has a vehicle with which she provides public transportation. She has two children, lives in a rented home in the Santa Rosa area of El Alto city. She is separated from her husband.

The loan will be used to buy a conversion kit to transform it from gas to using natural gas. This action will result in a 60% savings in the cost of fuel.

This is the first loan she is seeking from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a conversion kit to transform her vehicle from gas to natural gas

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Yin A., age 46, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham province, which is the best territory for farming. Yin A. is a married woman who is devoted to her four children, and all of them are single. Three of her children are employed in different jobs. 

Yin A. has a big farm thA. she inherited from her grandmother. Yin A. grows various rice crops, and she has never had a bad result from her farming business. Yin A. has another farm thA. she owns, but she is still not plowing yet. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to rent a plowing machine for plowing her farmland and to pay for farmland which she bought before.

loans.use: To rent a plowing machine for plowing her farmland and to pay for farmland which she previously bought.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Don Sergio, de 66 años de edad, posee una tapicería de muebles de madera y vehículos, él vive con su esposa en la Ciudad de San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia, haciéndolo desde hace 20 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:00am a 5:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades con el negocio.
Don Sergio necesita un préstamo para la compra de telas de diferentes clases y colores, hilos, pega y otros que son necesarios para la tapicería de muebles, ya que el no cuenta con suficiente inventario para cumplir con los trabajos que le llegan, este préstamo le ayudara a salir de esta situación.
La aspiración de él es que a través del buen trabajo que realiza pueda ganar clientela y de esta manera estabilizarse económicamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is 66 years old. He has an upholstering business for wood furniture and vehicles. He lives with his wife in the city of San Miguel, departament of San Miguel. He started this business on his own initiative and has been doing it for 20 years. He works Mondays through Saturdays from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm. So far, he has had no problems with the business.

Sergio needs a loan to buy different kinds and colors of fabrics as well as thread and glue and other things necessary for furniture upholstery. He doesn't have enough inventory to finish the jobs he gets, and this loan will help him get out of this. 

He aspires to being able to gain clientele through his good work and in this way stabilize himself financially with his family. .

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and glue.

loans.name: Bibisoida

texts.en:
B. Bibisoida is a mother of 4 children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Ever since she was a young she learned the honest work of raising the cattle, knowledge she has passed downed to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. Bibisoida and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk. They sell these on the weekends in their village. Currently Bibisoida wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. With the desire of improving their living Bibisoida is counting to your generous heart.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of items she has for sale

loans.name: Trancito

texts.es:
La Señora Transito P. es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por el sector de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, es una ciudad llena de cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Transito tiene 48 años, es casada y  tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 25, 17 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado,  vive en su casa pero independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja solo para sus gastos personales, su tercera hija  estudia en la universidad y su ultimo hijo en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Transito se dedica al comercio,  vende limpiones, repuestos para licuadoras, productos de higiene personal y muchos más artículos, lleva en esta actividad 29 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo con un horario de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Transito P. is a member of the 'Estrellitas' (Little Stars) community bank.  She lives in Quinta Chica neighborhood, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the fact that it was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  It is a city full of culture and traditions.

Transito is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 28, 26, 25 and 17.  Her eldest son is married.  He lives in her home but independently.  Her second son works and covers his personal expenses, her third child (a daughter) is studying at university and her youngest son attends high school in the city.  Her husband works as a salesman.  They do not own their own home and so rent their house.

Transito is a saleswoman.  She sells cleaning cloths, spare parts for blenders, personal care products and many other items.  She has been in this business for 29 years and works from Sunday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.

This is Transito's second loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying merchandise for her business.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy cleaning cloths, spare parts for blenders, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 28 years old, married to an engineer, and has 4 children who all go to school. Mary wants a loan to stock more bread to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara O. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and is married to an engineer.  Together with her husband she has raised two sons and a daughter.  Both sons are farmers and the daughter is studying at school. 

In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, Dinara breeds livestock and then resells them at a higher price. In this way, she earns additional 4000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to improve her family's living conditions and purchase household appliances. 

With the money received from the loan, Dinara would purchase more livestock. In the near future, she plans to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte colectivo. Tiene más de 37 años en este negocio,  pues fue con esfuerzo propio es que logro comprar este medio de transporte para que formara parte de un rol de rutas, con el paso del tiempo fue que Diana ha logrado obtener experiencia y brindarles a sus clientes la atención que merecen. Por este motivo es que decide realizar este financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, repuestos, tapizados de asientos.
texts.en: Diana Luz provides public transportation services.  She has been in this business for more than 37 years.  Through her own efforts, she was able to buy a vehicle so that she could take part in a network of routes.  As time passed, Diana managed to gain experience and provide her customers the attention they deserve.  For this reason, she decided to pursue financing in order to purchase tires, spare parts, and upholstered seats.

loans.use: to purchase tires, spare parts, and upholstered seats.

loans.name: Jesica Ketty

texts.es:
L. señorita Jesica es socia del banco comunal las Dalilas, del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 27 años D. edad y es soltera.
ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. gaseosas desD. hace 2 años, se inició con un pequeño préstamo  D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles que ManueL. Ramos le otorgó cuando ingreso al banco comunal.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 7 cajas D. gaseosas, 3 paquetes D. agua mineral con gas, 3 paquetes D. gaseosa guaraná,  2 paquetes D. gaseosa pepsi coL., 50 vasos descartables, 3 jabas D. gaseosa inca coL., 3 jabas D. gaseosa coca coL..
Está implementando su negocio D. a pocos, porque no cuenta con el capital para poder comprar mercadería al por mayor y por eso lo hace D. esa manera, no pierD. L. esperanza D. alcanzar sus sueños que es tener una tienda bien surtida y vender al por mayor, quiere aprovechar que es soltera para trabajar tranquiL. sin mas preocupación que su negocio.
texts.en:
Srta. Jesica is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Dalilas” which is in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 27 years old and single.

Jesica has been selling sodas for two years. She started with a small loan of 200 PEN from ManueL. Ramos upon joining the Communal Bank.

With this new loan of 2500 PEN, Jesica will buy the following items: seven cases of sodas, three packs of carbonated mineral water, three packs of “guarana” flavored soda, two packs of Pepsi CoL., fifty disposable cups, three cases of Inca CoL., and three cases of Coca-CoL..

Jesica established her business a little bit at a time because she did not have enough capital to buy merchandise wholesale. Despite this setback, she did not lose hope and continued to pursue her dream of having a well-stocked store where she could sell in bulk. She wants to take advantage of the fact that she is single and can work peacefully without any other worries for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, disposable cups, and mineral water.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es padre de familia de 25 años, vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposae hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Reque a unos 15 minutos de distrito de provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan Carlos  se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cuyes), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con alfalfa.  Posteriormente los vende una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos y obtener cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado es de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra de otros animales para que crie y después los oferte en el mercado y pueda tener mayores ganancias y poder cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  Juan Carlos siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y darle un poco de comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a 25 year-old father who lives in his in-laws' home together with his wife and children.  The only service their home has is electricity.  It is located in Reque district, some 15 minutes from Chiclayo province.  The main business activities in this district are farming and livestock raising.

Juan Carlos raises and sells farmyard animals (guinea pigs).  The pen where he keeps his animals is located out the back of his home.  He feeds them alfalfa.  When they have reached an optimum level of development, he sells them in the different markets in the city of Chiclayo so that he can increase his income and obtain things that his household needs.

Juan Carlos has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to buy more animals to raise and then sell in the market so that he can make more profits and cover his family obligations.  Juan Carlos has always known how to get ahead in order to improve in life and provide his family with a few comforts.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from the village of Silanga, Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Carmelita is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business raising fish to sell. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing nets to be used for fishing. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chemba, Provincia de Sofala, centro de Mocambique é viuva e mae de 2 filhos de 15 e 20 anos de idade todos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com os seus filhos .
Saiu de Chemba para Maputo devido a transferencia dos serviços onde ela esteve incorporada. Ė pensionista do Ministerio da Defesa ha mais de 11 anos e recebe 6.250.00mt por mês que depois de aplicar nas suas despesas familiares o resto poupa na sua conta bancaria mensalmente.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (varoês de ferro, cimento cola, barrotes e outros) para concluir a sua obra. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt para a habitaçao.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Filomena was born in Chemba District, Sofala Province in central Mozambique. She is a widow and has two children who are 15 and 20 years old. Both children go to school. Filomena only finished fourth grade and did not continue with school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her children.

She left Chemba to move to Maputo because of a work transfer. She has received a pension from the Ministry of Defense for more than 11 years and receives 6,250 meticais per month. After paying her household expenses, she saves the rest in her bank account every month.

Filomena has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution, and this is her third loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais, and she intends to buy construction materials (iron rods, adhesive, beams and other items) to finish her construction project. The earlier loans were for 10,000 meticais and 18,000 meticais, and they were for housing.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan with no problems, and she will ask for more loans to furnish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron rods, adhesive, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en:
Sam Oeurn (pictured with her loom) has been a weaver for more than twelve years. Her husband is a barber. He assists his wife to weave when he is free because he also knows how to weave. Sam Oeurn hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession business. So, she is asking for another loan of $500 USD to purchase weaving materials.
 
The couple has been married since 2004 and has one son and one daughter. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is a very hard-working man who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and practicing agriculture. He is the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing for their needs. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. 

Ilqar wishes to expand his business by purchasing calves and fodder for them. This is why he is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN.  He has a good client history with AqroInvest CU.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder for them

loans.name: Anita Alexandra

texts.es:
Anita es una mujer  trabajadora que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido tener una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Hace 15 años atrás ha trabajado para mejorar la vida de sus hijos a trabajado y a invertido dinero en víveres de primera necesidad para tener una tienda acorde a los requerimientos de sus clientes. 

Trabaja desde las 08h35 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, enlatados, granos, etc. En el futuro quiere seguir con su tienda y que su familia tenga buena salud.
texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking woman who with work and dedication has been able to have a small store in the back of her house. She has worked for 15 years to improve her children's lives and has invested money in basic necessity groceries to fill her customers' needs.  

She works from de 8:35 a.m. until  10:00 p.m. She aspires to a lot in her business and that is why she wants a loan to buy products of basic necessity such as rice, canned goods, grains, etc. In the future, she wants to continue with her store and for her family to be in good health..

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods and grains.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: El Sr. Saúl  desea terminar de construir  la barda de su domicilio, ya  que  anteriormente   tuvo  que  posponer  la construcción ya  que  no  contaba  con  el capital suficiente  para   concluir  con su proyecto, es  por  ello  que requiere de  nuestra  ayuda  para  terminar su proyecto,  agradece el apoyo  brindado por la institución para la realización de  su proyecto  ya que   ve  en el  crédito  la posibilidad   de  brindar   mayor  seguridad  a  su familia ya  que   tienen  un  pequeño  hijo   y  temen  de  que  alguien pueda  entrar  a  su  domicilio  y  puedan  hacer  algún  daño  tanto  a la  vivienda  como a  su pequeño.
texts.en:
Sr. Saúl wants to finish the construction of a wall around his home. He previously had to postpone the construction because he did not have enough capital to complete the job. For this reason, he is requesting assistance from Credituyo in order to finish the project.

Saúl is grateful for the support being provided to complete this job. He views this loan as a possibility for providing greater security for his family. Saúl has a young son and is concerned that someone could break into his house and do some damage to both his home and to his little one.

loans.use: to finish the construction of a security wall around his home.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married and has 12 children. She is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Wilma is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan for 14,999 to purchase corn fertilizer. 
Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 4 months. In the future, Wlma hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase corn fertilizer.

location.town: Ozamis-Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hija de 18 años de edad, es madre soltera, solamente su hija depende de ella, actualmente administra un comedor en el que ofrece varios menús, este negocio existe desde hace 16 años, para atenderlo cuenta con la ayuda de su hija.
Actualmente necesita comprar hierro, arena y cemento para terminar de construir la vivienda, otra parte quiere comprar productos para el comedor como gaseosas, jugos, carnes, aceite, esta inversión le ayudara para finalizar la construcción de la casa, contar con productos para el comedor que le permitan tener capacidad para atender la demanda.
El mayor sueño de Ana es tener su casa habitable, que por medio de esta ayuda podrá realizar, además de tener en el negocio todo lo necesario para atender a la clientela, y salir adelante con su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her 18-year-old daughter.  She is a single mother and only her daughter is dependent on her.  Ana currently runs an eatery where she offers several set menus.  She has had her business for 16 years and her daughter helps her serve in it.

Ana currently needs to buy iron, sand and cement in order to finish building her home.  She would also like to use part of her loan to buy products for her eatery such as soda, juice, meat and oil.  This investment will help her to finish building her home and have available the products she needs for her eatery.  This will allow her to meet the demand she has.

Ana's biggest dream is to have a habitable home which she will be able to achieve with the help of this loan.  She would also like to have everything she needs for her business in order to serve her customers, and to help her daughter make progress in her studies.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, meat, oil and building supplies

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn is 30 years old and a wife of a carpenter. They were blessed with four children, two of which are in school. With the help of a hog-fattening business, she is earning an income though she stays at home. This occupation provides allowances of her children as well as their daily expenses. 

With the aspiration to increase profit each time, she is asking for a loan in the amount of P5,000 to buy two more hogs and feed. This will make her work harder in order to make her hogs healthier and fatter. She hopes that with the help from Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc, she could improve her profit and upgrade their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a  la venta de ropa, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 7 años de edad, ella trabaja todos los días, visitando los pueblos y cantones cercanos ofreciendo la ropa, esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años y ha logrando mantenerse con sus clientes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones jeans, esta inversión le ayudara ya que sus clientes le demandaban estas prendas de vestir y espera que las ventas mejoren al igual que sus ganancias.
La aspiración de Rosa es crecer con la clientela y poseer un local propio de venta.
texts.en:
Rosa has a business selling clothing.  She lives with her husband and 7 year-old child.  She works every day, visiting the towns and nearby cantons offering her clothing for sale.  She has been doing this type of work for many years, and with her customers she has been able to support herself.  

Now she requests a loan to buy jeans.  This investment will help her because her customers are demanding this kind of garment.  She hopes that with this investment her sales will improve and she will have greater earnings.

Rosa aspires to grow her customer base, and to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy jeans for her business selling clothing

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fatima sigue laborando en zona franca, el cual ejerce como operaria, lugar donde lleva varios años trabajando, su hijo sigue creciendo, el cual le ha venido dando educacion sola, pero hoy en dia, tiene un compañero el cual labora como tornero, y esta en mejores condiciones moral y economica.
Ella tiene su cuarto aparte, y que ha venido mejorando sola, con los prestamo que Afodenic  ha dado. Lo que quiere hacer, con este nuevo financiamiento, es levantar las divisiones de concreto, ya que es de madera, aunque lo tiene bien adornado, pero ya esta muy viejo y se le hace incomodo ya. Es por tal razon comprara materiales de construccion en bloque, hierro, cemento, y hacer la mejora en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fatima continues to work in the free trade zone where she has a job as an operator. She has worked in this place for several years. As her son continues to grow, Fatima is the only one providing for his education. Today she has a companion who works as a lathe operator. He provides both moral and financial support.

Fatima has a separate room, which was the only improvement that was undertaken with the loan given to her by AFODENIC. With this new loan, she will put up concrete room dividers since the current ones are made of wood. Although they are well-decorated, the dividers are very old and make her house uncomfortable. For this reason, she will buy construction materials such as blocks, iron, and cement, so that she can make this improvement to her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for putting up concrete room dividers.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 27 years old and has three children. She is running a small shop that sells fruit. She earns 3,500,000 VND in profits from her shop. Joining in our credit program in 2009, she has received four loans and used them to expand her shop. To meet the extra demand of customers, she wants to borrow  9,184,000 VND to buy more kinds of fruit to attract customers to come.

loans.use: to buy  fruits to sell in retail

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Irma,tiene 5 en edad escolar hijos  es casada  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desD. hace 1 año y 8 meses, junto al grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad”, grupo conformado por 8  personas  que pusieron este nombre con el deseo D. prosperar. Irma  trabaja Alquilando combis desD. hace 7años este trabajo surge porque elL. deseaba darle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  ha logrado tener  4 combis propias que le ha permitido tener mayor  ingresos y así darles a sus hijos una mejor educación  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para dar mantenimiento a sus combis. Sabemos que Irma  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos  D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Irma has five school aged children.  She’s married and has been working with Edaprospo for a year and 8 months in the “Prosperidad y Amistad” (Prosperity and Friendship) group which has 8 members; they named it that because they wish to prosper.

Irma has been working leasing minivans for 7 years.  The business arose from her desire to proviD. a better quality of life for her children.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication she’s managed to acquire four minivans of her own that have led to higher income and she’s been able to proviD. her children with a better education.  In order to continue to grow, she’s asking for a new loan to service her minivans.  We know that Irma will reach her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo’s loans will help her.

loans.use: to service her minivans.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 51 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Julita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julita has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from selling rice and travelling sales of vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a thirty-six year old married lady with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. The family goal is to educate her children. She has been running a boutique of traditional wear for fifteen years which she started with capital of two hundred thousand shillings and now has capital of three million shillings. 

The challenges she is facing are high fuel and transportation costs, and taxes, however, she has a goal of hiring employees to help expand business and buying land to grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy clothes for resale

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Agueda Candelaria

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a La señora Agueda, tiene 55 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene seis hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive un nieto de 10 años que es como su hijo y que estudia en escuela. El esposo ya no trabaja es jubilado.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, trabaja  todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, vende de todo desde productos de primera necesidad hasta artículos de papelería y bazar, además de  tarjetas telefónicas entre otras cosas, trabaja con la ayuda de su nieto y su esposo cuando él puede, sus productos compra en Portoviejo. Lleva con su tienda por más de 18 años y  es su forma de ganarse la vida. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad, artículos de papelería y tarjetas telefónicas para surtir más su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque no piden tantos papeles para realizar los créditos. 

Sus sueños son ver que su nieto sea un buen profesional y seguir creciendo cada día más en su negocio.
texts.en:
The 6 de Julio Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Los Arenales in Crucita Parish in Portoviejo. The place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited by tourists from within the country and abroad. The region has many beautiful locales and a rich variety of typical dishes. 

Here we meet Sra. Agueda, 55, who has a common law partner and six adult children. A 10 year old grandson lives with her. He is in school and is like a son to her. Her husband is retired and does not work.

She has a store in her house and works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. She sells everything, from essential goods to stationary supplies, as well as telephone cards among other things. She runs her store with the help of her grandson and her husband, when he is able. She buys her products in Portoviejo. She has had her store for more than 18 years and it is her way of making a living.

She will use this loan to purchase basic supplies, stationery and telephone cards to stock her store. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because it does not require a lot of paperwork to take out loans.

Her dreams are to see her grandson become a good professional and to continue seeing her business expand.

loans.use: to buy essential goods, stationery supplies and telephone cards.

loans.name: Las Responsables 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Celia is one of the members from the group Las Responsables 2, 4 & 5 (The Responsible). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her 4 children and their father. She is a hardworking woman and helps her family by bringing in extra incoming.

Celia is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She has had her business for 8 years, starting with her own saving after worked in different jobs. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing shoes. She sells her product by walking and from her home.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to buy cloths and shoes for her children, so they can have a good Christmas. This group located in one of the Bateyes from La Romana, all this members are mainly Haitians. Bateyes are rural area surrounded by sugarcane fields.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, 26, is married, resides with his wife and child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites such as the ancient temples Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey. He and his wife are construction workers.

Soeurn is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to purchase a plot of land to build a new house to live in. In the future, he would like to raise pigs at home and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to build a new house

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 66 years old and married with 3 children. He has been building rental houses for the last six years, earning a monthly income from rent of 20,000 KES.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET of 30,000 KES. He plans to use the funds to purchase building materials, such as timber, for construction of houses. With the anticipated profits, he will increase the number of rental units.

His hopes and dreams are to develop new rental units every year.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as timber

loans.name: Ingris Cecilia

texts.es: Ingris tiene 46 años de edad que vive con su compañero de vida  y su hija de 5 años de edad que es su mayor alegría, todos viven en casa propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de maíz, desde hace 10 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz, de poder llevar el sustento a su hogar, gracias a su negocio, por lo que ella ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz por mayor para su venta y de esta manera continuar mejorando sus ganancias. Con el crédito anterior Ingris invirtió en su negocio, por lo que cada día logra solventar los pedidos de sus clientes, que cada vez son más.
texts.en:
Ingris is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her 5-year-old daughter who is her greatest joy. She is a hardworking woman who makes a living selling corn, which she has done for 10 years. She is very happy to be able to provide for her family, thanks to her business.

Ingris has decided to apply for a loan through FUSAI to invest in wholesale maize to sale and thus further improve her earnings. With her previous loan she invested in her business so she was able to fulfill all of her customers orders, which are increasing more and more.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale to sell and thus continue increasing her earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and supply organic banana seeds to peasant farmers to grow bananas for export.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina lives in Pokuase, Accra, Ghana. She sells secondhand clothing from house to house. She wants to expand her sales by buying clothing in bulk, by the bale. She is asking for a loan of $800.00 from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase raw materials and to pay suppliers. She would also like to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tomato-selling business

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: A mother of two children and aged 34 years old, Vera hails from Benin City in Edo State. She sells provisions in her community. Mrs. Vera O. has been able to send her two children to school. She is a LAPO leader in one of the unions. She is looking forward to getting this loan of $550 to improve her business and buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
I. Ramil was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory the Fizuli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city. He is 29 years old, married and a father of 3 children. His father and mother live with him. His parents are old. Therefore he is the only breadwinner of his family. He started his business in 2004. He sells perfumes, creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo. His friend helps him at this work. With this business he earns little money. The money is only enough for  some of his family's basic needs. 

He needs $700 to buy silver goods and merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and be able to offer his clients a bigger variety and quality. He is able to support his family’s expenses with this income. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He believes that you will help him in this business.

loans.use: To buy silver goods and merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and be able to offer his clients a bigger variety and quality

loans.name: Abigirl

texts.en: Abigirl I. is 42 years old, married with 4 children, and hails from the town of Ubanmu in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells all kinds of fruit. She has been in business since 2003 and a LAPO member since 2004. She is requesting a loan to enable her buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn S., 44, is a widow and cooks food to sell to supplement the family's income, as well as cooking for her four employed children. Two children are laborers and two are waitresses. Mrs. Phorn S. is pictured with one of her sons.

She requests a loan of $500 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. If she no longer has to pay for all her children’s transportation to work, she will be able to build up her family’s savings.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to save on the cost of her family's transportation

loans.name: Upper Kawugab(2061) C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Amina Z.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothing and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to increase her inventory. Amina is 30 years old and is married. She has 2 children who are 3 and 10 years old. Both go to school. Each week, Amina makes approximately UGX 40,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land and build a house.

Amina is joined in her small group by Margret N., Faridah N., Sulayina N., and Oliver M.. Margret N. is currently in the business of running a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to increase her stock. Faridah N. is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more shoes for sale. Sulayina N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her charcoal business. Oliver M. is currently in the business of running a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to increase the stock in her canteen shop.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Kireka A6 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty N.. She is currently in the business of selling snacks and is requesting a loan to change to a more durable business. Betty is 35 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children aged 14 and 16, and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Aminah N., Dinah N., Barbara N., and Miriam N.. Aminah N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase food warmers. Dinah N. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to increase stock. Barbara N. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more furniture. Miriam N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To start up another business

loans.name: Ngum

texts.en:
Born in 1968, C. is married and has no children. She regrets the fact that she is not having a baby. The loss of her brother and uncle greatly put her in hardship since they were so supportive to her. During this period of great emotional and economic hardship she heard about GHAPE. She was determined to help her sisters and other family members. With the profit she made from her past EC activities, she bought some kitchen utensils for herself and also paid the fees of her sister's child whom she took upon to stay with them. Given a loan she plans to expand her hair dressing saloon and also do trading and mixed farming.

She will repay her loan in 24months and her first installment repayment shall be done from the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of salon equipment  and seedlings

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Khin P. is 34 years old. She earns 1 US$ per day as a mostly subsistence farmer in Kampong Cham province.
