Her husband works a few hours away in the capital city of Phnom Penh as a hotel security officer. Pheng Vy earns 2 US$ per day. They only have one child together who is still very young and will not enter school for another couple years. Khin P. has been able to manage her farm well and wants to buy more land to grow more rice and thereby expand her income.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
In the city of Yaguarón, 15 km. from our Paraguarí branch, a group of women with a desire to undertake productive activities and others to increase their income came together. From there they contacted us to find out more about the program and accepted the program for the many benefits it offers.

The group is called “La Fortaleza” and it is in its forth cycle with an excellent record and is made up of 16 working women.

In the hopes of continuing to grow and to increase their sales, the women use the loans to invest in their businesses. Today they are asking for a new loan to invest in their respective activities such as the purchase of fabric, thread, meat, drinks, oil, noodles, rice, flour, dairy products, bread products, accessories for their stores, sheets, fruits and vegetables in general, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km. de la oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de emprender actividades productivas y otras para aumentar su capital de trabajo, de ahí que se pusieron en contacto con nosotros para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por los múltiples beneficios que presenta.

El comité lleva por nombre La Fortaleza, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 16 trabajadoras mujeres.

En miras de seguir creciendo y aumentar sus ventas ellas utilizan los créditos para invertir en sus negocios. Ellas hoy están solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en sus respectivas actividades como son la compra de tela, hilo, carne, bebidas, aceite, fideo, arroz, harina, lácteos, panificados, accesorios para mercería, sábanas, frutas y verduras en general, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, meat, drinks, oil, noodles, rice, flour, dairy products, bread products, accessories for their stores, sheets, fruits and vegetables in general, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To bulk-buy women's clothing to keep operating a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of shoes and pants to expand her small business.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat G. is 44 years old and married with four children. She is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. Saidat lives in Ijanikin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Saidat has been selling kerosene in her shop for a long time. The demand for her kerosene is high, and she wants to meet the demands of her customers.

Saidat is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more kerosene to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cerro Real de Caacupé, la mayoria de las integrantes realizan actividades comerciales como ser, ventas de bebidas, de ropas, algunas tienen despensa, etc. Todas son vecinas y en algunas oportunidades se ayudan mutuamente para poder comercializar sus productos.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 3er ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiada con un crédito promedio de gs. 580.000 cada integrantes.

El comité se inició gracias a que la actual presidenta la señora Lourdes C. se entero que un pariente de ella es integrante de un comité y así se puso en contacto con el oficial de comité de la Fundación Paraguya, Freddy Bordón quienes le informo de los requisitos para formar un comités y rápidamente lograron reunir y así se formo el comité Cristo Rey.

La señora Lourdes comenta que además de ser compañeras dentro del comités también ellas trabajan juntas realizando actividades con la finalidad de recaudar fondos para ayudar al club de futbol local a poder cubrir los numerosos gastos que representa competir en el torneo interno de la ciudad.

Con los prestamos que recibieron de la Fundación Paraguaya pudieron comprar, gran cantidad de de mercaderías como galleta, azúcar, leche, bebidas de todo tipo, ropas usadas, materia prima para la elaboración de dulces de todo tipo.

A continuación se detallan las actividades por integrante: Lourdes C. – Venta de ropas

Mirian O.- Venta de bebidas

Gladys C.- Venta de dulce y frutas

Teresa A. – Depensa (No se encuentra en la foto por tema laboral)

- Lourdes C.- Vendedora ambulante

- Maria E. –Despensa

Teresa G.- Venta de ropas usadas

- Albina S.-Despensa

- Geronima B.- Despensa

Ramona N.- Kiosko (No se encuentra en la foto por tema laboral)

- Claudia S.-Despensa

- Maria A.- Viverista

Maria S.- Venta de Bebidas

Matilde O.-Despensa (No se encuentra en la foto por tema laboral)

- Alicia R.– Venta de dulce
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 15 hard working women from Cerro Real de Caacupé. The majority of the members sell items commercially, such as beverages, clothing, some have stores, etc. All are neighbors and when they can they help each other by buying each other’s products. Today the group is in its 3rd cycle of the committee program “Mujeres Emprendoras” and they are benefitting from an average loan of gs. 580.000 each. The committee began thanks to the current president Lourdes C., when she ofund out a relative of her was a member of a committee and put her in contact with the committee official of the Fundación Paraguya, Freddy Bordón, who told them about the requirements to form a committee and quickly they were able to meet and form their own committee called “Cristo Rey.” Lourdes comments that in addition to being friends with the committee they also work together completing activities with the objective of raising funds to help the local soccer club covers its numerous expenses related to competing in the city tournaments. With loans that they received from the Fundación Paraguaya they were able to buy a great quantity of merchandise such as cookies, sugar, milk, all kinds of beverages, used clothing, raw ingredients to make candy. Below is additional information about each member’s work: Lourdes C. – Sells clothing Mirian O. – Sells beverages Gladys C. – Sells candy and fruit Teresa A. – Has a store (she is not in the photo because of work) Lourdes C. – Street vendor Maria E. – Has a store Teresa G. – Sells used clothing Albina S. – Has a store Geronima B. – Has a store Ramona N. - Kiosk (she is not in the photo because of work) Claudia S. – Has a store Maria A. - Sells plants

Maria S. – Sells beverages Matilde O. – Has a store (she is not in the photo because of work) Alicia R. – Sells candy

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soda pop, meat, noodles, tea, sugar, cookies, milk, used clothing, ingredients to make candy, etc.

loans.name: Sohibjamol

texts.ru: Гуломова Сохибджамол жительница района Гиссар.Возраст 42 года,замужем,имеет 4 детей.Клиентка имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке.Она закупает у оптовых поставщиков женскую одежду и реализует ее в розницу.На прибыль от торговли содержит семью.На кредит планирует закупить товар ,погасит кредит в тчении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sohibjamol G. resides in the Gissar region. 42-years-old, and married with four children, she has a small trade outlet in the local market. She purchases women's clothing wholesale and sells it retail. With the profit from this trade Sohibjamol supports her family. She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to purchase merchandise, and will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Сафарова Шодигуль жительница района Хуросон. Возраст 49 лет. Имеет очень большую семью. Замужем и имеет восьмерых детей.  Уже семь лет занимается животноводством. Занимается перепроджажей крупно рогатого скота. В данный момент хочет увеличить поголовье скота , путем покупки породистого бычка. Для этого она планирует получить кредит  сроком на 18 месяцев. Таким образом она наладит свой бизнес и даст возможность развивать дело.
texts.en:
Shodigul S. lives in the Huroson District. She is 49 years old. Her family is very large; she is married and has eight children. For the past seven years she has been raising livestock. She finishes - buys, fattens, and resells - cattle. Now she wants to increase the number of animals by buying a pure-bred bull calf. To do that she decided to take out an 18-month loan. This will improve her business and help her to further develop it.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a pure-bred calf

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is 49 years old and married with five children.  Two of her children have completed senior high school.  Joyce has owned her own business producing and supplying palm oil to wholesale dealers for the last five years.  She buys the palm fruits from the surrounding villages, where prices are quite economical.  Joyce intends to expand her business in order to meet the increasing demand of her customers by producing the oil in bulk.  

She believes that with the loan she can increase her profit margin and help her husband take very good care of their children.  Joyce is a member of the group called “Kristo Tease” (meaning, Christ lives) Trust Group in her community. In this group, the members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To expand palm oil business

loans.name: Apédo

texts.fr: Mr A. Apédo est né en 1968 à Gapé-Centre. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il a cessé les études et se lance très tôt dans de petites activités génératrices de revenus en achetant un meule pour aiguiser les houes et les coupe-coupe de ses frères agriculteurs dans la localité moyennant quelques sous insignifiants. Manquant de moyens, il n’arrive pas à développer son activité, ce qui le pousse à solliciter un crédit pour acheter une nouvelle machine. Actif et honnête, il tient toujours à ses promesses. Cette machine une fois achetée lui permettra d’avoir un rendement meilleur et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Apédo A. was born in 1968 in Gapé-Centre. He is married and has five children. He left school early and began working at small income-generating jobs, buying a grindstone to sharpen the hoes and machetes of the neighbouring farmers, making only a pittance. Because of a lack of money, he is unable to expand his business which is why he is asking for a loan to buy a new grinding machine. He is active and honest and always keeps his promises. Once he buys the new machine, he will be more productive and be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grindstone

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky D. is a vendor in the distant village of Cabisera 14-16 of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Angelito D., who maintains their small farm lot and sometimes works as a hired farm laborer in their village. They have a five-year-old daughter named Abegail, who is currently attending a day care center. Her small, happy and organized family serves as Vicky's motivation to work harder in order to attain success.

Vicky runs a smoked fish vending business. She is requesting a loan of $100 to expand this business. She will buy different varieties of vegetables, meats, and snacks at wholesale prices in the public market, which is far from her village. It does not matter to her even when she needs to ride a passenger jeep (which is rarely available) in order to reach the public market because the price there is cheaper. She has to sacrifice for the sake of her family.

From her daily income, Vicky wants to save for the future education of her daughter. Therefore, she is praying that her loan request will somehow be granted in order for her dreams to come true.

loans.use: To expand her fish business with vegetables, meats, and snacks

loans.name: Naseem Allah Rakha Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is 30 years old, married, and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Her husband is A. R., and he works in a factory. Naseem baji is the mother of three sons. All of her sons are free and don’t do anything. Naseem baji has been selling warm clothes for the past five years. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more warm clothes to sell. 

Naseem baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Maryam baji and Naseem baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling businesses. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Another Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy warm clothes

loans.name: Kholmamad

texts.en: I. Kholmamad has raised cattle and farmed for 11 years. With two children and the responsibility of providing food for his home, has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today Kholmamad finds himself in need of purchasing calves to raise in order to take greatest advantage of raising and selling them when necessary. For this reason, Kholmamad is requesting loans from IMON International in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after the country’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El Sr. jose Angel R. se dedica a la venta de articulos de plastico como ser baldes, pailas, ganchos, rayadores, canastas y otros, dicha actividad la realiza hace varios años y tiene su puesto de ventas en el mercado nacional de la ciudad capital, el tiene bastante demanda con los articulos que vende y tiene mucha variedad lo que le ayuda a tener muy buenas ventas. el tiene que viajar para comprar su producto y por eso es que necesita el credito para comprar mucha mercaderia y asi no tener que invertir dinero en gastos de viaje, ademas que comprando el producto por grandes cantidades es mas barato y se tienen mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Angel R. sells plastic items like buckets, hangers, graters, baskets, and so on. He has been doing this for several years and has a stand in a large market in the capital city. There is substantial demand for the merchandise he sells; moreover, he has a lot of variety, which helps his merchandise sell well. He has to travel to buy his products; consequently, he is asking for a loan so that he can buy a lot of merchandise at once and thus save on travel expenses and pay less by buying in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various plastic items

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Бобожонова 1985 года рождения, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Но имея высшего образования по специальности устроиться не  смогла, вышла замуж. Муж на работу не пускал, но не смотря на невзгоды она с ним разошлась. Ее родственница пожалела и дала на некоторую сумму товара. Со временем она расплатилась с родственницей  и на первый кредит открыла свою лавку.
texts.en:
Firuza B. was born in 1985, she is married and has 2 children. She has a college education. But having a higher education she could not find a job in her field and got married. Her husband did not let her work, but despite the misery she separated from him. Her relative took pity on her and gave her a quantity of products to sell. With time she paid back her relative and used her first loan to open a shop.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand assortment

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La señora Otilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas de Oro” del Distrito de Puno, en la  provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 66 años de edad, es Viuda y tiene 6 hijos. Ella no tiene  estudios. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, ella tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite) su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar mas abarrotes, (arroz, leche, aceite.  Le gustaría tener una tienda grande y muy surtida.

La señora Otilia nos refiere que le gustan las reuniones y la facilidad de pago que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Otilia is a member of the communal bank “Palomas de Oro (Doves of Gold)” in the District of Puno, Province of Puno, region of Puno. She is 66 years old, widowed, and has six children. She does not have an education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 4 years. She has a business selling groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, oil). Her first loan was for 300 PEN.

She currently desires a loan of an additional 700 PEN which will serve her to buy more groceries (rice, milk, oil). She would like to have a larger, better stocked store.

Mrs. Otilia tells us that she enjoys the meetings and the ease of paying that Manuela Ramos offers.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, rice, oil, canned goods, eggs

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo con señoras con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con la ayuda crediticia que será otorgada por La Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas cuentan con trabajos propios y luchan día a día para ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a la familia.  Las mismas tienen el deseo de invertir el crédito en su trabajo esto les facilitara con una herramienta para mejorar sus negocios. 

Este grupo de señoras se unierón con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida atravez de la formación grupo solidario y están dispuestas a ayudarse, cada una tiene una responsabilidad que asumen de manera conjunta, son personas humildes y muy trabajadoras, poseen el espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de progresar conjuntamente.- Algunas señoras llevan un monto de 500.000gs. Otras un  monto de 300.000 gs. 

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:  

Blanca Rosa G. - 	Almacen
Yeni Ramona B. - 	Carnicería Despensa
Enriqueta Catalina P. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Epifania B. Mereles - 	Panadería
Maura I.	-  Vendedora Ambulante-Vendedora de Planteras
Eugenia B. Insfrán - 	Almacén
Graciela A.	-  Copetín
Graciela F. - 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Teodora López	-  Almacén
Virginia C.	 - Vendedora ambulante de comestibles
Benita G. - 	Kiosko
Marta M.	-  Carbonería
Virginia M. - 	Venta de Ropas Interiores
Eleria S. - 	Venta de Ajos
Maria del Rosario I. - 	Venta de Mandioca y Verduras
Miguelina López	-  Venta de Ropas
Lorenza López	-  Venta de Ropas Usadas
Blanca Beatriz M. - 	Vendedora de Cubiertos
Florentina Muñoz - 	Vendedora Ambulante de Frutas y Verduras
texts.en:
This group is formed by women driven to continue working with the financial support of Fundación Paraguaya. Each of the women has her own job and fights day after day to earn money to sustain her family. They also wish to invest credit in their work as a tool to improve their businesses. This group of women came together with the aim of improving their quality of life through a solidarity group. They are willing to help one another, and each has joint responsibilities. They are humble, hardworking people with an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to progress together. Some seek a loan of 500,000 PYG; others, 300,000 PYG. The members and their activities are: Blanca Rosa G. - Grocery store Yeni Ramona B. - Butcher's shop Enriqueta Catalina P. - Clothing sales Epifania B. Mereles - Bakery Maura I. - Door-to-door planter sales Eugenia B. Insfrán - Grocery store Graciela A. - Snack bar Graciela F. - Fruit and vegetable sales Teodora López - Grocery store Virginia C. - Door-to-door grocery sales Benita G. - Kiosk Marta M. - Fuel sales Virginia M. - Underwear sales Eleria S. - Garlic sales Maria del Rosario I. - Cassava and vegetable sales Miguelina López - Clothing sales Lorenza López - Used clothing sales Blanca Beatriz M. - Cutlery sales Florentina Muñoz - Door-to-door fruit and vegetable sales

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door-to-door vendors: more products to sell--fruits, vegetables, merchandise, etc.; Dressmakers: fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Yaye  Seynabou

texts.fr: yaye seynabou M. est membre de la mutuelle depuis sept ans ;elle est cuisinière à l'hopital régional de thiès ,parallèlement à son travail ,elle fait du commerce qui consiste à acheter des tissus et des produits divers qu'elle revend à ses collègues;avec la somme qu'elle demande,elle envisage de renforcer son stock de marchandises avant l'arrivée de l'hivernage
texts.en:
Yaye Seynabou M. has been a member of the credit union for 7 years; she is a cook at the regional hospital in Thiès. Besides this work, she buys cloth and various products that she re-sells to her colleagues. With the amount she is requesting, she means to expand her stock of merchandise before the beginning of the rainy season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Las Mujeres Capacitadas Group

texts.en:
Justa V. is 37 years old and is the coordinator for the Women of Ability microfinance group in Puerta Barrabas, Dominican Republic. She is a single mother and lives at home with her one child, Yeseña.

Justa owns her house from which she cooks and sells food. Among other recipes, she is particularly proud of her pollo frito (fried chicken) and chichaharon, a popular pork dish in Latin America.

With the two loans she has already received and paid back, Justa has been able to buy more ingredients and has recently purchased a larger stove, leading to higher profits. She has only recently been able to make ends meet and pay her bills, thanks in large part to the loans she has been taking from Esperanza. Over the past year, she has improved her lifestyle with a wage that allows her to think past day-to-day subsistence and plan for her family’s future.

Ultimately, Justa would like to open her own restaurant in Puerta Plata. In the short run, she will improve the business in her own home by purchasing increasing amounts of inventory and upgrading her equipment. Your contribution will give her the means to realize these aspirations. Thanks for your consideration.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food and upgraded cooking equipment

loans.name: Pauline Arame

texts.fr: Pauline Arame T., 39 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants en charge. Son activité est la vente  de bananes. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son capital. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline Arame T., age 39, is married and has nine children to support. Her business involves selling bananas. She is requesting a loan to boost her capital. The revenues from her commerce will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in bananas

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy M., a 34-year-old self-employed woman, is a researcher by profession. Equipped with computers and a photocopying machine, she helps students with their research. Cissy has been doing this business for nine years now and is requesting the loan to purchase more computers, tables and chairs to accommodate more students.  She has two children whom she hopes to educate through to university.

loans.use: To purchase more computers, tables and chairs to accommodate more students.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina S. is from the village of Barra,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Felomina is married. To make a living, Felomina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Felomina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felomina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felomina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Felomina is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Felomina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor Marina C. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Apopa, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. DesD. hace un año, Flor puso su propia tienda en su casa, en ella comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual ella pueda invertir más en su negocio, ya que debido a su poco tiempo, le faltan más productos y es este uno D. los mayores deseos D. Flor, poder surtir su negocio para percibir mejores ganancias y poder mejorar la economía D. su familia.

loans.use: Compra de más productos

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs in retail to her customers within her community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time.

Patricia hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
M. Moustapha T. est le propriétaire d'une boutique de vente et réparation de portables à Ouakam, Dakar.  
“Je suis dans l'électronic depuis le bas age, je répare des radios, téléviseurs et autres et c'est-ce qui m'a permis d'entrer dans le milieu de la vente et réparation de portables.”
Ce crédit est le cinquième prêt d'U-IMCEC pour M. T..  Avec le crédit, il voudrait acheter les nouveaux portables et accessoires pour bien satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.  Il est marié avec trois enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Moustapha T. is the owner of a shop selling and repairing mobile phones in Ouakam, Dakar. “I have been in electronics since I was young. I repair radios, televisions, and more. And this has enabled me to enter into the field of selling and repairing cell phones.” This loan is the fifth U-IMCEC loan for Mr. T.. With this loan, he would like to buy new cell phones and accessories to satisfy the demands of his customers well. He is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his stock of mobile phones an accessories

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: A. Akouélé est née en 1959 et est mariée à NADOHOUENOU Damien, un chauffeur poids lourds. Le couple a quatre enfants et vit au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, il y a de cela 6 mois. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Akouélé n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. C'est depuis 22 ans que Akouélé vend du charbon de bois et des fagots de bois qu'elle livre à domicile. Akouélé s'approvisionne à Sêto au Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour accroître davantage son fonds de roulement et faire face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle, Akouélé sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouélé A. was born in 1959 and is married to Damien NADOHOUENOU, a truck driver. The couple has four children and has been living in the Fidjrossè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for six months. All four children attend school and live with their parents. The couple supports the family together. Akouélé never attended school and, for 22 years, has been selling charcoal and bundles of firewood that she home delivers. She gets her supplies in Sêto in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, and already benefited from two loans which were repaid without problems. In order to bolster her working capital and meet high customer demand, Akouélé is seeking another loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El joven José Luís García, desde hace diez años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, el rubro que mas cultiva es la piña, gracias al apoyo de su abuela que le heredo una parte de las tierras donde actualmente tiene la producción, la mayor afectación que presenta son las plagas y enfermedades por la falta de fertilizantes e insumos que requiere para poder estar en buen estado, si logra aplicar todos los fertilizantes va a tener un cultivo el cual va a tener calidad y tamaño para poder ser vendido en un mejor precio en el M., a la vez  poder pagar el préstamo y con las ganancias ir poco a poco mejorando las condiciones de vida , él habita en un barrio pobre de la comarca San Ignacio , juntos a sus abuelos , los planes futuros es poder construir su casa y después hacer una familia con su actual novia , la cual labora como comerciante en el M. de Masaya . Agradece a Afodenic que a través de los fondos Kiva, son muchos los agriculturas que se benefician y logran mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
José Luís García has been doing agricultural work for ten years. He mostly plants pineapple, thanks to his grandmother’s support. She gave him part of the land where he now has his production. The biggest problems are the plagues and diseases from the lack of fertilizers and supplies that he needs to be able to keep them in good condition. If he is able to apply all of the fertilizer, he will have a good crop. It will be of good quality and size to be able to be sold at a better price in the market. He will be able to repay the loan, and with the earnings he will be improving his living conditions little by little. He lives with his grandparents in a poor neighborhood in the San Ignacio region. His future plans are to be able to build a house and later have a family with his present girlfriend. She works as a merchant in the Masaya market. He is grateful to Afodinic, who through Kiva funds, has helped so many farmers improve their crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and supplies for his crops to get good quality fruit production

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells groceries, foodstuffs and clothes. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She is 36 years old and married with four children. Joy is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Bertha Gumercinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Bertha Gumercinda H. O. de 46 años de edad vive en su casa propia con su hija de 17 años de edad en Calle Luren – Cercado de Ica.
Se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y otros productos de consumo masivo. Su negocio funciona en su domicilio. Tiene en el giro como 5 años y gracias a su trabajo esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado obtener sus bienes y darle una educación a su hija quien se encuentra preparándose para postular a la universidad. 
La Sra. goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es bien trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella desea que le apoyemos para invertir mas en su negocio poder comprar panteones y otros por campaña navideña y así obtener un ingreso adicional que le permitirá apoyar a su hija en la inscripción para su postulación ya que su mayor sueño es que su hija sea profesional y pueda encontrar un trabajo que le ayude a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Bertha Gumercinda H. O. is 46. She lives in her own house with her 17 year old daughter. They live on Luren – Cercado Street in Ica. She sells sweets, soft drinks, and other popular consumption products. Her business is in her home. She has been doing this for five years. Thanks to her work, effort, and dedication she has obtained her belongings and paid for her daughter’s education. Her daughter is preparing to apply to the university. She has good references from her neighbors who say she is enterprising and very hard-working. She wants us to help her invest more in her business. She wants to be able to buy “panteones” (Christmas cakes) and other things for the Christmas season. That way she will get an additional income that will allow her to help her daughter in her enrollment. Her greatest wish is that her daughter become a professional and be able to find work that will help her succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Adama Djiby

texts.fr: Adama Djibi B. est une femme agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié à 4 fois de suite de crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Adama Djibi B. is a 35-year-old woman, married and mother of six children. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of SIWAL for two years, and has been granted four successive loans. Her activity is fattening cattle, and the income generated allows her to share in the support of her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her activity of fattening cattle

loans.name: Kalykova Ulmas' Group

texts.en: K. Ulmas, 46, is the leader of this group. She is widow with one married daughter who lives with her husband and is a housewife. Ulmas’ main source income is raising livestock. When her husband died, she needed to deal with something to earn money to earn a living. Frankly she didn’t have much choice. The best occupation was raising livestock and she bought one lamb for KGS 600 and later a calf, and so on. At the present time she has two cows, two calves and two sheep. Besides this business, she has a little shop where she sells tea, cigarettes, candles, etc. Due to her hard work she was able to accomplish all this! Ulmas’ loan will be used to buy six or seven lambs which she plans to sell later at a higher price. Her annual income from her livestock business is approximately $50 per month. Muhabbat, 50, is the mother of five children. Four of them are working and the youngest daughter goes to school. Currently Muhabbat is a housewife, but mostly she spent her time during the last few months opening a vendor kiosk in a shipping container, investing money that she received from her elder sons. She will use this loan to buy goods for her new kiosk. This kiosk is located near her house and it is very comfortable. Shakirjon, 48, is married. He sells secondhand goods and his wife helps him in his business. He has a son, who is a builder, and three daughters. He needs a loan to increase the turnover of his family business. He usually buys secondhand goods, including clothes, in the city and sells them in nearby villages. He has been in this business for fifteen years. Mahirahon is 50 years old and is divorced with three daughters. Her eldest daughter is married and the others go to school. Her daughters cook meals at home and sell them in the market to local traders. Mahirahon has a small business in the clothes trade. She will use this loan to increase her assortment of goods and prepare for the upcoming spring season. This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy six or seven lambs

loans.name: Allamurod

texts.en:
I. Allamurod is 41 years old. He is married and the father of four children. Allamurod is a hard-working and enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields. Allamurod needs tools and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of 6000 Somoni. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Allamurod!  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Las Peras Group

texts.es:
Las Peras es un grupo unido, trabajador, esforzado y con el deseo de seguir adelante. La coordinadora es la señora Silvia Elena López B. quien inicio su negocio con venta de sopa ya sean de res, mondongo, pollo, hueso, cola, queso….etc. los domingos con lo cual pudo crear un pequeño capital para invertir en una comideria. 

Los otros integrantes son Miriam A. tiene una fritanga, Fátima Solórzano vende cosméticos y Cruz Alfonso L. R. vende ropa.
texts.en:
Las Peras is a united, vigorous and hardworking group with the desire to progress. The coordinator is Mrs. Silvia who started her business selling soup, such as beef, tripe, bone, beef tail or cheese soup, on Sundays. With this business she was able to create some capital to be used to invest in an eatery. The other members are Miriam, who has a fried food shop, Fatíma, who sells cosmetics and Crux, who sells clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is happy with her business. She sells pepper soup, drinks and sachet water. Her peak time for business is in the evenings when her customers leave their jobs and they relax and chat in her restaurant. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She needs a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. 

She is 55 years old and married with seven children. Some of her children are graduates and the others are married. Her husband sells building materials. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise W.g. Group

texts.en:
R. Juliet is a 53 year old widow with six school-going children.

For the last three years, Juliet has been selling cows to earn a living in Ntungamo district in western Uganda. Her main drawback in the course of doing this business has been the unstable prices of cattle. With a determined resolve and efficient customer care skills, she has managed to keep her business going. In a month, Juliet says she makes profits to the tune of 90,000 shillings.

Juliet’s future plans are to fully expand her cattle farm and to pay for her children’s university education. With this loan, she anticipates great strides in achieving this dream.

loans.use: To restock her cattle farm with more cows.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en: Rosenie P.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Cogon, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. Rosenie is just starting this business. In 2010, Rosenie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosenie is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Damacline

texts.en:
Damacline is 21 years old and is single.  She has been running a salon where she also sells beauty products for one year. She is also employed as a baby-sitter in a nursery. She was previously working as a home-help. 


She joined Hongera group in Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access financial support.  She wants to take out her first loan from Faulu Kenya.  She wants to add stock of braids, cosmetics, lotions, chemicals and weaves.  She hopes to open up a wholesale cosmetics shop in the future.  She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of braids, cosmetics, lotions, chemicals and weaves

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia C., already widowed at 56, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so that her four children can have a better life. To that end, Nelia has been managing her own rug-making business for quite some time now.

Nelia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used her previous loan money to expand and improve her rug-making business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of additional capital to buy raw materials and supplies needed for her business. She dreams that her business will continue to grow. Nelia wants to be able to buy her own place where she can run her business and sell her products.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buying raw materials and supplies needed for rug-making.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Determined B. Milton is a happily married father of eight children. Like any other responsible man, he devised means of how best he would satisfy his family’s requirements. He started up a farm, rearing cattle in his home area of Kakuuto, Ibanda, with a variety of cows on his farm which makes his business more attractive.

Milton’s business has been generating him profits to the tune of 150,000 shillings a week. With this project, he has been able to capture a good market from other farmers and butchery owners. His main setback has been having a small stock. Therefore he hopes to restock and also modernize his farming system and also de-worm his animals on acquiring this loan. This will improve his market supply and also his revenue.

loans.use: To restock his farm and also pay for de-worming his cattle

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es:
José tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el cantón Corralito, Corinto Morazán, está acompañado, y se dedica a la agricultura. 
 Tiene  veinticinco  años de realizar el trabajo de  cultivo de granos y fue su padre quien le inculco el trabajar la tierra,  siembra Maíz, frijol y maicillo, trabaja en horario de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm, le gusta mucho su trabajo, actualmente se ha visto en la necesidad de adquirir un préstamo  para invertirlo en compra de abono y fertilizante para el cultivo de maíz.
Con la compra de abono José espera tener una producción favorable de la cual planea vender una parte y otra para consumo de su familia; Sus aspiraciones obtener un exetente Cultivo, comprar a futuro animales:  Vacas y cerdos  dedicarce al cuidado y venta para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 48 years old, and resides in the Corralito canton, living in the Corinto Morazán state. He work in farming. He has been a farmer, growing grain for 25 years. It was his father who got him into farming, sewing corn, beans, and native corn, he works from 6:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon. He likes his work a lot and currently he has seen the need to acquire a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and nutrients for his corn crop. With the purchase of fertilizer, Jose hopes to have a more bountiful harvest, from which he plans to sell one part and his family will consume the other part. He aspires to have a flourishing harvest to buy animals in the future such as cows and pigs and to devote himself to raising and selling cattle and improve the quality of his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutrients and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita C. is from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 44 years old. Carmelita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing specialty tailoring services especially curtains, matress, and pillows cover to local community members. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 53 years old. Nenita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Blas Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Compañía Espartillar, vive en concubinato  con la  Sra. Gloria Cañiza y  no tiene  hijos, tienen casa  propia.  

      El se dedica hace varios años a la  venta ambulante de artesanía fabricadas por su esposa  por la  zona de Ypacarai y Villa Elisa, comenta que cuenta con clientelas bien formadas ya que los productos que lleva son de buena calidad y de aceptación del cliente, su viaje lo realiza en forma semanal.
Toda la familia trabaja para hacer este negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanía, entre las fabricaciones más solicitadas se encuentran los ponchos de lana, frazadas, bufandas y otros. 

   Solicita el  préstamo  para compra de materia prima (hilo, trapos de distintos tipos, y colorantes para teñir las telas).
texts.en:
Blas S. is from Carapeguá city, Compañía Espartillar. He lives with his partner Gloria Cañiza in their own home. They don't have children. For several years Blas has worked selling artesanal goods door to door, make by his wife, in the Ypacarai and Villa Elisa zones. He has very good clients as the products he sells are of a very good quality and well-received by his clients. He travels weekly to sell them. All the family works for this business, making and selling artesanal goods. Among the most sought-after products are woolen ponchos, blankets, scarves and others. Blas is seeking this loan to purchase raw materials (thread, different types of cloth, and tints to dye the wool).

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads, cloths and wool dyes

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 26 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living by doing both tailoring and embroidery work, largely for women's outfits and tablecloths. Most of her customers live in her neighborhood. Julia is a member of the Huruma B group, which is part of Faulu Kenya. She previously borrowed 20,000 Kes from the group and is now applying for a new loan, for 30,000 Kes, to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make tablecloths.  She hopes to become a major distributor of tablecloths in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric to make tablecloths

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 65 años, es viuda y vive con uno D. sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 20 años D. experiencia tejiendo mantos utilizando como herramienta una maquina a base D. madera, que le ayuda a realizar estos telares. Actualmente su trabajo lo realiza en su casa, en compañía D. sus hijas, quienes la apoyan en esta labor. Tiene clientes fijos que siempre le piden los productos que venD., por lo que ha significado un prestigio en su trabajo a la vez que se estabiliza sus ingresos económicos. Adicionalmente a esto también se dedica al cultivo D. maíz y papa, en cada temporada, como es D. costumbre, necesita D. mayor esfuerzo la temporada D. siembra y cosecha, por lo que necesita D. manos para poder acabar con su trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. lana D. diferentes colores y también en la compra D. sacos D. abono para la siembra D. maíz y habas.
texts.en:
Paulina is 65 years old, widowed, and lives in her own home with one of her children. She has 20 years of experience producing woven garments with the help of a wooden loom. Paulina currently works from home with her daughters who help with the duties. She has established customers who request the products she sells. As a result of the reputation she has earned from her work, Paulina is able to generate a stable income.

In addition, she grows corn and potatoes. Each season, as is custom, Paulina must invest in a great deal of effort to complete the planting and harvesting. For this reason, she must hire laborers to help with the work.

This is her second loan with MFP. Paulina is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. She thanks those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will be helpful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of wool in different colors. She will also buy sacks of compost so that she can fertilize her corn and bean crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in different colors & sacks of compost to fertilize her crops

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza P. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ma.theresa Erma

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa Erma T. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sutay, Brgy. Antipolo, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating three business ventures: food vending, a general store and a tricycle transport business. Her husband, Fausto, who is 49 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and he also helps in his wife's businesses. They have five children aged between 7 and 27. 
Ma. Theresa Erma joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Theresa Erma has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,100 PHP, thus raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP, which she intends to use to process the documents for her daughter to work abroad so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. 
Ma.Theresa Erma T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

 About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her food business

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
Ella tiene 53 años de edad, viuda y con 2 personas a su cargo, una sobrina y su mamá que es una anciana. Vive en el barrio la Fuente, en la parte central de la capital. Donde tiene su negocio desde hace 10 años.

En todos estos años ha demostrado ser un buen cliente. Con un buen record crediticio. Ella vende comida tales como: pollo tapado, asado, frito, en caldo, carne desmenuzada, carne asada de res, sopas de res, cerdo asado, frito, y gran variedad de fresco. La comida tiene un precio de C$ 40.00 córdobas, y fresco a C$7.00 Córdobas.

La Sra. Dolores M. es cliente de CEPRODEL desde febrero del 2002 donde ha trabajado 7 créditos con nuestra institución. Los que ha utilizado para invertir en su negocio, ayudándole a permanecer en el mercado durante todos estos años de existencia del negocio. También parte de este dinero lo ha invertido en la mejora de su casa.
texts.en:
Dolores is 53 years old.  She is a widow and has two people in her care; a niece and her mother who is a pensioner.  She lives in La Fuente neighborhood in the central part of the capital.  She has had a business there for 10 years.

In all these years she has had good customers and a good credit record.  She sells meals such as 'pollo tapado' (a type of Nicaraguan chicken stew), roast chicken, fried chicken, chicken stew, 'carne desmenuzada' (shredded meat - a typical Nicaraguan dish), roasted meat, 'sopa de res' (a traditional meat stew), roasted pork, fried pork and a good variety of soft drinks.  The meals are priced at 40 Nicaraguan cordobas and the drinks are priced at 7 cordobas.

Mrs Dolores M. has been a client of CEPRODEL since February 2002.  She has had 7 loans from our organization which she has used to invest in her business, helping her to stay in the market during all these years that she has been in business.  Part of this money has also been invested in improving her house.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N., 34, charges used batteries as his primary business. He also has rental houses which he rents out to tenants within the area. He is married to Lucy Ngugi and together they have two children named Elvis (in class seven) and Zain, aged six months. Joseph has been running this battery charging business which is in Rongai for 10 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. His business is strategically placed so Joseph has many customers.

Joseph was introduced to KADET Ltd by existing clients and he has applied for a loan which he will use to open a food shop near his battery charging business as a secondary business. He plans to use the loan to buy a cook stove for this purpose. If the loan boosts the business, he will build more houses to get more income. 

Joseph describes himself as hard-working, and he has high hopes of having many rental houses. This will enable him to cater for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a cook stove and open a food shop

loans.name: Juana Anatolia

texts.es:
Juana Anatolia M. A. tiene 81 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Juana  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 25 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un tienda de abastos.
Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Juana Anatolia M. A. is 81 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Juana has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past 25 years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She likes to work.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is a 32-year-old married man with two children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling produce for the last ten years, having started with 12 bags of maize and increased to 300 bags. His hardships include: debtors, price fluctuation, poor means, and increased transport costs. His vision is to supply to institutions around Kasese and Hima, plus educate his children. Bright intends to use the credit facility to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-age children in Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1998. He works hard to obtain a good income for his family. In addition, he works in the agriculture field. It is common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs in parallel to make profit and cover the heavy expenses of housing, food, school etc.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a new engine and fix his car to offer a comfortable transportation service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a new engine and fix his car

loans.name: Virgo Jay's Group

texts.en:
Virgo Jay D. is from the village of De Vera, Cauayan City. Isabela. He is 33 years old. Virgo Jay is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virgo Jay is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virgo Jay owns and operates a business running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Virgo Jay has been engaged in his business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgo Jay joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgo Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgo Jay is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virgo Jay from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chicken roaster.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a widow who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buy and sell "balut" (fertilized duck eggs) and a general store. Her children are all adults.  Josefina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josefina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use for more funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family. Josefina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: For business operations

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: Mahina is married and she is the loving mother of two children. She is an entrepreneur from Penjikent, Tajikistan, where she sells men’s clothing in one of the local markets. Mahina has been in this business for about four years. The financial assistance of IMON International has helped her increase her assorted merchandise and expand considerably. Mahina has a reasonable pricing policy that attracts customers to her vending facility. This coming spring season, she is planning to increase seasonal inventory, which is why she is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni. Mahina is hoping to generate additional income and invest part of the profit in reconstruction of her old house, which needs to be repaired. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Tony

texts.es: Tony, de 20 años es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres al lado de ellos y sus hermanos menores; y a pesar de su juventud se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante. Desde que terminó el colegio se propuso aprender a reparar computadoras es por esta razón que estudio para  técnico en computadoras. Ya han pasado dos años y el tiempo le ha permitido aprender y a brindar el servicio de arreglar computadoras, y en la actualidad es muy conocido por su trabajo  en la zona por donde vive. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también trabaja como obrero de construcción durante las tardes. Pero hay un anhelo que aún no concreta y es instalar su propio taller de reparación de computadoras, aunque sea en un local alquilado, pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo logrará todos sus planes; es por esta razón que solicita el dinero pues quiere pagar la inicial para alquilar su local. Además para el futuro tiene planeado estudiar ingeniería de sistemas, pues quiere aprender nuevas técnicas para mejorar y salir adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Tony tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en el pago del primer alquiler de su local donde podrá guardar sus herramientas y reparar toda clase de computadoras y equipos electrónicos sin problemas.
texts.en:
Tony is 20 years old and he lives in his parent’s house along with his younger siblings. Though he is young, he works hard to get ahead. After finishing high school, he studied for a technical degree in repairing computers. It has been two years since then and he has been able to learn more and provide his services repairing computers. He is well-known in his neighborhood for his work. 

He also works in construction during the afternoons. However, something he would like to do but hasn’t been able to do yet is to open his own computer repair workshop, even in a rented space. He knows that with a lot of hard work he will achieve his goals. For this reason he is requesting the loan; he wants to pay the first the rent on his shop. Additionally, for the future he plans to study computer engineering because he would like to learn new techniques to improve and get ahead. 

This is the first loan that he has had with Microfinanzas Prisma and he promises to make his repayments punctually. He doesn’t want to disappoint the people who made possible the money that will help him to continue working and making progress. Tony plans to invest the requested loan in paying the first rent on his shop, where he’ll be able to leave his tools and repair all kinds of computers and electronic equipment without problems.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the shop where he will repair computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the rental houses and to buy packing tins for yoghurt.

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married and has one child.

Riyad is a carpenter and has his own shop; he has been selling furniture, pillows and covers since 2007. He has a long experience; he inherited this business from his father. He has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2400 loan to buy a new machine. He aspires to a better future through good financial returns.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for his work.

loans.name: Celinda Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a Celinda, tiene 59 años  de edad, es soltera, vive con su hermana y una sobrina de 15 años que estudia en colegio y la quiere como si fuera su hija. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 12 ciclos  y le gusta porque además de entretenerse recibe el apoyo tanto de sus compañeras como de la institución.

Ella para obtener recursos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas para que sus clientes miren sus productos, nos cuenta que lo que más vende es ropa de mujer y de niñas. Ella también prepara comida para vender, prepara hasta 10 almuerzos al dia  para entregar. Trabaja todos los días  desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes o cuando necesite. Tiene 14 años dedicada a sus ventas y le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños, etc.

Su sueño es algún día tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
