In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi Province and known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Luz de América" meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Celinda, age 59, who is single and lives with her sister and 15-year-old niece who is a student and who she loves like a daughter.  She has been in the communal bank for 12 terms and she enjoys it not only because it keeps her busy but because of the support she receives from her friends there.

She earns her living selling all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis and out of her home where she has display cases set up for the customers to shop.  What she sells most are women's and little girls' clothing.  She also prepares and sells up to 10 lunch meals a day which she delivers.  She works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month or when necessary.  She has been in business for 14 years and it has gone well for her.

She plans to use the loan to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, etc.

Her dream is to have her own shop one day.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Harvey Maurico

texts.es:
Harvey aprendió a fotografiar después de trabajar durante algunos años en diferentes estudios fotográficos, por lo que se considera empirico pero enamorado de su oficio. Después de quedar desempleado y sin muchas oportunidades, Harvey decidió crear su propio negocio en el Barrio Popular 1 de Medellín en el que le dio vida a su propio estudio. 

Este emprendedor realiza estudios fotográficos, montajes y asiste a eventos sociales para realizar la toma de fotografías, aunque Harbey es soltero, su negocio le ha permitido cubrir sus gastos básicos y contribuir con el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

A pesar de que en algunas temporadas del año su trabajo disminuye, Harvey continúa con su labor con la ilusión de crecer cada vez más hasta convertirse en un fotógrafo reconocido en la ciudad.

Actualmente sus equipos que ya se han ido desgastando por el uso que les ha dado necesitan de un mantenimiento para agilizar sus procesos y poder ofrecer un excelente servicio que se traduzca en mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y caminar cada vez más cerca en busca de ese sueño.
texts.en:
Harvey learned to photograph after working for several years in different photographic studios, for which he is considered empirical, but enamored of his job.  After remaining unemployed and without many opportunities, Harvey decided to create his own business in the popular neighborhood 1 of Medellín in which he gave birth to his own studio.  

This enterpreneur creates photographic studies, montages and helps with social events by taking photographs.  Although Harvey is single, his business has allowed him to cover his basic expenses and to contribute to the support of his home.  

In spite of the fact that in some seasons of the year his work diminishes, Harvey continues with his work with the dream of growing more each time to become a recognized photographer in the city.  

At present his equipment has started to wear out from the use that he has given them.  They need maintenance to expedite his processes and to be able to offer excellent service that will translate into greater income to improve his quality of life and to reach closer each time in search of that dream.

loans.use: to maintain his photographic equipment

loans.name: Mahoukpego-Pouce Group

texts.fr: MAHOUKPEGO-POUCE est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes et dont la présidente (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Elise. Les membres du groupe sont des amies qui fréquentent la même Eglise. Née en 1976 au Bénin, Elise vit avec son mari Cokouvi et ses trois enfants dans une ville du Bénin, depuis quatre ans environs. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Elise assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a deux ans que Elise a commencé à faire le commerce de chaussures et de produits cosmétiques de façon secondaire. Elise s’approvisionne au Bénin, et vend ses produits de façon ambulante. Ce crédit servira certainement à Elise et aux membres de son groupe d’augmenter le stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaire de même que leur revenu. Elise ambitionne trouver un lieu fixe de vente dans un marché afin d’y vendre ses produits.
texts.en: The Mahoukpego-Pouce group is composed of four individuals. The group’s leader (raising her hand in the photo) is  called Elise. The group members are friends who attend the same church. Born in 1976 in Benin, Elise  has been living with her husband, Cokouvi, and their three children in a town in Benin for about four years. Some of the children are in school. Elise and her husband jointly provide for different household needs. Two years ago, Elise started a business selling shoes, and, as a secondary activity,  cosmetics. She stocks up in Benin and sells as an ambulant street vendor. This credit will certainly help Elise and her group members to expand their product stock and to increase their sales volume and their revenues. Her goal is to have a permanent  stand at a market in order to sell her wares there.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 48 years old and married with four school-aged children. She is from Tabid Ozamis City. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a transportation business. Her main source of income comes from operating a motorcycle transport service. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

Rosalinda joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a shop that sells green bananas. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy green and yellow bananas.

She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ma. Ligaya, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rosendo, a contractor, and is the mother of four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. A dream for most poor Filipino parents, like Ligaya, as she herself has been an undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Ma. Ligaya operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells bananas, papayas and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 600  every day.

To help her continued business operations, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Ligaya dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fruit deliveries for her business.

loans.name: Saidmahmad

texts.ru: Саидмахмад проживает в районе Джиликул. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Саидмахмад занимается растениеводством. Он при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает дыню, арбуз и овощи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Saidmahmad lives in the Jililkul region. He is married. He has five children. His wife works in the collective farm in the region. Saidmahmad does agriculture. He has a small plot of land by the house where he grows melons, watermelons and vegetables. He has been in this business for fifteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria Del Carmen

texts.es: Victoria Del Carmen tiene 35 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Este negocio empezó hace 4 años con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos ya que además ella imparte clases en colegio público. Ella empezó vendiendo muy pocos cosméticos, después fue que empezó a invertir un poco más y obtener este medio de vida.  El crédito será invertido en la compra de lápiz labial, estuches calzados, ropa en general, bolsos, sabanas y otros. Su meta es llegar a tener un una tienda de artículos variados que pueda estar ubicada en el mercado, que brinde las facilidades económicas a ella y a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria Del Carmen, 35, sells general merchandise.  She started the business four years ago with very little working capital as a way of finding an additional source of alternative income since she also teaches in a public school.

She started out selling a few cosmetics and later on started investing a bit more to build this way of life.  She will use this loan to buy lipsticks, kits, footwear, clothing in general, purses, sheets and others.  Her goal is to have a general store eventually located in the market that will provide her and her three children with economic means.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorreti is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children.  All of her children are currently in school. Gorreti has a poultry farm business, which she has had for eight years. She also has a second business of a small retail shop that sells soft drinks.         

To help expand her business, Gorreti has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gorreti hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Gorreti hopes to expand her business. Gorreti is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Flora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.
Flora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Flora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Cleto Marcelino

texts.es: Cleto Marcelino 70 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 20 año que busca la manera de mantener a su familia. Don Cleto es un hombre emprendedor, el es su propio jefe de su negocio pues se levanta todos los días temprano para ofrecer sus tortillas caliente a sus clientes. el desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra maíz, bolsas, leña, cal y comal. Por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma.
texts.en: Cleto Marcelino is 70 years old.  His business is making and selling tortillas.  He has been looking for a way to support his family for more than 20 years.  Cleto is an entrepreneurial man.  He is his own boss and he wakes up early every morning so that he can offer warm tortillas to his customers.  He would like this loan to buy corn, bags, firewood, lime and a 'comal' (special pan for making tortillas).  He pledges to make his repayments in full and on time.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, firewood, lime and a 'comal' (special pan for making tortillas)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and blessed with four children. She presently residing at Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental.

Teresita sells a variety of products like vinegar, salt, soy sauce, eggs, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for a year. She has a net income of Php 3000 monthly.Her business helps a lot in her family; all she wants today is to expand it well so she can earn more.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy additional goods to sell. The loan will help her buy what she needs. Her dream is to buy more land to be able to produce more and solve her problems.

In her free time she likes to walk and work some extra hours.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional basic goods to sell.

loans.name: Santos Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Santos Pablo es casado, tiene 32 años de edad, cursó el tercer años de educación básica, tiene 1 hijos el cual aun no estudia, se dedica a la tejeduría, al tejido de cortes, rebosas, sabanas, servilletas, inició este trabajo como operario y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a atender una tienda.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases  y colores, espera en el futuro contar con grande capital.
texts.en: Santos Pablo is 32 years old, married and has a 3rd grade education.  He has one child who is not yet in school.  He has a weaving business.  He weaves traditional skirts, scarfs, bedcovers, and napkins.  He started doing this work as an employee, and has 15 years of experience.  He relies on the support of his wife, who works attending to a store.  He requests a loan to buy yarn of different types and colors.  In the future, he hopes to have more capital to work with.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Exaltacion Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EXALTACIÓN” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Elaboración de mantas, venta de hilos, venta de quesos, venta de refrescos, venta de mantas y lana, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras.

La señora Hilda,  indica que es primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de quesos que viene trabajando hace un año atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de queso), que comprara de Viacha y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

En la fotografia acompaña al grupo la prima de la señora Juana, ella se esconde de cámaras.
texts.en:
The community bank "Exaltación" started its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascade Center.  It is made up of seven members and led by a board, which is headed by Hilda.  The businesses that the members of the community bank own are different, including: making blankets, yarn sales, cheese sales, beverage sales, blanket and wool sales, a neighborhood store, and vegetable sales.  

Hilda says that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer.  She was invited to join the group by a promoter.  She has a business selling cheeses that she started a year ago.  

She will use this loan to increase her capital and purchase cheese.  She purchases cheese in Viacha and then sells it at markets.  This work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has three children.  

In the photograph, Juana's cousin is also shown.  She hides from cameras.

loans.use: to purchase cheese.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and none of her children goes to school. She operates a sewing machine from home. She has been in business for the last 20 years. Milly works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials. Her aspiration and goal is to buy an electric sewing machine to serve many customers in a short time. Her major business challenge is seasonality and the ever-increasing price of textiles. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: María Aracely

texts.es:
La señora María  tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, reside en la comunidad  urbano marginal Terencio Sierra, sector Chamelecón en San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Desde hace 8 años inicio su negocio vendiendo calzado, actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas, caballeros y niños. Sus dos hijos menores están estudiando por lo que ella se esfuerza por aumentar sus ganancias.
Ella ha solicitado su segundo crédito para surtir su negocio con ropa y zapatos nuevos, considera que al ofrecer variedad de productos, sus clientes aumentan y sus ganancias también.
Doña Maria va continuar luchando para sacar adelante a sus hijos con el estudio y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 38, is a single mother; she has three children and lives in the marginal urban community of Terencio Sierra, Chamelecón Sector in San Pedro Sula, Cortés.

She started selling shoes 8 years ago and now also sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes.  Her two younger children are still in school so she works hard to increase profits.

She has requested her second loan to stock her business with new shoes and clothes.  She believes that by offering a variety of products her customer base will increase as will her profits.  María will continue to strive to raise her children and provide them education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Helaria runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.
Helaria has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ariole

texts.en: Ariole is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is a single gay man who earns a living by running a beauty shop that provides haircutting, hairstyling, pedicure, manicure and other services. He has been in this line of work for 20 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy supplies for his shop. Ariole joined HSPFI earlier this year and hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, while her husband is a palm juice vendor and her son is a chef.

Sim has requested a loan of 700 USD through KREDIT Ltd. to purchase a motorbike to use in a motor taxi business. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income and support her children to study toward a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use in a motor taxi business.

loans.name: Cham

texts.en:
Cham (in the photo) is 47-years-old and her husband, Kin, is 50-years-old. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons whom are blacksmiths.  

Cham is a weaver. Additionally she also buys nets and some cotton and silk fabrics from weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. 

Cham is applying for her first loan in the amount of $800 to purchase additional nets, cotton and silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: to purchase additional nets, cotton and silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a very active lady. She supports her husband financially by preparing wooden stools. She started this business a few years ago. She is a very hard worker by nature. While working, she never thinks of day and night. Her work is very demanding in her area. Her husband is a mason by profession and constructs houses and buildings by contract. He is known as an expert in his work and offers quality services to his clients. Naseem is the mother of 2 sons.  

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son, who makes and sells shawls at different clothing shops in the market. He sells a variety of shawls, such as embroidered, simple and colorful shawls, to his customers. With the loan investment, he will buy colored thread, beads and laces in bulk quantities that will allow him to make better quality and a higher variety of shawls, selling them at higher profits. 

Naseem is confident that an investment will help her son make his business better. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.”

loans.use: to buy colored thread, beads and laces for a shawls-making business

loans.name: Adut

texts.en: Adut is 26 years old, married and has one child who is enrolled in school. She earns a living by selling fish and is applying for this loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, tiene 32 años, junto con ella vive sus 3 hijos y su esposo quien también es comerciante y la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, como también en el crecimiento de sus actividades. El negocio se encuentra en punto de fácil acceso, para sus clientes, ya que se encuentra por la calle principal y esto se presta para que sea muy visitado.
Doña Luisa el crédito lo necesita para compra de: maíz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, embutidos, huevos, pollo, discos, bandas, limas, lijas, aceite etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es extenderse mas en su negocio, y así darle variedad de productos a sus clientes y de esta manera contrarrestar la demanda que le hacen a diario, de igual manera obtener mejores ingresos para darle una buena condición de vida a su familia.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Luisa es crecer en su actividad  día a día y enviar sus hijos a la universidad.
Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, embutidos, huevos, pollo, discos, bandas, limas, lijas, aceite etc.  para su negocio

loans.name: Neyding Karina

texts.es:
Neyding Karina se Llama laJoven que habita en el municipio De Santa Rosa del Peñón una ciudad Reconocida, Por su belleza. 

Neyding Karina Tiene 24 años de edad  soltera ella se dedica a trabajar en una de las instituciones del estado.  

Desempeña el cargo de profesora, donde da clase en uno de los instituto del estado, viendo la oportunidad que presenta en su vida, como es su empleo, le está solicitando a Ceprodel y kiva un pequeño préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto por tal razón solicita el préstamo para la compra de: Zinc, Cemento, arena y Ladrillo, con esto ella considera de gran importancia en su vida.  

Ella considera que esto sería de gran importancia en el desarrollo de su vida familiar así que regresar a su casa y le permitirá pasar un mejor tiempo con su mamita, que comparte su vida.    

Se siente agradecida con Dios por a verle iluminado que Kiva siempre sigue apoyando y que por medio de estas institución se le podrían cumplir todo sus sueños.

loans.use: Compra de: Zinc, Cemento, arena y Ladrillo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for sell to small scale at favorable prices.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: "Auntie Adwoa" operates a store where she sells assorted drinks and provisions. She need a spacious store that can contain all her goods. She is seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to enable her to expand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a widow. She has five children, three in secondary and two in primary schools. She is a trained primary school teacher and she teaches at a nearby school. She started her business last year in order to supplement her salary. She gets her stock from the farmers during harvest seasons and sells them when the supply is low. This is her second loan with PEMCI. The first loan enabled her to expand her business, so she was able to pay school fees for her children in secondary school, and she was also able to develop her farm. With a second loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her stock further.

loans.use: Rose would like to boost her stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Deizi (Daisy)

texts.en:
Deizi is a 47 year old single mother. She has a son, Gerson, 10, and a daughter, Fiorella, 18. Deizi currently buys clothes from Lima, formal and informal wear for adults, and sells them to friends and other people she knows. Most of her clients buy on credit and pay her back monthly. In order to have a more consistent income flow, Deizi has started a pastry business, which she prefers rather than selling clothes. She uses a small oven at her home to make a few dozen empanadas, which she sells in the main Plaza in Juliaca. Fieorella and Gerson often stay up until 2:00 am helping their mother make dough for the empanadas.  

She is seeking a loan in order to start up a pastry tienda. She has researched the items necessary in order to begin her business. An industrial oven she would need runs for $1,000 and rent for a small shop in Puno, the busy touristic center in which she hopes to open her shop, is about $150 a month. The $325 loan in addition to the savings and capital she has accumulated would allow Deizi to purchase the necessary startup items she would need to set up her shop and as well as allow her to hire a couple of employees to help manage her pastry/bakery.

loans.use: Expand Pastry Business

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Mrs. Eduviges G. lives on Unión Fátima Avenue in the city of El Alto. She has a kiosk from which she sells meat dishes, vegetable dishes, cookies, and so on. She has two children who currently live with her. Her husband works as a farmhand in the country. She would use the loan to buy merchandise to sell from her kiosk, increasing her sales and income. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation IMPRO conducted qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

La señora Eduviges vive en la avenida Unión Fátima de Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto, posee un kiosco donde se dedica al comercio de refrescos carne, verduras, galletas etc. Tiene dos hijos que actualmente viven con ella, su esposo trabaja en el área rural. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell from her kiosk

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en: Mrs. Sarita M., 29, lives in Bholdhoka with her husband, Mr. Sagar M.. Most of the people in this region are involved in business professions. Mr. Sagar M. is a taxi driver. He drives a taxi in Kathmandu Valley. Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. Due to a lack of money she cannot expand her business. So, she seeks a loan to buy necessary goods like noodles and biscuits to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu lives in Kirkhchirak village, in the Salyan region. She is 39 years old and single.

Gullu has been in the farming business for 15 years. She needs a loan of $1,200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Daniela's Group

texts.es:
Justina is 44 years old, Daniela is 56 years old, and Estela is 65 years old. They are all part of the Community Bank of Your Angel Lucy and have been part of the bank for 7, 8, and 5 years respectively. In the bank, they were trained to run their businesses and save.

Justina sells spices (condiments) in the “Market: April 12th.” She began her business with a loan for $50 and little by little grew to have more merchandise and clientel.

Daniela sells food in the Santa Clara Market. She joined the Community Bank due to the invitations from her friends.

Estela sews clothing and sells it in the community fairs. Estela began her business with $2 of savings.

Justina, Daniela and Estela need a loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($350.00), S/. 600 ($200.00) and S/. 600 ($200.00) which will be invested in cinnamon, pepper, cumin, red chile, yellow chile, rice, potatoes, noodles, sugar, cloth, thread and other accessories. Justina, Daniela and Estela dram of constructing their own homes, raising their children to be professionals, and opening up time for relaxation in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Justina tiene 44 años, Daniela tiene 56 años, mientras que Estela tiene 65 años, ellas pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy desD. hace 7, 8 y 5 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal les enseñaron a como administrar sus negocios y a ahorrar. Justina venD. especerías (condimentos para cocinar) en el mercado 12 D. abril, Justina cuenta que inició con un préstamo D. 50 dólares y poco a poco fue creciendo; actualmente tiene más mercadería y clientes. Por otro lado Daniela venD. comida en el mercado Santa Clara y llegó al Banco Comunal por invitación D. una amiga. Mientras que Estela confecciona prendas D. vestir y los venD. a los feriantes, Estela comenta que inició con 2 dólares D. ahorros. Justina, Daniela y Estela necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 600 soles y 600 soles que serán invertidos en la compra D. canela, pimienta, comino, ají colorado, ají amarillo, arroz, papa, fideo, azúcar, telas, hilos y otros accesorios. Los sueños D. Justina, Daniela y Estela son construir su casa, que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales y para abrir un recreo en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale in each woman's respective business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand poultry business

loans.name: Abigeal

texts.en: Abigeal, 40, is married with 5 children. Two have completed secondary level, 2 are in secondary school, and 1 is in primary school. She has three years of business experience selling used clothes, locally known as “mivumba,” to various markets and trading centers. This has benefited her by allowing her to pay school fees for her children as well as to buy household items. She has a dream of one day opening up a shop selling used clothes to avoid the daily movements.

loans.use: Abigeal intends to buy more used clothes with the loan.

loans.name: Alma Gloria

texts.es:
Alma Gloria Dávalos is an exemplary and enterprising woman from the municipality of García, Nuevo León. She has four children who are now grown and married, 40, 39, 36 and 32 years old.

After her divorce, Alma was left without a means of income given that her children do not support her financially. She was also responsible for her own mother’s care, which requires income given that she has been infirm of late. Due to all this, she needed to start an enterprise that would generate substantial income to be able to cover her financial obligations. Thus, she began to sell American clothing which she purchases in packs so she can achieve greater profit upon resale.

She currently seeks a loan of $950USD to be repaid over a period of six months. She would invest in merchandise to be able to continue in her activities. With your help, Alma will be able to care for her mother as well as have an income on which to live on.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Gloria Dávalos, es una mujer emprendedora y ejemplar del municipio de García, Nuevo León, tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya están casados y son mayores, tienen 40, 39 ,36 Y32 años.

Después de su divorcio, Alma quedo sin un sustento económico, ya que sus hijos no la apoyan económicamente y además de esto ella se hace cargo del cuidado de su madre así como de los gastos que generan darle atención medica, ya que ha estado enferma últimamente. Debido a todo esto ella necesitaba tener una actividad que le generara buenos ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos. Fue así que se inicio en la venta de ropa americana la cual compra por pacas y así puede obtener mayor ganancia al revenderla.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en mercancía y poder continuar con esta actividad. Con tu ayuda Alma podrá seguir cuidando de su madre así como tener un ingreso para vivir.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Loveness

texts.en:
Loveness is a married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12. Loveness sells clothing, a business she started in 2006. Every day she works from 9 A.M. to 4 P.M., and she earns a monthly profit of about $25.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deisy is 26, has three childre, and is working selling clothing and sells them at the Argentina/Paraguay border. In the past, she worked at the market selling vegetables, and later as a saleperson in a salon, but since she earned so little, she decided to try business for herself.

Deisy has worked since she was 15 years old, and already has her own house. Thanks to the Foundation she is improving her sales and savings, and she hopes to one day have her own shop from her house, where she would like to open a small bar.

Deisy is asking for a loan to buy winter clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La sra Deisy tiene 26 años,tiene 3 hijos,ella se dedica a la compra de ropas y las vende en la frontera. con Argentina. Anteriormente trabajaba en el mercado vendiendo verduras y después fue vendedora de salón, pero como ganaba muy poco ella decidió independizarse.

Deisy trabaja desde los 15 años, ya posee una casa propia y gracias a la Fundación fue progresando con sus ventas y ahorros, ella desea poder montar el día de mañana su propio salón de ventas en su casa donde además le gustaría poder abrir un pequeño bar.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de la temporada invierno.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Nasy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nasy S., 42, and her husband, Mr. Hoeun Ham, 43, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have six sons. Five of them are in local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Nasy has been a weaver for seventeen years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Mr. Hoeun has been a cow seller for seven years. Mrs. Nasy now is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for weaving and a cow for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and a cow for resale.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.en:
Maria de Jesús is a client dedicated to the housework she is responsible for. In order to support her husband and her family she works weaving huipiles (traditional dress of Guatemalan women) by hand to sell. She realized that it would be profitable to be able to focus on another business to earn more income and came up with the idea of a mill to grind corn, because there wasn’t one in the area where she lives.

With the help of her husband she bought a mill with a manual drive (powered manually and with diesel) but with this loan she wants to buy an electric mill, which is easier to operate. Although she now has competition, with her kindness she has been able to keep her clients. She also has a small store and wants to stock it with common daily consumption necessities. In the future she wants to see her children become professionals so that they can help her economically and so that they can become important people.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

La señora María de Jesús es una socia dedicada a sus quehaceres de su hogar con su responsabilidad; es de apoyo para su esposo y familia ella se dedicaba a la elaboración y tejido de güipiles a mano para venderlos, pero pensó que era provechoso para ella poder atender un negocio para obtener mas ganancias y se imagino un molino para moler nixtamal porque en el área donde ella vive no había.

Con la ayuda de su esposo lograron comprar uno pero de manejo mecánico (con fuerzas y de diesel) pero ahora con el préstamo quiere comprar un molino eléctrico lo que es mas fácil manejarlo, aunque ahora tiene competencia; con su amabilidad ha logrado mantener sus clientes. También tiene una pequeña tienda y quiere surtirla con lo necesario para el consumo diario, lo que ella quiere en el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales para que la ayuden económicamente y puedan ser personas importantes.

loans.use: Buy an electric mill for grinding corn and to purchase more inventory for her general store, such as beans, noodles, oil, and other daily consumption items

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma was born in 1985.  While her husband is employed in Italy as a seasonal worker, Selma produces healthy food at home. She makes and sells homemade jam and different kinds of salads and she can earn about 120 KM monthly. 

She has asked for a loan of 600 KM in order to buy compost and prepare the land for sowing wheat.  Her hope is to earn enough money from wheat sales to buy a greenhouse for her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy compost.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de primaria, vive en la comunidad de Chua, distrito de Capaso, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Con su crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles compró 01 cilindro de petróleo. Desde los 13 años de edad aprendió a vender gelatina, galletas, maná en las ferias de Chua, Torata, Tancachi, etc. A los 17 años de edad se fue a la ciudad de Tacna para trabajar como empleada y con ello pudo lograr ahorrar un capital, y desde hace 04 años empezó a dedicarse al negocio de combustible, negocio que tienen hasta el día de hoy.
 
Con este crédito de S/.1,200 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 cilindros de petróleo a S/.560 cada cilindro.

Su meta es seguir con el negocio, aperturar una tienda de combustible, gasolina, petróleo, kerosene; además incluir productos como lubricantes y aditivos.
texts.en:
Maria is single, 24 years old and has a fifth-grade education. She lives in the community of Chua, Peru. She is a member of the Generation 2000 Community Bank in Mazocruz. With her first loan, she purchased one cylinder of oil. Since she was 13 years old, she learned to sell gelatins, cookies and other treats in the local outdoor markets. At 17, she went to the city of Tacna to work as maid and she was able to save some capital. The past four years she has made a living selling combustible fuels. With the $425 loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase two cylinders of oil at about $200/cylinder. Her goal is to keep growing her business and open a store selling gasoline, oil and kerosene as well as other products like lubricants and additives.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cylinders of oil

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru:
Назарова Хосиять, 1967 года рождения, замужем и у них 4 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи фруктов и овощей. У нее 10 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она торгует на рынке «Дехконбозор» Гисарского района фруктами, овощами, куринные яйца, а в сезон продает рыбу, жаренную и сырую. У Хосият много постоянных клиентов, часто ее рыбу закупают оптом в столовые и пивные бары. Хосият хочет увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар у дехкан, рыбаков  и поставщиков из Худжанда.
Хосият хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 1500 сомони чтоб закупить рыбы.
texts.en:
Hosiyat N. was born in 1967, is married, and has four children. She began her business by selling fruit and vegetables. She has ten years of experience. She trades in the Dekhanbozor market in Gissar, selling fruit, vegetables, chicken eggs, and, in season, fish both fried and raw. Hosiyat has many regular customers who frequently buy her fish wholesale for cafeterias and bars. Hosiyat wants to increase sales to make more money. She buys her goods from small farmers, fishermen, and suppliers from Khujand. Hosiyat wants to take out a loan through Kiva for 1,500 somoni in order to buy fish.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fish

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C., 26, is a grocery seller and has been making a living selling groceries including candy, eggs, seasoning and cakes since 2007. Her husband, Mr. Saody Chengh, is 27 years old and lives in Kdieydong Commune in Kompong Tom Province. He works outside his home as a construction worker and he currently earns approximately $2.50 per day. Mom has three children, two of whom are in school, while one is still young.

Mom hopes to run a new store for fried beef and boiled eggs to sell in front of her house; hence, she would like to apply for a $100 loan to make that possible.

loans.use: To run a new store for fried beef and boiled eggs

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty years old. She is married with six children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a food vendor who has been cooking for fifteen years. A. cooks rice with stew and sells it on a table top on the streets. She sells from the morning to the evening to the people of her community. 

A. buys bags of rice and other food items, such as cooking oil, fish, and meat, in the city. Ingredients such as tomatoes and pepper are readily available in her community. She wants to buy in bulk the ingredients that are not common to come by in her community. 

A. belongs to the group called “Tumi Wura” Trust Bank in her community. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia K. sells electronics at the shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Julia is 27 years old and is divorced. She has four children who are currently in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. It encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: school fees for children

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma Ramadhani is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur business man. For 5 years, he has run a butcher shop at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. He receives a meat order from the meat suppliers, who purchase directly from the slaughtering center at Vingunguti in Dar es Salaam.

The butchery business is profitable due to high demand of meat for domestic purposes. He requests a loan of $925 (1,200,000 TZS) to purchase more meat to increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase more meat to sell in the butcher shop

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede F. is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells medicine. She is requesting the loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
Abdel Karim, 41 years old, lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. For 10 years, Abdel Karim has worked as a mechanic selling tires and changing car oil. Previously, Abdel Karim received a loan to help him improve his business and his financial situation. Abdel Karim is special because he renown for his good mechanic work in the region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have any difficulty. He pursued this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation and have an independent work life. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. 
 
Abdel Karim is requesting a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise, such as tires, tools and oil, for his garage. Abdel Karim has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael A. B., de 57 años de edad reside en la colonia Los Conacastes ubicada en el municipio de Soyapango. Vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, una de 22 años, la segunda de 19 y el tercero de 15 años, los tres son estudiantes. Misael posee una panadería en su propia casa, en la cual colabora toda su familia para poder elaborar el pan y luego Misael se encarga de repartirlo a sus consumidores. El desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar un pick up para repartir el pan, así también desea aumentar su producción y para ello necesita tener las posibilidades para comprar más materia prima para su trabajo, es por ellos que solicita este préstamo ya que de esta manera tiene la posibilidad de mejorar su negocio y de mejorar la vida de su familia, ya que una de las mayores razones por las que Misael trabaja arduamente es para poder brindarles los estudios a sus hijos y de esta manera poder brindarles un mejor futuro y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Misael A. B. is 57 years old and lives in the Los Conacastes district located in the city of Soyapango. He lives with his wife and three children, ages 22, 19, and 15. Misael runs a bakery from his home and his whole family works together to make the bread. Later, Misael sells the bread to customers. He wants a loan to buy a pickup truck to use for deliveries, buy more ingredients for his bakery and increase his production. With this loan, he will then have an opportunity to improve his business as well as the life of his family. One of the reasons Misael works so hard is to provide for his children's education and ultimately provide them with a better future and better financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pickup truck

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Мавлододов Усмон житель города Яван. Возраст 26 лет , не женат . Работает в диллерском центре. Торгует пластиковыми картами , для оплаты мобильных телефонов. кроме этого торгует запчастями для мобильных телефонов. так же производит моментальные переводы оплаты за телефон. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы  закупить карты различных провайдеров. Это привлечет новых клиентов и даст дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Usmon M. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 26 years old and single. He works at a dealer center. He sells prepaid cards for mobile phones along with mobile phone spare parts and also provides instant payment transfers for phones. Usmon plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase cards for different mobile providers. This will attract new clients and provide additional income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone cards

loans.name: Nolvia Jaquelin

texts.es:
la Sra. Nolvia M. inicio su negocio desde hace un año y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, ella vive en union libre y su comañero de hogar trabaja para una institucion privada, ella es madre de dos hijos uno de ellos esta pasando sus estudios primarios, ella opto por buscar a poner un negocio en su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos y asi estar generando dinero tambien, ya que la situacion se ponia critica y solo a su compañero de hogar le tocaba pagar todos los gastos del hogar, ahora ellos estan mas nivelados economicamente ya que este negocio a sido una bendicion segun nos comento ella, en estos momentos su compañero de hogar empezo de nuevo a estudiar y esta saliendo adelante, ellos se sienten muy felices.
su clientela cada dia es mas grande y por eso ella necesita el credito para poder invertir mas en su negocio y asi tener una tienda con muchos productos.
texts.en:
Nolvia M. started her business one year ago and it is worth noting that during this time she has learned to manage the business. She lives with her common-law partner who works for a private company. She is a mother to two children, one of whom is in primary school.

She chose to set up her business in her home so that she could look after her children and also contribute to the family income; their economic situation had become critical and her partner was obliged to cover all household expenses.

She tells us that this business has been a blessing and now they are better off. Her partner has resumed his studies, they are moving forward and are very happy.

Her client base increases every day and this is why she needs a loan to invest more in her business and stock her store with many products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, rice, soap, sugar, coffee, sauces, soups, diapers, pasta, beverages, dairy products, embutido, meat, chicken

loans.name: Erick Jose

texts.es: Erick José Núñez Juárez tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es casado. Erick tiene 1 hijo y todavía no asiste a una escuela. La actividad económica es compra y venta de ropa. Erick inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa y su hijo necesitaban el sustento diario, a pesar de lo difícil que es su situación Erick mantiene la alegría con sus clientes. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es que tiene que recorrer muchos kilómetros en busca de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, calzado entre otros. A pesar de los difíciles problemas que enfrenta como las cuentas por cobrar. Los sueños de Erick son de proporcionarle a su único hijo una buena profesión para que se defienda en la vida.
texts.en:
Erick José Núñez Juárez is a 26-year-old married father with 1 child who has not yet started school. He buys and sells clothing for a living. Erick started this business because he did not have a job at the time, and his wife and child needed daily sustenance. Despite how difficult his situation is, Erick keeps a cheerful attitude with his customers. He has been in business for over 6 years. The most difficult aspect of his job is having to travel many kilometers in search of customers. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital to purchase undergarments, footwear, and other merchandise. Despite the problems he faces, such as having to collect payments, Erick still dreams of providing his son with a good profession so that he can get by in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “Poderosas”  es parte del Centro Focal “Villa Adela” cuentan con casi 1 año de vida, con 17 integrantes que tienen variados negocios como: confección de edredones, deportivos, mochilas y otras venden  cosméticos, verduras y fruta, las que se dedican a la confección necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima como: tela y forro, las que se dedican al comercio necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. A las integrantes de “Poderosas” les gusta confraternizar, así que todas se sirven un rico plato organizadas por su presidenta Mercedes C..
texts.en:
The Community Association called Poderosas is part of the Villa Adela community center. They have been in existence for one year. The members have various businesses like making quilts, sports clothes, and backpacks. Some sell cosmetics; others sell fruits and vegetables. The members who make products need a loan to buy raw materials like fabric and lining. The members of the Poderosas like to get together and have great food; the get-togethers are organized by their president, Mercedes C..

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material/merchandise

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre soltera y vive con su único hijo, quien tiene 15 años, estudia y le apoya mucho. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y pescado, según la temporada, en un kiosko instalado frente a su casa. El producto que le es más rentable es el pescado, el cual es de agua dulce, D. río que surca su ciudad, pero actualmente no es temporada, por lo que viene vendiendo frutas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se mantiene activa y es una labor tranquila. Además le es rentable porque cada día vende todos sus productos, debido a que se encuentra en un lugar muy transitado y Sadith se encarga de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes, quienes se sientes muy satisfechos por la acogida que les brinda. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que los integrantes son personas puntuales en sus pagos y se apoyan mutuamente. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más frutas y mandará a ampliar su kiosco, ya que necesita mejoras para dar una mejor vista a sus productos.
texts.en:
Sadith, 39, is a hard working woman. She is a single mother, and she lives with her only child who is 15. He goes to school and helps her a lot. For five years she has been selling fruit and fish, depending on the season, in a kiosk, which was installed in front of her house. Her most profitable product is the fish. It is fresh water fish from a river that runs through her city. But, it is not in season now, so she is selling fruit. What she likes about her work is that it keeps her active, and it is tranquil work. Also, it is profitable because she sells her products every day in a very busy location. Sadith makes sure she treats her customers well. They feel very satisfied with the way she makes them feel so welcome. This is her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her community bank is that the members are punctual in their payments, and they are supportive of each other. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more fruit and to expand her kiosk. It needs some improvements to be able to better display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her kiosk and increase merchandise

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! M. ANGELIQUE is seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company. For 7 years, Angelique has been doing salon services in the capital city of Rwanda, Kigali. She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm and employs 3 people to help her. She earns a profit of approximately 110,000 Rwandan Francs per month.

Angelique is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to help her buy more materials; with the increased profits that result from her loan, Angelique hopes to expand her services.

This client is married with 4 children with the following ages: 10, 8, 4, and 2, and she takes care of 2 other persons, 12 years old and 20 years old.

loans.use: buying materiels

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine is a dealer of personal products such as lotion, powder, dish washing liquid and other cosmetic products. She wants to earn money so that she could be able to sustain her daily needs on her own.  She is thankful because at her young age she was able to sustain her needs through the income that she generates from her business. According to her, she needs to purchase all the orders of her customers so that she could dispose it immediately but her capital is not enough.  In line with this, she is now asking to avail a loan of PHP5, 000.00 as additional capital. Cristine is hoping that her loan request will be approved to be able to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en: Lovelyn sells provisions and drinks of all brands. She is 32 years-old and married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is asking for a loan of NGN 120,000 in order to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and drinks

loans.name: Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Buen pastor esta integrado por cuatro mujeres inteligentes, capaces y con deseo de auto superación. La coordinadora del grupo es Isabel V. de 46 años, ella vende comida en el mercado oriental y desea poder ampliar y mejorar su lugar de trabajo para que sus clientes cuenten con un local apropiado para comer.

Las otras integrantes son Rosa María O. E. de 45 años quien vende producto avon y fresco, Melida Rosa G.  de 41 años quien vende ropa y Ana María Bojarge R. de 43 años, ella vende comida en su casa.

loans.use: comprar productos para preparar deverso tipos de comida como carene, pollo, arroz, tomate...etc

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak P. lives in Tralanh village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing five more piglets and pig food for breeding. Additionally, she wants to use the rest of money to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sae Vorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Hak P. is 57 years old and the mother of four children. One of them is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To purchase five piglets, pig food, and a cow.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, de 35 años, es un padre muy responsable y comprensivo, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es darle una buena vida a su familia.

El trabajo, para Javier, siempre fue una forma de demostrar lo que vale, él ha trabajado en varios oficios y nunca ha tenido miedo de realizar cualquier actividad, ya que siempre se sintió muy feliz de tener trabajo. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando como albañil, que es una actividad que el realiza con mucha destreza, motivo por el cual tiene muchos contratos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es construir casas, ya que siente que con su trabajo está ayudando a una familia a tener un techo donde vivir. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados tablones que usa para sostener los techos de las casas que construye. 
Para un futuro cercano, desea comprar nuevos materiales que lo ayuden en su trabajo de construcción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Javier con MFP, se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para no fallar en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de socias. Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará más puntales y tablones, ya que los que tenía están siendo utilizadas en otras obras.
texts.en:
Javier, 35, is a very responsible and understanding father. He lives in the house that he inherited from his parents. What he wants most of all is to give his family a good life. For Javier work was always a way to demonstrate his worth. He has worked at various jobs, and he has never been afraid to do any job. He always felt very happy to have work. He is currently working as a bricklayer. He puts forth great effort doing this job, and he, therefore, has many contracts. What he likes most about his work is building houses. He feels that with his work he is helping a family to have a roof over their heads. He has been doing this work for ten years. The most difficult part is loading the heavy planks he uses to hold up the roofs of the houses he builds. In the near future he would like to buy new materials to help in him in his construction work. This is Javier’s first loan with MFP. He feels very happy to have received the loan. He is prepared to work very hard to not miss making a payment. He is very dear to the other members of his communal bank. He will use the 1,000 PEN he asked for to buy more mainstays and planks. The ones that he had are being used on other jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for his work

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 37 years old and is married with four children aged between 1 and 9 years. She lives in the Rwamagana district approximately one hour and half drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. It is in this area where she has owned a shop selling foodstuffs since 2005, working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Dative realized that her profit is still too low to expand meaningfully and she believes that a small amount of additional capital would change that for her. For that reason she is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase some additional foodstuffs. This will enable her to attract new customers and increase her sales and (hopefully) profits as well.

With the continued success of her business, Dative will be able to continue paying school fees for her children and will be able to build a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase some additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie C. is 35 years old Kaing maker, happily living with her husband Rodolfo C., 40 years old, a fisherman. A Kaing is a kind of basket storing for goods, especially for fruits). In the long years of their marriage they were given three children: Lessie Rose, 13 years old; Zyra Rose, 12 years old and Bea Unice, 9 years old. Her children are all students.

The business is in demand, so they will be able to send their children to school. Naturally, Melanie and Rodolfo don’t want their children to experience what they experienced in the past. They want them to be a professional in the future. Melanie, in her own little way, helps their children to provide their needs in education. She has run a Kaing making business for three years, and she really wants this to continue and to grow more.

In 2007 she joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), and as a member she is entitled to loans. Every loan that she received was always used in improving her Kaing making business. Now her loan will be used to expand her business, because she will buy all the necessary things needed by her business like bamboo shoot, a roll bamboo strip and many more and sell it at a good price to the others in town.

She is hoping that her business will continue growing, Not only for Kaing making but she also wants to be involve in different businesses to provide good life for her siblings and family. In that way, she could help her children in sending to school, and also help them improve their status in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her Kaing (basket) making business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne N. is 34 year-old lady, married, and a mother of one child.

Anne offers typing and photocopying services in Likono Mombasa. She initiated this in 2005. She says the business is doing well as the number of clients has increased considerably.

She plans to expand her business by supplementing it with the sale of mobile phone accessories and electrical products which are in high demand. She has applied for 30,000 KES to buy stock of mobile accessories and electrical items.

loans.use: Buy stock of mobile accessories.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She sells garri (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava/manioc) and has been in the business for the past 15 years. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her husband is also a salesman. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000. With the loan, she plans to expand her garri business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and to be able to better provide for her children's education. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Phon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy P., 33 years old, is a coconut seller. She is the mother of five children: four are students in the local school while the other one is too young for school. Her husband, Mr. Tith Run, is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare field to cultivate rice. Since her business is going well, she would like to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy P. is requesting a loan from AMK to buy more coconuts to sell. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a bicycle and rice seeds to support her husband's farm.

Mrs. Chanthy P. is the president of this village bank of 16 people located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. The members will use this loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts

loans.name: Koffi Sosthène

texts.fr: Ce monsieur âgé de 52 ans est père de famille, l’activité génératrice qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille est le commerce de produits alimentaires tels que les tomates, l’oignon et autres, il exerce son commerce  près de l’abattoir du grand marché de lomé. Il a une  grande expérience dans ce commerce car il l’exerce depuis 1987. Son stock de tomates a diminué, de même que une partie des autres produits.Voulant se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 20 de piments et 80 sacs de tomates et d’oignons.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 52 years old and a family man.The income generating activity that allows him to provide for the needs of his family is grocery business such as tomatoes, onions and other items. He sells his items near the abattoir of the large market of Lome. He has great experience in this business having been in it since 1987. His stock of tomatoes and other items have gone down. In order to restock, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 20 bags of pepper, 80 bags of tomatoes and onions.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of pepper, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy toilet paper

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alfonso se dedica a la venta de granos básicos muy de mañana abre el negocio para recibir a su clientela y ofertar la variedad de productos, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado la estación. 

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de un maíz, bolsas plásticas y otros, ya que se lo ofrecieron a un buen precio.
Algo relevante del señor Pedro, es que cuando inicio su negocio vendía ambulante hoy en día tiene su propio tramo.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Alfonso sells basic grains. He opens his business early each morning so that he can meet his customers and offer them a variety of products. His establishment can be found at the station market.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy corn, plastic bags, and other products that he already offers at a good price. Something relevant about Pedro is that he used to travel when he started his business. Today he has his own place where he makes his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, plastic bags, and other items

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas K. W. is twenty six years old, married and has two children aged six years and three years old. His business is located near the busy Marikiti in Nairobi. He sells music CDs and movies. He has been doing this business for the last two years. He says that this business is profitable but the major challenge is that he lacks equipment to download movies as per the customer request. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy a duplicator to be able to burn CDs faster to meet customer demands. He wants to open another business like this one and later venture into transport business. He is a patient and hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase a duplicator

loans.name: Buddhika

texts.en:
Buddhika is a 21-year-old married woman living with her husband.  They do not have any children. They are living in the town of Akurassa, Sri Lanka. Her husband is providing her with good help.  

She has a business that consists of making and selling fish tanks. After attending school, she got started doing this business.  She is a young educated woman. She can demonstrate strong leadership in group settings and is a good team worker.  She does her jobs on time and is very honest. 

Buddhika is seeking a 20,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to expand her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop the fish tank business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and two children. They live in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She produces baskets, while also buying others for resale, and makes an income of about USD $3.50 per day. Her husband buys smoked fish for resale, earning an income of USD $4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. has requested a loan of USD $1000 to purchase more baskets. She also wishes to purchase more smoked fish in order to expand both her and her husband’s businesses. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to make repairs to her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva Field Partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy baskets and smoked fish for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and married to a businesswoman.  He has been operating John’s Music Shop for four years.  Formerly he operated another retail shop.  John decided to employ two people in his shop so that he could get time to run his Bodaboda (motorbike transport) business.  

John and his friends came up with a group and joined Faulu Kenya so that they could get financial support.  In this group, he is able to save his money on a weekly basis and he can be guaranteed a loan by his group members.  

He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  He wants to use this loan to add to his stock of DVDs, cassettes and video tapes to sell.

loans.use: To buy DVDs, cassettes and video tapes to sell

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Pheobe J. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and groundnut (peanut) paste and is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell.  Pheobe is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a clerk. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock fish to sell

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye L. est un commerçant qui vit à Kaolack la troisième ville économique du Sénégal .Son activité principale est la vente de pièces détachées motocyclettes .C'est une activité très rentable car kaolack est une zone carrefour et les taxi moto sont très développer.Monsieur L. sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses besoins en pièces de rechange car la demande est forte.Ainsi ,les bénéfices tirés lui serviront de gérer ses dépenses quotidiennes et l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mr. Mbaye L. is an entrepreneur living in Kaolack, the third business city of Senegal. His main line of business is selling motorcycle parts. This is a very profitable activity as Kaolack is located at the crossroads and moto-taxis are widespread. Mr. L. is seeking a credit to increase his stock of spare parts as the demand is high. The income will allow him to take care of everyday expenses as well as his children’s education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering his business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Luis Gutiérrez M.  es un  señor de 48  años de edad quien vive con su esposa y 2 hijos  en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Don Carlos y su familia   tienen aproximadamente 5 años en el  negocio de la lechería, así que Debido a su experiencia   él conoce muy bien acerca de  todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
En este momento el    desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera  aumentar  su producción de leche, con esto el   lograra  crecer  su negocio ya que la demanda de leche cada vez es mayor, y los precios de venta son muy buenos. 
Don Carlos  es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 48 year old man who lives with his wife and two children in a town called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the province of Cartago. The town is a small rural community of approximately 2,000 people. Its residents work in milk production and coffee planting. Its terrain is hilly and a lot of the land is moist like a tropical forest. The town has very picturesque landscapes that combine tropical forest with two pretty lakes, plantations and dairy farms. Carlos and his family have been in the dairy business for about five years. He knows from experience as well as from instruction from relatives over time how demanding this business is. He currently wishes to obtain a loan in the amount of $975 to buy a dairy cow in order to increase his milk production. With this loan he will achieve business growth since milk demand is increasing and selling prices are very good. Carlos is a member of the Asociación de Productores de El Sauce (El Sauce Producers Association), one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en: Priscila L. is from the town of Banga. She is a hardworking 50 year old. Priscila is married and has nine children. Most of her children are adult but she still has younger ones who go to school. To make a living, Priscila raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She wishes to improve her business and be able to sustain her children's education. Priscila joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscila has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Priscila is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Priscila from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also additionally offers savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Tacku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TACKU LIGGEY est créé  depuis la mise en place du Banc Villageois (GADAPARA) il y a de cela 11 ans. Le groupe est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. 

Madame AWA D. debout à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04enfants.
