Son activité consiste la vente de rafraichissement. Elle fabrique des jus naturels avec des produits du pays : pain de singe, feuilles d’oseille, gingembres etc. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en produits de base pour ses jus afin d’augmenter sa production de jus.

Elle participe financièrement à la prise en charge de sa famille. A partir de ses bénéfices renforce son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The TACKU LIGGEY solidarity group was created after the GADAPARA Banc Villageois was established 11 years ago. The group is composed of 9 women who all come from the same neighborhood. Mrs. AWA D., standing at the extreme right in the photo, is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her business consists of selling cold drinks. She makes natural juices with home-grown products: monkey bread, sorrel leaves, ginger, etc. Her loan will enable her to stock up with raw materials for her juices in sufficient quantity to increase her juice production. She contributes financially to the support of her family and will expand her savings from her earnings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her commercial business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora C. de 53 años es una mujer luchadora y de mucha experiencia en los negocios, hace 11 años inició la que hoy su pulpería y en estos años ha logrado introducir nuevos productos, tener mayor cantidad de inventario de cada uno de ellos, comprar activos que le ayudan en su negocio y mejorar la apariencia del local. Ella utilizará el crédito para invertir en la compra de sus productos.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora C., who is 53 years old, is a hard-working woman with much experience in business. Eleven years ago she set up what is today her general store, and in these years she has succeeded in introducing new products, having a larger inventory of each one, and buying assets that help her in her business and improve the appearance of the premises. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more products.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana tiene 31 años D. edad resiD. en San Miguel, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos D. las edades D. 7 y 4 años, los cuales dependen económicamente D. ella, ella posee un negocio D. elaboración D. tortilla y pupusas. 
El negocio lo inicio por la necesidad D. ingresos que le permitieran apoyar la familia, ella solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. pupusas como Son harina D. Maíz, aceite, queso, carne D. cerdo, entre otros. Esto le permitirá incrementar las ventas, generar más ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas D. la familia.
Los sueños son contar con el dinero para comprar su propia vivienda y dar le a los hijos un mejor sistema D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and she lives in San Miguel. She is married and she lives together with her husband and their two children, aged 7 and 4 years old, and they depend on her. She has a tortilla and pupusa business. She started this business following their need for a source of income to support the family. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make pupusas, such as corn flour, cooking oil, cheese, pork meat etc. This will allow her to increase her sales and generate more income to cover the basic needs of the family. Her dreams are to have enough money to buy her own home and to proviD. her kids with a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, cooking oil, cheese, pork etc.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia  B. is a 30-year-old married woman who supports her family by fishing.  She lives in Napulo, Brgy Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental and has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002. Thanks to hard work and loans from NWTF, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Rogelia has applied for a new loan, her 13th, for PHP 19,500 so that she can buy more materials for her business.  She has repaid all her previous loans on time, and expects to do the same with this one. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her fishing business

loans.name: Lucia Ivania

texts.es:
LUCIA IVANIA G.,Trabaja Como Ayudante de cocina en el centro capacitación alemán CECNA.
ha trabajado tres prestamos con ceprodel y tosdos estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa de habitacion.Ella va utilizar la plata en la mejora de su Casa de Habitación que piensa  comprar algunas lamina de zinc  casa de habitación y solventar algunos gastos familiares.
es madre de familia soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Lucia Ivania G. is kitchen assistant working inthe National Technological Institute named CECNA (Centro de Capacitación  Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán).
She has been granted three loans by Ceprodel, and they have all been used to make improvements to her house. She will use the money she is requesting to make more improvements to her house, as she plans on buying some zinc sheets, as well as to pay for family expenses.
She a single mother: her son attends school and is economically dependent on her.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Gloria Bicoy Group

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from Dimaluna, Ozamis City. She is 49 years old, is married and has four adult children. Gloria is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gloria B. Group. 

Gloria owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Gloria is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.







About Group Loans 

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Veronica

texts.es:
La Sra. María Verónica C. es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en el mercado Israel Lewite de Managua de venta de ropa, ella trabaja de lunes a domingos de las 7 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, ella es madre de familia de dos niños los que a su vez se encuentran en el colegio.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como: ropa interior, pantalones, chinelas, toallas.
María dice que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su negocio ha crecido y ahora puede competir con la competencia.
texts.en:
Ms. María Verónica C. is an enterprising individual who runs her clothing sales business in the Israel Lewite market in Managua.  She works from Monday through Sunday, from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.  She is the mother of a family with two children who are in secondary school.

The requested loan is to buy merchandise for her business, such as: undergarments, pants, slippers, and towels.  María says that thanks to previous loans she has received through CEPRODEL, her business has grown and she is now able to compete with the competition.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, pants, slippers, towels

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en: Wallace, 33 years old,  sells spare parts in Nairobi; he employs one person. He has been in this business for three years and hopes to open a garage in the future. Faulu has empowered him by providing relevant financial solutions to him to ensure he always has sufficient stock. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to increase his stock of motor vehicle paints and spare parts. Wallace is married and a father of two.

loans.use: to increase his stock of motor vehicle paints and spare parts

loans.name: Belgica Raquel

texts.es:
Belgica Raquel  G. S. tiene 33 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Belgica se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Belgica Raquel G. S. is 33 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has two children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Belgica has been growing corn, rice and beans for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own home.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: David Kivatu

texts.en:
David has been operating a general shop in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is a 28-year-old married to Monicah Wairimu. They are blessed with one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of KES 30,000 in-full and in good time. He plans to use the loan for increasing his stock in the shop to cater for the high demand of commodities during the festive season.

In the future, David hopes to expand his business to a wholesale shop in Naivasha town.

loans.use: For increasing his stock in the shop to cater for the high-demand commodities during the festive season.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Enrique; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes en Yanatile que queda ubicado en la provincia de Calca que es a una hora de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio también se dedica a la docencia enseñando en un instituto, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y pollos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "BUENA ESPERANZA" communal bank which is located in the disctrict of Cusco, Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Enrique is 48 years old and married, with two children.  He alternates his daily activity with the business of raising chickens and guinea pigs in Yanatile, which is located in the province of Calca, a one-hour drive from Cusco.  He also is a high school teacher.

Enrique wants to expand his chicken and guinea pig business and is requesting a loan to increase purchases.

He truly appreciates the loan and is committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky O. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Vicky is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products, including fish like milk fish and sardines, in the local community. Vicky has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vicky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and fund working capital. Vicky is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish like mackerel and salmon. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vicky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles S. started Black Diamond Services in May 2005. Black Diamond Services sells and maintains custom computer control systems that enable customers to operate household equipment through automated systems. For example, customers could operate their outdoor lighting or security cameras through computer systems. These automated systems also enable customers to access this equipment from outside their homes. Black Diamond Services specializes in customizing the features of these automated control systems to a customer’s needs and specifications. 

Charles employs between 2-10 part-time employees, the number depending on the contracts available. He is married with three children. Charles began his business in response to customer requests for high quality and good customer service. This led him to believe that if he sold quality products, backed them up with superior customer service, and paid attention to customers’ needs, then customers would be willing to pay a premium price for a premium product and service. Charles believes that his business has been successful because of how well he has done in these areas. That 99.9% of his new customers were referred by existing customers is testament to that. 

This loan helped Charles to purchase new computer control equipment so he could expand his offerings of automated control systems. It is also his third loan and the loans have helped him purchase new equipment and tools as well as increase sales. It is very important that Charles expands his business because he has seen an increased demand for his services from new customers. Without the loans, he would not have been able to expand quickly enough and would have lost those new customers.

loans.use: New computer control equipment to expand offerings of automated control systems

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El Señor  Orlando nacido en la ciudad Chuquisaca el 29 de enero, estado civil soltero, su objetivo de el señor es llegar  a  abrir una  gomería en el centro de la ciudad , para hacer crecer su negocio, lleva trabajando en ese rubro 7 años, aprendio este oficio debido a que su hermano Ramiro tiene la misma actividad y el le enseño el oficio de gomería, su crédito fue destinado para la compra de un lote de terreno que tiene como ubicación urbanización Amboro zona sur de la ciudad de santa cruz de la sierra, con el tiempo desea hacer construir ahí su casita y también su taller de gomería, es un joven muy trabajador con muchos planes para el futuro, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Orlando was born in the city of Chuquisaca on January 29th.  He is single, and his goal is to open a tire and auto repair shop in the center of the city.  In order to grow his business, he has been working in this field for seven years, learning about the profession from his brother Ramiro, who works in a tire shop and teaches Orlando about the job.  

The funds from this loan will be put towards the purchase of a plot of land which is located in the Amboro district, in the south of the sity of Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  With time, Orlando hopes to construct his house and his auto repair shop here.  He is young and very hard-working, with many plans for the future.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided to him.

loans.use: Purchase of property

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Eudulia

texts.es:
Eudulia tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia que está ubicada en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como luz o agua. 

Desde hace más de 3 años, se dedica a la venta de chica de jora, una bebida típica de Perú hecha de maíz fermentado. Prepara la bebida los martes para venderla los viernes y sábados en la parte de delante de su domicilio. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida.

Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de harina que usa en la preparación de la chicha de jora. También le gustaría hacer unos arreglos a la parte de su casa donde recibe sus clientes. Asi, podrá proveerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes y seguir creciendo su negocio. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles. Junto con los ingresos de su esposo, quien se dedica al cultivo de limón, Eudulia puede solventar sus obligaciones familiares y seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Eudulia is 27 years old, married, and she has one son. She lives in her own house located in Tambogrande, an agricultural region situated in the province of Piura. It is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the region of Lambayeque. She currently does not have basic services such as hydro and water.

She has been selling chicha de jora for more than 3 years, a traditional Peruvian drink made of fermented corn. She prepares the drink on Tuesdays to sell on Fridays and Saturdays from the front section of her house. She enjoys an established clientele.

She wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of flour, which is used in the preparation of the drink chicha de jora. She would also like to carry out some improvements to the section of her house where she attends her clients. This way she will be able to provide better service to her clients and to keep her business growing. In order to reach her goals she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 800 nuevos soles. She will combine it with her husband's income. He cultivates lemons. Eudulia will be able to keep providing for her family obligations and to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour to make chicha drinks.

loans.name: Actable The Best Group

texts.en:
Asha Hamisi, who is in her late thirties, is married with 5 children.  She has been running a salon since 2000. She works from 8.30am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Asha's second loan from Tanzania Limited. She used the previous loan to start selling fabric and sarongs in her saloon. She also bought salon equipment. She has paid back her loan successfully. She now hopes for a loan to buy salon equipment. Her dream is to, one day, open a food shop and sell at wholesale prices.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group, "Actable the Best", which has a total of 15 members. The group members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Asha is 1st on the left in the second row.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five young children who are still attending school. He is the main income source of the family. He has worked as a driver for a locA. company since 2007. His work consists in transporting the employees from their houses to the company and vice versa.  He has obtained two Kiva loans and was a very good client with prompt payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay for his children's schooling. His main purpose in life is to ensure a better education for his children.

loans.use: to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es: Don Urbano tiene 55 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y de su hijo en su casa que es propia. Es un hombre muy trabajador dedicado a velar por el bienestar de su familia y la gran responsabilidad que él tiene lo asumió, desde entonces se dedica en la actividad agrícola. Por más  30 años siembra granos y tubérculos como: papa, maíz y cereales en sus terrenos de cultivo, su deseo es superar su record de  producción, para que de esa manera pueda solventar su hogar y al menor de sus hijos que actualmente esta estudiando. En cada jornada de siembra y de cosecha siempre requiere la ayuda de su esposa y de peones que contrata y eso le permite optimizar su trabajo y ahorrar tiempo. Es su crédito número 6  que tiene con MFP,  confía en cada integrante de su banco común al porque a lo largo del tiempo ha demostrado ser responsable y solidario por lo que esta muy agradecido. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de abono para su siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Urbano is 55 years old and lives with his wife and son in his own home.  He is a very hard-working man who is committed to looking out for his family's well-being.  He took on the great responsibility that he has.  Urbano works as a farmer.  For more than 30 years, he has been growing grains and tubers such as potatoes, corn and cereals on his farmland.  His wish is to increase his production record so that he can cover his household expenses and the expenses of his youngest child who is currently in school.

Every day of the sowing season and harvest season Urbano always requires the help of his wife and laborers who he hires.  This allows him to optimize his work and save time.  This is his sixth loan with MFP.  He trusts every member of his community bank because, throughout the years, they have shown themselves to be responsible and united, and he is very grateful for that.  Urbano will invest the loan that he is requesting in buying fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potato crop

loans.name: Maria Caridad

texts.es: La señora Maria Caridad tiene 5 años con su negocio de venta de mercadería en general. Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en mercancía como es accesorios de belleza para dama, ropa, perfumes, cremas, shampoo, toallas, sandalias, pantalones, entre otros ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga este tipo de productos. El negocio lo aprendió con el propósito de salir adelante y tener un medio de ingreso para su hogar. Desea tener más variedad y estilos de ropa para satisfacer a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Maria Caridad has been running her general store for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of products such as beauty accessories for women, clothes, perfumers, creams, shampoo, towels, sandals and trousers among other items, since her customers have been asking her to sell these products. She started this activity in order to improve her living conditions and to be able to provide for her family. She wishes to acquire more clothes of a wider variety of styles in order to satisfy her customers’ needs and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of products such as beauty accesorie for women, clothes, perfumes, creams, shampoo, towels, sandals and trousers.

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Bok jom a été créé le 05 mai 2010.il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même village.
Elles ont comme activité principale l'agriculture et la vente d'huile.

Madame Fatou en position debout à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupement. Elle a 40 ans à  et 05 enfants en charge.

l'agriculture constitue son activité principale plus précisément la culture d'arachide. Cependant elle mène une activité secondaire celle de la transformation de l'arachide en huile.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des semences de bonne qualité et en quantité suffisante pour préparer l'hivernage.

Son objectif est d'acheter un matériel neuf  afin d'augmenter sa capacité de production.
Aussi elle désire participer à la gestion quotidienne de la maison
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok jom was founded on May 5, 2010. It has 11 women members who are from the same village.
Their main business activity is farming and selling oil.

Ms. Fatou, at the far right of the photo, is the head of the group. She is forty years old and takes care of five children.

Her main business is the farming of peanuts. However, she also has a secondary business of producing peanut oil from the peanuts.

The loan will allow her to purchase a sufficient quantity of high-quality seeds to prepare for the rainy season.

Her goal is to purchase new inputs so that she can increase her production capacity.

She also wants to help with the daily, household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Oktiabr

texts.en:
Mr. Oktiabr is 31 years old and a chef. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Oktiabr doesn’t own any land and his family live on his parents' property. Until the end of 2010, Oktiabr had worked as a chef at a restaurant for many years and he is an experienced chef.

 In January 2011 he decided to open his own cafeteria and at the moment he is renting a small cafeteria and runs it together with his wife. Oktiabr makes the dishes and his wife works as a waitress. The cafeteria is located in quite a crowded area and always full of customers. Recently Oktiabr built a greenhouse in his garden and he is planning to grow vegetables there. Nowadays food safety, especially vegetables are a big issue. Therefore Oktiabr is planning to grow his own organic vegetables and to use them in his cafeteria. He thinks it will save some costs and will attract more customers. The loan he is taking will be used to buy some good quality seeds and to process the land.

loans.use: To buy some good quality seeds to grow organic vegetables and to process the land.

loans.name: Dianne Eve

texts.en:
Dianne Eve is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 

Dianne Eve is making and selling homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Dianne Eve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is married with two children. Sheis 32 years old and lives in Plaridel.

Karen sells jewelry to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 1000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase jewelry to sell.

Karen has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Emelson

texts.en:
Emelson is 35 years old and is married with three children. He earns about 30,000 PHP each season as a rice farmer working in the Philippines. Emelson has been growing rice for the past 13 years. 

Emelson is requesting a loan to pay for farm inputs such as seed, fertilizer, and insecticide that are necessary in farming. In the future, he hopes to diversify his business in order to generate more income and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Nueva Luz Villa Fatima Group

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra presidenta del Banco  Emprendimiento Nueva Luz, es la líder que conformo el banco, enseñándoles los valores de puntualidad, honestidad, lealtad, solidaridad a todas sus compañeras que conforman el banco de emprendimiento. La Señora Sandra actualmente se dedica a la venta y compra de víveres, frazadas que los distribuye en pagos, vive en la casa de la suegra  en la zona de Chuquiaguillo - Villa Fátima, su trabajo lo desempeña de manera ambulante todos los días, tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en colegio los cuales no son barrera para seguir desempeñando sus funciones como vendedora, la señora Sandra esta casada, su esposo actualmente se dedica a ser de arenero en el rio de chuquiaguillo, el crédito que lo solicita la señora Sandra es para la incrementar la compra de mercadería, por tener muchos mas pedidos y generar mayor ingreso económico en su  familia y así poder comprar la casa soñada para su familia apoyando a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is the president of Banco Emprendimiento Nueva Luz. She is the leader who has formed this communal bank, teaching values ​​of punctuality, honesty, loyalty, solidarity to all of her colleagues who are are a part of it. 

Sandra currently purchases and sells food items and blankets, which she distributes to her customers. She lives with her in-law's at their house in the area of ​​Chuquiaguillo, Villa Fatima. Her work involves traveling every day. She has three children who are studying at college, which poses no barrier to her ability to continue her work as a saleswoman. Sandra is married. Her husband is currently a sand merchant at the Chuquiaguillo river. 

Sandra requests this loan so that she can purchase increased quantities of merchandise, helping her to generate many more orders and earn a higher income so that she can buy the dream house for her family and support her husband in managing the family's household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to support her work as a saleswoman

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen is a 60-year-old man who has been living in the Reussey Keo commune. He has three married children. One of his children is a garment factory worker and has a formal salary per month.  

Mr. Sen is a local fisherman. He has been doing this job since 2000 and he earns about $3.75 USD each day. He has no life partner because he divorced from his wife many years ago. Currently, he also relies on his daughter’s income. Mr. Sen has requested this loan to purchase a new boat. 

In the future, Mr. Sen trusts with his increased income, he will buy more fishing tools and decorate his old house.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat.

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver. She has one son and four daughters. She is living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Silk weaving is a traditional profession. Muon is asking for another loan of $300 USD to continue her weaving business by buying silk materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Relyn

texts.en:
Relyn is 26 years old and for 10 years already has been selling "taho" (a Philippine snack food sold by peddlers). This was taught her by her parents; she inherited the trade. Within nine years duration of walking a distance selling "taho", she concludes that, as long as you are dealing in this occupation with persistence, you can lift your life from poverty.


So, she is working patiently to establish a comfortable life for her family, especially for her two children. She wants to improve her "taho" business, and that’s why she is asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy soya, silky, soft and hard tofu, bean curd skin, soybean paste, and soy ice cream as ingredients needed for her business. 


She wants to sell a delicious yet affordable "taho" in order to acquire a higher target market to produce also a higher income. This will uplift their poor living from the hardship of life, and especially she will be able to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soya, silky, soft and hard tofu, bean curd skin, soybean paste, and soy ice cream as ingredients.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, el caballero Javier se ha dedicado al cultivo de frijoles el cual los vende en su localidad y por medio de este trabajo puede llevar el sustento a su familia. 

Es menester para Javier obtener un crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de los insumos agrícolas para mejorar su trabajo y así tener una excelente cosecha y así beneficiar a sus pequeños hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y por tal motivo requieren del apoyo de su padre.
texts.en:
In the town of San Rafael del Sur, in Managua, Javier's business is growing beans.  He sells his crops in his town and, through this work, he is able to support his family.

Javier needs to take out a loan to invest in buying farming supplies so that he can improve his work and enjoy an excellent harvest.  This will benefit his young school-age children who need their father's support.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for sowing his beans and to pay laborers

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Orlando tiene 49 años de edad y se dedica a prestar servicios de transporte Taxi, tiene 4 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, su unidad esta asignada a un Centro Comercial de la ciudad,  el cual es visitado por muchas personas, mismas que le solicitan el servicio, tambien cuenta con clientes que tiene por contrato mensual para transportarlos de sus casas a sus trabajos y viceversa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos, su unidad esta mala y desea reparala lo mas pronto posible para poder seguir ofreciendo un excelente servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar Orlando is 49 years old and provides taxi services. He has been in this line of work for four years. His vehicle is assigned to work in the central commercial district of the city, which is visited by many people who request his service. He also has customers who hire him on a monthly basis to drive them from their homes to their jobs and vice versa.

This loan will be used to buy spare parts. His vehicle is in bad condition and needs to be repaired as quickly as possible so that he can continue providing excellent service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Wangninangbe Group

texts.fr: WANGNINANGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un sixième prêt. La représentante du groupe, Augustine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Augustine est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Salami. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Augustine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Augustine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Augustine vend divers produits (sacs, savons, chaussures) par le système de distribution. Augustine mène cette activité depuis  cinq ans, ce qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Augustine achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité tout en la diversifiant, et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Augustine sollicite, avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINANGBE, un sixième crédit. Les crédits précédents ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: “Wangninangbe” is a group of three individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. In order to expand their business and meet customer demand, the group members turned to ALIDé, with the goal of obtaining their sixth loan. The group’s representative, Augustine (raising her hand in the photo), is 37 years old. Augustine is married to Salami, a businessman. They have two dependent children, both in school. Augustine lives together with her husband and children. Augustine never attended school. In order to support herself, Augustine sells various products (bags, soap, shoes) through a distribution system. Augustine has been working in this business for five years and earning substantial revenues. Augustine buys her goods in a town of Benin. In order to diversify and grow her business, and better respond to the ever growing customer demand, Augustine, together with the other members of the Wangninangbe group, is seeking a sixth loan. The previous loans have all been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, bags and shoes

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Marian tiene 48 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo,  tiene 3 hijos (22, 21 y 12), reside en la comunidad  de La Danta en Choloma, Cortés.
Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, sus dos hijos mayores están casados y su hijo menor esta en la educación primaria.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como granos básicos (maíz, frijoles y arroz), maseca, sopas, manteca, huevos y refrescos. Hace aproximadamente un año  estableció su negocio (mini pulpería) con la ayuda de un financiamiento.
Actualmente ha solicitado un segundo préstamo para surtir con productos de la canasta básica. Ella se siente motivada, ya que su nivel económico ha  cambiado, espera que en el futuro pueda apoyar a su hijo con la educación y logre graduarse en la secundaria.
texts.en:
Marian, age 48, lives with her common-law husband and her three children (22, 21, and 12).  She lives in the La Danta community in Choloma, Cortés.  Her husband is a bricklayer, her two oldest children are married, and the youngest child attends elementary school.

She sells food products like basic grains (corn, beans, and rice), “maseca” (instant corn dough), soup, lard, eggs, and soft drinks.  Approximately one year ago she established her business (a mini grocery store) with the help of a loan.

She has now requested a second loan to stock up on staple products.  She is motivated because her financial position has changed.  In the future she hopes to be able to support her son’s education and manage to have him graduate from high school.

loans.use: to buy staple products.

loans.name: 030702-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future.

Liên is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030702-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself.

Edwin has operated a nursery school for the past two years. His potential clients are his neighbors’ children. His major challenge is the lack of enough capital to hire professional teachers.

Edwin decided to join Yehu because it has fair loan terms and conditions. With a 20,000 KES loan he wants to purchase text books, desks and chairs for his school. He dreams of expanding his nursery school to include a primary school level.

loans.use: to purchase text books, desks and chairs for his school.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
 
Brenda provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy materials needed for giving pedicures and manicures.

Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to give pedicures and manicures.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is a 45-year-old widow with two daughters. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh city. 

Twenty-one years ago, Be established a stall to sell candies and breads in the local community. She plans to get a loan to invest capital in her business by purchasing a greater quantity and variety of candies and breads to sell.

She hopes that this will both enable her to attract more customers, and help her to earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more candies and breads to sell.

loans.name: Pauline Clémence

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans, Pauline Clémence est mariée et est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Pauline Clémence a un autre enfant à charge, en dehors de ses enfants. Pauline Clémence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pauline Clémence a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de vingt trois ans que Pauline Clémence mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et subvenir aux besoins des enfants. Pauline Clémence s'approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour élever le niveau de son activité, Pauline Clémence sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Pauline Clémence, 40 years old, is married and the mother of six children, who are in school. She has another child to support beside her own. Pauline Clémence lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. 

Pauline Clémence dropped out of secondary school. For nearly 23 years, she has had a business selling charcoal in her district. It enables her to support herself and her children. Her supplies come from northern Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to boost her business. Pauline Clémence is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loan were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Easther

texts.en:
Easther is 37 years old, married, and has two children ages 8 and 14. She makes soap to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as good because she has many customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Easther has been able to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business to a big soap-making company in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy chemicals for soap making.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for soap-making.

loans.name: German Oswaldo

texts.es: Oswaldo tiene 33 años estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos. El cuenta que el era albañil pero la crisis económica del país como esta dice que se quedo sin empleo por eso el tenia plata ahorra y  después se puso una tienda de víveres en su casa pues eso es lo que ahora es su sustento de vida para El y su familia. Su esposo le ayuda con el negocio pues se levantan las 6:00am a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela y luego  a las 7:00am abre su negocio. El anhela que su negocio crezca más y poderlo surtir con mas productos. Pues con el préstamo el comprara mas víveres como .arroz, azúcar y mejorar su vivienda etc.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is married and has two children.  He says he was a bricklayer but with the economic crisis in his country he ended up without a job.

He had money saved so he set up a general store in his house, which is what supports him and his family now.  His spouse helps him with the business.  They get up at 6 a.m. to leave their children at school and at 7 he opens his business.  He wants for his business to grow and to be able to stock up on more products.

With the loan he'll buy more provisions such as rice and sugar, he'll improve his home, etc.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as rice and sugar, and to improve his home

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 34, works as a motorcycle taxi or “boda boda” driver in Kampala, Uganda. Motorcycle taxis are extremely popular in Uganda because they allow passengers to avoid being stuck in traffic and to navigate the country's rough roads. 

Moses used to be a night cleaner, but likes working as a boda boda driver because, he says, it is easier to save money when you earn for yourself every day instead of getting paid monthly. 

Moses currently owns an old motorcycle and doesn’t have enough money to purchase a new one on his own. A new motorcycle will allow him to attract more customers, drive without worrying about mechanical problems, and earn extra income from selling or sub-letting the old one in a rural area. 

Outside of motorcycles, Moses cheers for Arsenal football club, and his favorite hobby is practicing studio photography. After paying off the new motorcycle, Ronald plans to use his increased savings to build his own house on a small plot of land he saved to buy recently.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace his aging one, attracting more customers and improving his safety

loans.name: Avec-Mali

texts.en:
AVEC-Mali is a women’s association based in Mopti, Mali with 74 members. The association engages in a variety of activities, such as selling clean cookstoves, teaching women to read and write and educating women about family planning.  

In July, nine women from the association starting selling solar lamps (seven of them are featured in the photo).  As of the end of September they sold 1,200 lamps and they have ambitious plans to grow the sales. 

Korotoumou (fourth from the left) is one of nine members of AVEC-Mali who sell solar lamps. She is 47 years old and has six children. In addition to her work with the women’s association, Korotoumou is the matron at a health center in Mopti, and she sells grains.  In July, she started selling solar lamps to fisherman, students and farmers, who are reliant on kerosene and flashlights for light.  With a solar lamp, her customers can save money.  Kerosene and mobile phone charging currently cost about $110 per year; whereas, a solar lamp costs $25 and has a lifetime of about five years.  These solar lamps provide 8 hours of light and can charge a mobile phone.

On top of being less expensive, solar lamps are more durable and reliable and keep people from stealing mobile phones. “With a solar lamp, you don’t have to go to a mobile phone charging station and give your phone to someone who may steal your phone or use the call credit you have on your phone,” says Korotoumou.

Selling solar lamps provides income for the women and for the association. The women earn $2 for every lamp they sell and the association earns $3.  The money the association earns is invested in a warehouse to store solar lamp inventory and motorcycles to distribute the products.

The solar saleswomen are well organized – each responsible for her own sales territory. They educate their communities about the benefits of solar lights and generate lamp sales through group meetings and demonstrations at night.

Since customers cannot afford to pay for the lamps up front, the women need working capital. A Kiva loan will allow the solar saleswomen to obtain solar lamp inventory from NOTS Lampe Solaire on credit.  When they receive payment from their customers they will re-pay the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy solar lamps that they will sell in their communities

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine  lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with five children. She keeps broilers and layers.It is now a sixth year since she started this business.She recently managed to get a tender to supply eggs and chicken meat to various restaurants in Ilala district of Dar es Salaam.From the current business she can not have enough eggs and chicken to supply these restaurants.In order to keep her customers Valentine buys these items from other poultry keepers and resell them to these restaurants,she earns a small margin of profit. She is in need of USD 750 to expand the business to meet the demand from the restaurants.From the loan amount she will add a flock of chickens,expand chicken hut,add more trays and medicines for chickens especially in this rain season.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Denga

texts.en:
E. Denga is a 51 year-old widow who supports four children in her household. She has two school-aged children still living at home and is also raising two of her orphaned grandchildren.

E. spent two years learning the art of dressmaking and has been offering her tailoring services within her community in Kisumu, Kenya since 1986. She specializes in women’s dresses and men’s shirts. Despite the stiff competition in her area, E. has always been able to keep old customers and attract new ones. She constantly updates her materials to keep up with the current fashions, offers a wide selection of patterns, and maintains a good stock to meet her customers’ demands.

She plans to supplement her income with small sales of beans and rice from her tailor shop. The profit from the sale of these staple foods, which require very little care, will help pay for school fees and other household expenses, especially during the slow season when orders are low.

loans.use: To expand her business and the variety of products she sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed for her poultry farming

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

José has only worked in agriculture; he has had crops of pigeon-peas and corn. Thanks to his more than 10 years experience, he has been able to support himself economically. Now he has a small shop where he works from very early of the day, gaining clientele and experience in the business.

Loan Use

Our friend José is asking for the loan to reactivate his sown land. He want to buy the inputs and products needed for his crops like corn, but his biggest investment will be the purchase of merchandise for his small but cozy shop, since he wants to work not only in agriculture but in commerce as well.

Personal information

At present José is 47 years old and he is married. His wife also helps him with the crops. They work every day for the well-being of their only son who is in school now. They have a cozy house with a cement structure, they have happily lived in this area for 20 years. He hopes that with the loan his life conditions will improve and this way he will serve better the community and relatives of his area.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

José se a dedicado netamente a la agricultura, llegando a tener cultivos de Gandul y Maíz, en la que gracias a su experiencia, que tiene ya 10 anos, a podido mantenerse económicamente. Y gracias a ello tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual se dedica desde muy temprano del día, ganando clientela y experiencia en el negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Nuestro amigo José pide el préstamo para reactivar sus sembríos, comprando los insumos y productos que requiere y necesita dicho cultivo como es el Maíz, pero su mayor inversión es en la compra de víveres para su pequeña pero acogedora tienda, ya que no solo se quiere dedicar a la agricultura sino también al comercio .

Información Personal

En la actualidad José tiene 47 anos de edad y actualmente esta casado. Su esposa también le ayuda en la agricultura. Ellos luchan día a día por el bienestar de su único hijo que ha llegado a procrear el mismo que actualmente estudia, las condiciones de su vivienda son acogedoras de estructura de cemento, felizmente tienen viviendo 20 anos en esta zona. El aspira que con el préstamo sus condiciones de vida lleguen a mejorar para así servir aun más a la comunidad y allegados de su sector.

loans.use: Invest in his shop and his land

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionisia is 20 years old, three children and is married to a field worker. She is an artisan who makes blouses, tapestry, pillows, wallets and purses. She takes these to be sold at the local artisans house. Some times, she also goes to a nearby town to sell as well. She belongs to the group Espina 3, togehter with doña Marcela Hernández Hernández (artisan). They will invest this credit to purchase threads and fabric for embroidering.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

DIONISIA, tiene 20 tres hijos, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el campo, ella es artesana hace blusas, tapetes, cojines, monederos y bolsas y los lleva a vender a la casa de las artesanías de su localidad y otras veces al pueblo mas cercano. Pertenece al grupo Espina 3 junto con doña Marcela Hernández Hernández (artesana).Con el préstamo esperan invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos de bordar

loans.use: Purchase threads and fabric for embroidering.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
To reach Florence’s business, you must go off the paved road for several miles. You will come to a very rural village where life is very quiet and pastoral. Cicada’s are heard in the trees. There is a pace to the day that is slower than the city. As in all of Uganda, there is always a stream of people walking, walking, walking.

Florence has a produce hut where she buys in larger quantities than a normal produce stand, but has less variety. She sells Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and cassava. People arrive with small plastic bags and she counts and fills their orders.

She has been operating the produce hut for six years and has been in a lending group for eleven years. She is widowed and has two children. Florence will use her loan to increase her inventory and sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and cassava.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O. is 45 years old, married with 3 children. She comes from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in LAPO for 2 years. Bose sells drinks and need the loan to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
42 year-old Margarita P.’s works every day selling food and providing excellent customer service . She has three children for whom she provides the essentials so they can continue studying and progressing. She is a single mother and despite having a huge responsibility to care for her children she has always shown herself to be capable of obtaining everything needed.

Margarita sells food in a hired place, but her aim is to construct a site form which to sell cold drinks: for this she needs capital, which will help her to realise her goal. She needs your help, to make her wish come true.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Vender comida y dar una buena atención a sus clientes es el trabajo diario que realiza la señora Margarita P. de 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, a los que les brinda lo necesario para que sigan estudiando y progresen. Ella es madre soltera y a pesar de tener una responsabilidad muy grande con sus hijos siempre se mostró segura y capaz de conseguir todo lo que se propone.

Margarita vende comida en un lugar apropiado, pero su objetivo es construir un local para la venta de bebidas heladas, por lo que requiere de un capital el cual le ayudará con el cumplimiento de su propósito. Ella necesita tu apoyo, para cumplir su deseo.

loans.use: Consolidation of her business and construction of a new sales space.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 35 year old Anna M.. She is married with five children, aged between 3 and 17. In 1998, Anna established a poultry business and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks for selling. She thanks you for your support.

Kuku means chickens in Swahili. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. Firstly, raising kuku require little start-up capital as you can start with one or two kuku, then either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally. Secondly, they require little space; therefore, you can let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, growing chickens produce eggs that can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks in bulk

loans.name: Kaddu Mukasa's Group

texts.en: Kaddu is a fisherman, a banana plantation farmer, and a businessman involved in buying and selling coffee. His main job is fishing in Kiyindi, Buikwe where he has three boats. He has been our client of one and a half years and the loans have really helped him in all his jobs.  With his previous loan, he was able to buy a new boat engine that helped him pay school fees as well as start a poultry business for his wife at home. He plans to buy another engine with this loan to fulfill his dream of constructing rental houses in Buikwe town.

loans.use: Kaddu plans to buy another boat engine as well as buy coffee and chicken mash.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia belongs to the community bank, Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, and is a liscensed veterinarian in the district of Chiquian, Bolognesi province, in the Ancash area.

With this loan of S/. 8,00.00 ($300), she will be able to pay for 6 dues, 5 boxes of vitamins, 5 antibitoics, 2 kilos of anti-parasite medications, 3 liters of another type of anti-parasite, and 8 kilos of fertilizer.

She is 50 years old, is married, has nine children, 2 of which are economically dependent upon her. Her other children are economically independent. Her husband supports her in the education of her children.

Tanslated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, tiene su veterinaria, en el distrito D. Chiquian, provincia D. Bolognesi, departamento D. Ancash.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 8,00.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 5 cajas D. vitamina, 5 sobres D. antibióticos, 2 kilos antiparasitaR., 3 litros D. otro tipo D. antiparasitaR., abono foliar 8 kilos.

Ella tiene 50 años D. edad, casada, tiene 9 hijos, dos D. ellos aún dependen económicamente D. ella, sus otros hijos son independientes su esposo la apoya en la educación D. sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy products for use in the business

loans.name: Luth

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Luth M.. She is married and has 3 children aged 9,12 and 2. She has 3 dependents who live with her because they are street children. In 2002, Luth established her red palm extraction business. Luth has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock of red palm in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of red palm in bulk.

loans.name: Abdul Qayom

texts.en:
Abdul Qayom, son of M. R., is a 48-year-old man. He is married and has 8 children. Now he is working in his own garden as a gardener in the Behsood district of Ningarhar province.
Abdul Qayom has 10 years work experience in this field. He wants to raise the current level of his income to solve his economic problems, so he needs to buy some stock and other necessary things. He applied to AFSG for 30,000 Afghanis loan and he will repay it in 24 months.

loans.use: To buy stock and plants

loans.name: Akinsanyan

texts.en:
Akinsanyan R. lives in the Iba housing estate, Ipaye, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells textiles, headgear, women's clothing, and the traditional Yoruba woven fabric known as "aso oke." After learning the business from her mother -in –law, Akinsayan opened her own business 10 years ago. Akinsanyan is 52years old and married with 4 children.

Akinsanyan has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She now needs a loan of $1,200 USD to buy add shoes, bags and aso oke to her inventory. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen baji is the wife of M. R., and they have a chemical supply business.  At their chemical factory, they create supplies for medicine and packaging.  Parveen baji lives in an area named Yadgar (famous historical place) in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. Her eldest son who is 21 years old helps his father in his chemical business. The next eldest son makes shoe soles on order. Her younger sons and her one daughter are enrolled in a local school in her area. Parveen baji is a housewife and also makes shoe soles on order. Parveen baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy materials (Zinc, Alum) for her husband so that he can extend his chemical supply business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her chemical factory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther was born in 1940 and is married and the mother of four children, two of whom are under 15 years old. Her only daughter, who was married, died after a protracted illness, leaving behind three children who Esther now cares for.

Esther is not educated and because of poverty, hardships and the death of her husband struggles to educate er children, clothe them, pay hospital bills and provide them three square meals a day. Esther joined GHAPE three years ago and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in buying and selling pigs and fowl, and farming of cassava. The profit from these loans has helped enormously in paying school fees and hospital bills and increasing the size of her farm.

With her latest loan, Esther intends to increase the size of her farm by buying more pigs and fowl and by farming more cassava. Her business is going to succeed because there is a ready market for her products. Due to her longevity in this business, she is well known in her community for raising healthy animals and has a lot of customers who come from far and near.

Esther plans to repay this loan in 18 months with the first installment repayment due four months after disbursement.

loans.use: Buying of farm seeds and rearing of fowls.

loans.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra actualmente en su décimo ciclo cuenta con 15 integrantes.

Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se pueden destacar la venta de minutas, bebidas, despensa, peluquería, además de venta de ropas, entre otras cosas el destino de los fondos va para la compra de materiales como telas, ropas, hilos, carne, aceite, verduras, kiosco compra de mercaderías varias.

Este grupo compuesto por 15 integrantes es bastante dinámico y organizado uno de los comité mas antiguos de la fundación.

La Sra. Francisca F. tiene una despensa que gracias a la ayuda de la Fundación pudo ampliar hoy cuenta con un stock interesante de mercaderías y tiene una tendencia a crecer.

El comité presenta buena relación interna y respeto entre sus integrantes.

Cabe destacar también la puntualidad en los pagos y asistencia de la mayoría de las integrantes a las reuniones. Las actividades que desarrollan estas mujeres emprendedoras se definen de la siguiente manera:

-Francisca F.,Despensa

-Ramona L., Venta de mercaderias varias

-Modesta S., Venta de ropas

-Marina C., Venta de comestibles

-Toribia L., Venta de ropas

-Julia C., Venta de ropas usadas

-Ana Maria G., Venta de lenceria

-Maria V., Venta de bebidas y ropas

-Maria Raquel A., Venta de comestibles

-Aparicia P., Venta de lenceria

-Eulalia D., Venta de comestibles

-Ana M., Kiosko

-Cinthia G., Peluqueria

-Mirian I., Venta de comidas rápidas

-Maria T., manualidades
texts.en:
This committee actually finds itself in its 10th cycle counting among 15 members.

The members are dedicated to various activities among which can be seen the sale of designs, drinks, pantry, a salon, as well as the sale of clothes. Among other things, the destiny of the funds will go to buying materials like cloth, clothes, needles, meat, vinegar, vegetables, kiosk buying of various merchandise.

This group composed of 15 members is dynamic and organized enough and one of the oldest committees of the foundation..

Mrs. Francisca F. has a pantry which thanks to the help of the Foundation was able to grow and today has an interesting stock of merchandise and has the tendency to grow.

The committee has good internal relations and respect among its members.

It can also show the timeliness of payments and the attendance of the majority of its members at the meetings. The activities which these women are involved in are defined in the following way.

-Francisca F.,Pantry

-Ramona L., Sale of various merchandise

-Modesta S., Clothing sales

-Marina C., grocery sales

-Toribia L., Clothing sales

-Julia C., Used clothing sales

-Ana Maria G., Venta de lenceria

-Maria V., Clothing and drink sales

-Maria Raquel A., Grocery sales

-Aparicia P., Venta de lenceria

-Eulalia D., Grocery sales

-Ana M., Kiosk

-Cinthia G., Salon

-Mirian I., Fast food sales

-Maria T., manualidades


Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma has been preparing and selling food in Zanzibar for one year. Through the snacks that she sells, she is able to earn a profit of approximately $55 each month. She is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she will use to buy more ingredients, particularly oil and flour, so that she can increase her output and sales.

Rahma is 25 years old, married, and has one 8-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients with which to cook food

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora A. has worked with her husband for 15 years raising and reselling livestock in their village.  They purchase calves in neighboring  towns, feed them and eventually sell them to local butcher shops when the cows are mature.  This is a job that Gulnora does with great care, because it provides her with satisfaction  and allows her family to live a decent life.  Most importantly, raising healthy animals allows her children to study in school.  Gulnora currently hopes that she might be able to develop her family's business by purchasing even more calves next season.  This would allow her to secure her children's education and professional careers.  Therefore, Gulnora is requesting a loan of $900.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is forty-six year old Tabitha B. from Mwanza. She is married with six children, between the ages of ten and twenty six.

Tabitha has been running a shop since 2005. This client’s business is selling cosmetics. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week. Tabitha currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy more cosmetics for resale. In the future, she plans to open a new shop selling clothes. Tabitha thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Mahmoud has been a barber for seven years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase a barber's chair. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud hopes that the loan will help him increase his income. He is special in his work because he is the only barber in his village and he knows about modern haircuts. His clients are men and teenagers of the village.

loans.use: To purchase a barber's chair.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel F., born in 1963, is married and blessed with four children. He has been a hard-working boy from childhood when he got a job. This job was very short since he was sacked from the job without any fault of his. He also lost his brother who usually supported him in paying school fees and the basic needs of the family. With these drawbacks in life, poverty set in as he now was really unable to maintain the living standards of the family. He then moved to a little two-room house. The school for the children was changed which made them trek very long distances as they even became sick and expenses grew. Faced with these difficulties, his luck changed when his friend introduced him to GHAPE in 2008 were he got his first loan of 400,000 frs which he finished paying back. He is now asking for a loan which he will use to purchase newspapers, firewood, and piglets.

He knows the business will succeed since his community is in need of firewood for cooking and also the pigs will provide pork and the pig manure will be used to improve land to farm food crops and vegetables to the community.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, newspapers and piglets

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en: W. Madina is the leader of the Musoli group in Jinja. She is a business lady involved in the fishing business; she has 2 boats for which she employs a man in charge of each boat though, at times, she indulges in the activity herself. She has been in the business for so long that she has been able to build a good customer base over the years. On each boat, she has fishing nets and hooks, and she would like to buy new ones since the ones she has are used up. She has recently bought a plot of land that she will use for agriculture then in future, she will construct houses for rent.

loans.use: New fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is 33 years old, married and blessed with two kids.  Currently, one is in school.  She is a fish monger who sells in a shed in the local market square.  She procures her goods at wholesale prices and has been in business for ten years.  According to Akosua, most of her customers are food vendors and households in her community. 

She lives with one of her children in a house in Anyinem, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Akosua believes the loan would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually improve her family finances.  She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Patience Trust Group.  Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: Procure fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
la Sra. Rosa S. se dedica a la confeccion de ropa para dama, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos estan casados, ella solo se ha quedado con su esposo. gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo logro que sus hijos obtuvieran el titulo de educacion media.
ahora ella se dedica a la confeccion y es la unica fuente de ingresos.
en vista que ella tiene muy buena clientela necesita comprar materia prima para la fabricacion de lo que le encargan y ella no tiene capital suficiente para comprar todos los materiales.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa S. is engaged in sewing women's clothing which she has been doing for several years. She is married and has three children, all of whom are married, so it's just her and the husband now. Thanks to her hard work, her children were able to complete their secondary education. Now she devotes herself to sewing which is her sole source of income. Since she has a very good clientele, she needs to buy the materials to produce the orders they have given her. However, she doesn't have sufficient capital to buy these materials.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, fabrics, thread, felt, buttons, clasp, and shoulder pads.

loans.name: M.c.a Primary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the M.C.A Primary School in Magburaka. Teachers of this school have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan. Teachers and other monthly wage earners come to SMT to seek a loan for several reasons: some use such loans to pay college fees for themselves, others use it to pay their children’s school fees, some invest it in their businesses or in their wives' businesses, some use it to buy pieces of furniture, and others invest it in building a house. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar will deduct the repayment amount of each teacher (borrower/group member) and deposit it with SMT’s cashier.
 
Amadu L. B. (left) is the head teacher at this school and head of this group. Mr. B. was born in Kamakwe town, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-nine years old and married with four children. All of his children are attending schools – some in primary schools and others in secondary schools. He has been a teacher for five years now. He will invest his loan in buying pieces of furniture, like chairs, tables and a bed.

loans.use: Buy pieces of furniture

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Margarita P. V. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de Secundaria, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de verduras y de comida rápida, cuando inició tenia un pequeño puesto donde vendía verduras, al darse cuenta que aumentaban sus clientes empezó con la venta de comida rápida (esto desarrollado desde su puesto y en su casa).
Recién ha iniciado como socia, y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Con el crédito de 300, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida.
María tiene como sueño poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
María Margarita P. V. is 28 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, in La Libertad, Perú.  She studied until the 2nd year of Secondary school, and has 3 children that depend on her financially. María dedicates herself to the sale of vegetables and fast food. When she first started, she had a small stall where she sold vegetables. When she noticed that her customer base was growing, she started selling fast food (from her stall and from her house). She recently started as a member of the Fighting Romans II cooperative bank. With the loan of 300 Peruvian soles, she will invest in purchasing ingredients for preparing food. María’s dream is to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Fidelia Buenaventura

texts.es: Fidelia Buenaventura Rodríguez R. de 46 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Y tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Fidelia se dedica desde hace 15 años a la costura. Por lo que cuando inicio solo realizaba reparaciones de trajes y con el tiempo se fue perfeccionando. Fidelia es una mujer muy bondadosa porque además confecciona trajes para niños muy pobres y los obsequia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de materia prima telas, hilos, botones, zipper entre otros. Sus deseos son de establecer una tienda en donde se exhiban prendas elaboradas por ella.
