texts.en:
Fidelia Buenaventura Rodríguez R. is 46 and married. She has three children who all work independently. Fidelia has worked as a seamstress for fifteen years. When she started she only mended clothes. With time, she was perfecting her skills. Fidelia is a very generous person; she makes clothes for very poor children and gives them to them. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy raw materials like fabric, needles, buttons, zippers, among other things. Her wish is to set up a store where she can display the clothing she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino actualmente tiene 6 hijos pero ninguno de ellos a su cargo ya que son mayores de edad y no dependen de el económicamente , su negocio esta ubicado en su propio domicilio el tiene una pensión y se atiende  de lunes a domingo, acerca de la competencia de su negocio no tiene mucha competencia ya que al rededor de el hay venta de panchitos (hot dogs) y de masitas pero no de una pensión ,el destino del crédito es para la compra de electrodomésticos el cual lo usara en su negocio y le será muy útil. Sabino cuenta con un crédito en otra institución financiera el cual lo paga bien y también es cliente antiguo en agrocapital y tiene un buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Sabino has six children, none of whom are dependent on him as they are adults and financially independent. His business is located in his home: he has a rooming house which he runs seven days a week. There is not much competition for business as nearby there are a hot dog sales business and a cookie-selling business but no other rooming houses. He will use this loan to buy household appliances for his business, which will be very useful. Sabino also has a loan from another financial institution which he has been repaying punctually in addition to being a long-standing client of Agrocapital. He has a good payment record.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household appliances

loans.name: Suma Yawar Group

texts.es: “Suma Yawar” es una Asociación Comunal con casi 7 años de vida, su presidenta es Teodosia T., ella menciona  que a las integrantes del grupo les gusta asistir a las reuniones porque comparten, hablan y se olvidan de sus problemas. La mayoría se dedica a la venta de ropa de niño, mujer y hombre y otras a la venta de calzados, huevo y comida. Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y así tener variados productos que ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Suma Yawar” is Community Association with 7 years of life. The Association’s president is Teodosia T.; she mentions the group members enjoy attending their meetings because they share, talk, and forget their problems. The majority of the members sell clothing for children, women, and men, and others sell shoes, eggs, and food. They all need this loan to purchase merchandise to be able to offer clients varied products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette M. est une femme mariée de 59 ans qui s’active dans la plantation  et le commerce de bananes. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter des intrants, du fumier, du gasoil et de payer la main d’œuvre pour la plantation de nouveaux pieds
texts.en:
Henriette M., age 59, is married and her business consists in growing and selling bananas. She wants to bolster it. The loan she's seeking will enable her to buy fertilizers, manure, fuel oil, and to pay workers for planting new trees.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow and sell bananas

loans.name: Sikiya

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! 

B. is 26 years old,he is single,he has an experience of 5 years in selling various goods as shown in his picture included. 

Sikiya needs his first loan from Vision Finance Company of 300,000 RWF. With this new loan, he hopes to expand his shop through purchasing more products in order to make more profit than before. 

Through accessing this requested loan, he will be able to pay for university and save for his future.

loans.use: more products

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 32 years old. Lovely is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lovely owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lovely has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lovely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Lovely is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Lovely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Diaminatou

texts.fr:
Madame Diaminatou Samaké est âgée de 35 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 3 enfants en location avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales, elle abandonna les études (en classe  de 6ème année fondamentale, système éducatif malien) de pour se mariage. Elle commença alors les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa grande sœur très habile dans le commerce d’articles divers. Elle travailla quelques années avec dernière qui lui  donnait de  petits articles à  revendre, quand elle revenait de ses voyages d’affaire de Lomé, Accra, Abidjan etc. Après ces quelques années d’initiation, Diaminatou opte pour le commerce d’habits, de sacs à main et de chaussures depuis maintenant 4 ans. Elle jouit d’une  grande réputation surtout auprès d’une franche de la population ayant un goût prononcé pour les articles de grands standings.
Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours au programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière, depuis 12 mois après un 1er prêt individuel correctement bien remboursé. 
Elle est à son 2ème prêt qui servira à acheter, 12 complets de bazins riches. Elle s’approvisionne très généralement sur place à Ségou et souvent à Bamako.(capitale du Mali). Madame  Diaminatou  Samaké vend au comptant et à crédit à une vaste clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA, ce qui lui permettra de faire face à  certaines charges familiales. 
Son ambition est d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation pour quitter la location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diaminatou Samaké, 35, lives with her husband and their 3 children in rented quarters together with other households in the Médine neighborhood of the town of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For socio-economic reasons, she left school after the 7th grade, Malian education system, to get married. She began earning her living together with her older sister who was very good at selling various goods. She worked for several years with her sister who would give her little things to re-sell when she came back from her business trips to Lomé, Accra, Abidjan, etc. After these years of learning to the business, Diaminatou opted for selling clothing, handbags, and shoes, which she has been doing for 4 years. She has a good reputation, especially with folks who dearly want to have fancy things.

In view of growing her working capital so as to respond to the demand of her clientele, she turned to the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with the latter for 12 months and reimbursed her first individual loan correctly. She is on her second loan which will be used to buy 12 outfits of expensive “bazin”. She generally does her buying right there in Segou and often in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). She sells for cash and credit to a wide clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA which will allow her to deal with certain family expenses.

Her ambition is to buy a plot of land to build a home on so that they will not have to rent anymore.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Ana Patricia R. ha iniciado a poner mucho empeño en su trabajo para llevar a cabo la reconstrucción de su vivienda el cual ha estado en malas condiciones desde hace mucho tiempo y por esto requiere mejorarla.

Es por esta razón que ella actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y la pintura para iniciar a pintar las paredes y de esta manera continuar con el mejoramiento de la vivienda y así brindarle excelentes condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo and department of Chinandega, Sra. Ana Patricia Rios is in the middle of reconstructing her house because it has been in poor condition and is in need of improvements.

For this reason, she has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase construction materials and paint so that she can continue with these improvements. These changes will provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & paint

loans.name: Celeste Alfredo

texts.pt:
Celeste Alfredo C. nasceu em Manhiça tem 56 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 7 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 18 aos 37 anos. 4 deles já estão empregados e 3 vão à escola. Para além dos três filhos responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa e consegue poupar 1.500.00MT por mês porque conta com ajuda dos seus filhos e do seu esposo.


Celeste sai de Manhiça para Vila de Namaacha com seu esposo este que foi transferido para trabalhar naquele Distrito. Dois anos depois da sua chegada ela inicia com o negócio de venda refeições nas barracas da fronteira que depois foram abolidas pelo Governo do Distrito devido à poluição do ambiente. Com ajuda do seu vizinho, que também era um grande criador, ela constrói uma capoeira na sua residência e inicia com o mesmo negócio e tornou se numa grande criadora de frangos. Tem criado no Maximo 100x5 caixas de pintos gastando 35.000.00MT e vende cada frango a 100.00mtx500frangos, cria em fases para poder vender alternadamente. Tem vendido a maior parte dos frangos a grosso, pois gastam menos ração. Rende cerca de 10.000,00MT em cada lote.

Aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT para comprar pintos de 1 dia e fazer crescer (aumentar o volume de criação para calhar com a época festiva que se aproxima).

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Celeste na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. o primeiro de 10.000.00MT foi usado para comprar pintos, o segundo de 10.500.00MT  também usado para a mesma actividade. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para adquirir uma carrinha que lhe facilitara nos trabalhos diários
texts.en:
Celeste Alfredo C. was born in Manhiça, she is 56 years old, married and the mother of 7 children ages between 18 and 37. Four of them work and she suports the other three that only go to school, plus a niece that lives with them. She's able to save about 1.500,00MT (U$ 50) per month with the help of her husband and working children. Celeste left Manhiça years ago with her husband, who was transfered to Namaacha. Two years after her arrival, she starts a business selling meals at stands in the border of the country, which were later closed by the government due to the polution in the area. With the help of a neighboor, who raised chicken, she started doing it herself and saw her chick raising business grow. This is Celeste's third loan in the amount of 25.000,00MT (U$875) which she'll use to buy more chicks and improve her business. She hopes to pay it in no time so she can ask for another loan in order to buy a pickup van to help with her daily work.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of chicks for raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech T., 37, is a military policeman. To help with the family’s daily expenses, his wife sells fresh fish in the local market. Pech is a good father with a young child.

Pech T. finds it hard to get to work because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. He is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a used motorbike which he will use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 41-year-old single mother of a daughter named Jane. She has run the P&C Beauty Zone and Executive Barber Shop since 2003. She has four employees and says her business is competitive. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a facial machine. 

Hellen describes herself as hardworking and smart in her work and says that since joining Faulu, a Kiva partner, she has made better decisions on matters pertaining to her business. In the future, she hopes to open several more branches of her salon and become a leader in her profession.

loans.use: Purchase a facial machine

loans.name: Carmen Dora

texts.es:
La señora CARMEN DORA S. V. D. C. tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito D. EL PORVENIR, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 6to D. primaria , refiere que es D. la sierra y que en su época los padres no se preocupaban por brindarles educación a sus hijos. Carmen es V.  y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores e independientes. 
Ella se dedica a atender la bodega que tiene en su casa y con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas, golosinas, gaseosas, aceite, fideos, menestras, etc.  para surtir su tienda.
Actualmente necesita un crédito D. 1,700.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos alimenticios para su bodega como: arroz, golosinas, leche, jugos, fideos, menestras, etc. y a la vez comprarà cerveza para abastecer su tienda por fiestas D. fin D. año.
Carmen sueña con aperturar una fuente D. soda en su domicilio el próximo año para lo cual està ahorrando y trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen, widow of C., is 56 years old, lives in the Porvenir District, in the Trujillo Province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the “Hope for Tomorrow” Community Bank. She has a sixth graD. education because she is from the mountains. In her parent’s time it was not important to educate your children. Carmen is a widow with five children. They are all grown and independent. Carmen has a small grocery store in her house. With her first loan of 300.00 soles she bought food products such as rice, sugar, milk, cookies, hard candy, soft drinks, oil, noodles, soups, etc. She purchased these supplies in order to proviD. a greater variety of products to her customers. Now she needs a loan of 1,700.00 new soles with which she will buy food products for her store such as rice, hard candy, juices, noodles, soups, etc. Also she will buy beer for her store for New Year’s celebrations. Carmen’s dream is to open a soda fountain in her house next year. In order to reach this goal she is saving and working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, hard candy, milk, juice, noodles, soups etc. and also beer.

loans.name: Ndeye Marie

texts.fr:
-Ndeye Marie D.
Madame Ndeye Marie D. est spécialisée  dans la vente de vaisselle .Elle a une activité secondaire qui est  axée  dans la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience  de plus de 5 ans dans son activité.
 Elle vit a la cite comico, une cite qui est éloignée  du marche de Ouakam. C’est une femme entreprenante  qui  après  avoir fait une étude  du milieu s’est rendu compte que la demande était présente. Ainsi elle s’est lancée  dans la commercialisation de ces marchandises précitées. Elle est mariée et mère  de 5 enfants. Son mari est un fonctionnaire en retraite.
Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de vaisselle. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de compléter la dépense quotidienne de tous les jours.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Marie D. is specialized in selling dishes, pots, and pans.  She has a secondary business that is centered around selling cosmetics.  She has over five years of experience in her commerce.  She lives in Cité Comico, a community that is distant from the Ouakam marketplace.  Ndeye Marie is an enterprising woman who, after studying the area, realized that there was a demand.  Thus, she embarked on marketing the previously mentioned merchandise.  She is married and the mother of five children.  Her husband is a retired civil servant.  Ndeye Marie is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for bolstering her inventory of pots and pans.  Her profits enable her to cover day-to-day family expenses all the time.  Continuing in its aim of participating actively in the struggle against poverty, U-IMCEC is succeeding with positive backing from lenders to support the people in operating their profitable revenue-generating businesses, which facilitate valued socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Augmenting her working capital

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith S., 43, is widow and lives with her only child in Batambong Province, Cambodia. S. is in the business of selling soy milk. She sells her products at a popular local market in the town and is able to earn a gross income of $33 per day. 

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family.  They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to take care of the necessary daily expenses. 

Therefore, S. is requesting a loan of $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more soybeans to produce soy milk for new and existing customers at the market. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy soybeans to produce soy milk to sell

loans.name: Esther Waithiegeni

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old and married to Francis, a business man. They have one daughter who is 3 years old. Esther has been selling clothes for the past six years. She also sells shoes as another source of income.

She was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. She is planning to expand her business by adding more clothes stock with the loan she is applying for. Esther intends to re-invest in the business with the extra profit generated from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to open another store, increase stock and employ more young people. Esther describes herself as an ambitious and honest lady.

loans.use: To expand her business and add stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of office supplies

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 39 años, vive con el padre de sus 2 hijos, en casa de sus suegros. 
Nueve meses al año, junto a su esposo, se dedica a sus cultivos de manazas, mangos y uvas. Pero los 3 meses de verano trabaja en un recreo campestre al sur de Lima, cerca las playas, donde le pagan buen sueldo. Pero lo que más le agrada a Jenny es el comercio, por ello todos sus productos agrícolas, después de cada cosecha, los vende de manera ambulante y a otros comerciantes mayoristas. Es por ello que para más adelante, con su esposo, planean enviar sus frutas directamente al mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad, ya que consideran que sus ganancias serían mayores.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido responsable con sus pagos y promete seguir siéndolo. Actualmente es la secretaria de su banco comunal y es muy apreciada por sus compañeras. El dinero que solicita esta vez será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus frutales.
texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old and lives with the father of her two children at her in-laws' house. For nine months during the year she, along with her husband, grows apples, mangoes, and grapes. During the three months of summer she works in a country estate near the beaches in the south of Lima, where she receives a good pay. However, what Jenny enjoys the most is selling which is why she sells all her crops on her own and to wholesalers. That is why, later on, she and her husband plan to sell her fruits directly to a fruit wholesaler in the city as they think their profits would be higher. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always been responsible with her payments and she promises to continue to be. Currently, she is the secretary of her communal bank and is well appreciated by her fellow members. The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for fruit trees.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Marlyn's Group

texts.en:
Marlyn A. is from the village of Brgy. Quirino, Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Marlyn is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and drinks for passenger in the bus terminal. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marlyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marlyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fairly used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old man who grows tomatoes, spinach, cabbage and other vegetables. He is married and has a three-year-old son. He has been farming for fifteen years and employs one other person on his farm in Kiseriain in Rongai. One of his challenges is transportation since his farm is about five kilometers off the main road. For other sources of income, Peter raises chickens for sale and has a motorbike taxi.

He wants to use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and a spray pump so that he can get the best crop yield.

In the future, Peter hopes to diversify his income to include raising animals. He wants be a successful farmer and own a large-scale farm. He describes himself as a risk-taker hoping to get greater returns for his efforts.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and a spray pump

loans.name: La Victoria Y Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de la Sra. Sandra Dávalos, quien se entero del programa por intermedio del Comité   Niño Jesús del Barrio Cptan. Roa, de la Ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo, la misma invitó a sus vecinas para poder conformar y participar del Programa de Comité de Mujeres.
 Ellas son independientes en sus labores asi como la señora Angelica quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles en un casilla frente a su casa ya que esta cerca de una parada de buces donde concurre mucha gente quiene conforman su clientela. Así ella se levanta muy tempreno todos los días para preparar sus comestibles para ofrecer pruductos frescos y así satifacer a sus clientes.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de un mostrados de vidrio con focos, ya que actualmente no cuenta con esta herremienta para mantener sus preparados, y agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda que les brinda.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Sandra Dávalos, who entered the program through the captain of the Niño Jesús del Barrio group in the city of Colonel Oviedo. She herself invited her neighbors to form and participate in the Women's Group Program. They work independently. Angelica, for instance, sells food from a stall in front of her house. It is very close to a bus stop where lots of people gather, and they form her clientele. She wakes up very early every morning to prepare the food so she can offer fresh products and satisfy her customers. She is seeking a loan to purchase a display case with lights, as she currently lacks one to display her products. She thanks Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the help they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food, beverages, and ingredients

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Isatu (who is pictured first row on the left) is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone with her husband and their four children. Isatu has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), for many years now. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to purchase gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock. This is the first time that Isatu and her group members have requested a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Xequemeya Group

texts.es: La señora Feliza González M., es casada cuenta con 2 hijas y 4 hijos  ellas se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, en el centro de San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán, y también cuenta con la ayuda  de su esposo, el se dedica al servicios, como ayudante de albañil, doña feliza compra su mercadería, y también se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos como ganando vacuno, bovino y porcino, y lo vende en el centro de momostenango, los días  de plaza como lo es domingo y miércoles, es la coordinadora de este grupo de señoras,  del Caserío Jutacaj,  Aldea Xequemeya, Momostenango del  departamento de  Totonicapán, son personas que trabajan, desde hace 8 años, han decidido ampliar su capital de trabajo , por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá,  para poderles financiar su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Feliza González M. is married and has 2 daughters and 4 sons. She sells french fries in the center of San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán with the help of her husband. He is an assistant bricklayer. Feliza buys her supplies in the center of Momostenago on the market days of Sunday and Wednesday, and also raises domestic animals such as cattle, cows and pigs, and sells them there. She is the coordinator of this group of women from the Jutacah farming village, Xequemeya, Momostengango in the Totonicapán Department. They are women who have been working for the last 8 years, and have decided to increase their working capital. That is the reason why they went to the ASDIR of Pologuá offices- to help finance their work and thus improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth P. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Ruth is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Ruth runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 31-year-old married man with one kid. He has been working as a pickup driver since 2005. Bilal’s pickup is his only source of income. He works with some contractors, transporting building materials from one place to another at an exact time and place. He is well known amongst his neighbors and villagers for his good reputation and honesty. Bilal also transports furniture and fills many other requests. He believes that he must work as hard as he can in order to secure a good living for his small family. 

This is Bilal’s seventh loan with Al Majmoua. Bilal makes a good example. Bilal is requesting a loan to do necessary maintenance on his pickup so he can be ready for any job. He’s also going to buy tiles to sell and to fix the floor of his house. His dream is to own a big cement factory and he hopes to achieve it.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his pickup

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel R. es una mujer joven de 27 años quien era integrante de un grupo solidario el cual se separó por la decisión de sus socias de ya no seguir con los créditos de manera grupal; así ella tomó esa misma decisión pues “no podía confiar en cualquiera para formar un grupo”. Ella inició hace 5 años una pequeña pulpería la cual no ha crecido mucho, sin embargo ella no pierde las esperanzas de convertirla un día en una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
María Isabel R. is a 27-year old woman who was part of a community bank group, which broke up when they decided to no longer seek group loans. So María decided that she "could not trust just anyone when forming a group." Five years ago she started a small grocery store, which has not grown too much. She still hopes to one day become a larger distributor of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Nery Del Socorro

texts.es: La  Sra. Nery del Socorro A. S.   ella  es Trabajadora del colegio público “Emmanuel Mongalo y Rubio S. Norte” de San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte año de trabajar para el magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en Edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la reparación del techo de su cocina y levantado de muro de la misma, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Nery del Socorro A. S. is an employee of the public school, Emmanuel Mongalo y Rubio S. Norte, in San Rafael del Sur. She works as an elemenary school teacher and has worked in teaching for 21 years. She is currently married and has a school-aged son. She has had seven loans with CEPRODEL and she has used them to purchase construction materials to improve the house in which she lives. She is requesting this loan to repair the roof of her kitchen and raising the wall as well. The loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her in a great way since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: quarry stone, cement, zinc sheets, beams, etc.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia F. is 46 and married with three children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam.  Telesia has three years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of 1500 Talas to buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated $104 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Telesia joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Telesia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui E., age 30, lives with her husband, daughter and grandmother in Hentiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a ger on a small plot of land which they rent. Her daughter attends middle school while her husband works as a herder. The family owns 153 head of livestock.

Since 2009 Nergui has been operating a clothing repair service in a small rented workplace in Uguuj trade center in town. She makes and sells a variety of clothing items. Her business has grown quickly within a short period and has garnered many permanent customers.

Nergui is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase more sewing materials for her business. She is a hardworking and generous woman. In the future, she plans to purchase necessary tools and equipment for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Nhuan

texts.en: Nhuan T. N. is 50 years old and has 2 children who are of working age. She has been running a shop that sells construction materials since 2005. Her business developed more when she accessed a loan from our credit program in 2006. She meets all the demand of customers in Dong Anh town. Therefore, she can make 5,000,000 VND profit per month from this business. Currently, she wants a loan of 7,630,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
NORBERTO C.,trabaja como Vigilante en el mercado Commema Mayoreo de Managua, es padre de familia de un niño y este se encuentra en el colegio, el prestamo solicitado es para solventar agunos gastos medicos.
ha trabajado dos prestamos con ceprodel y estos hansido para salud y su vivienda.
texts.en:
Norberto C. is a security guard working for COMMEMA* at the Wholesale Market of Mangua. He is a family man, and he has a son who is attending college. The loan he is requesting will be used to settle a few medical expenses.
He has already been granted two loans by Ceprodel, and they both have been used for health expenses and for his house.

<cite>* COMMEMEA is the acronym for “Corporación Municipal de Mercados de Managua” (Managua Municipal Markets Corporation)</cite>

loans.use: To settle medical expenses.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald M. is 34 years old and runs a motorcycle transport business as his primary business.  He also sells eggs as his secondary business. He is married to Rose Muthoki and together they have two children, aged seven years and six months. Gerald has been running these two businesses for 4 years and he gets a monthly profit of Kshs 6000.

He was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. With the loan he plans to increase the stocks of eggs in his secondary business and if the loan boosts his business he plans to expand it to a wholesale shop.

Gerald describes himself as hard-working and dreams of having a big wholesale shop and many motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of eggs

loans.name: Sara Priscila

texts.es:
Sara Priscila S. Z. tiene 35 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Sara se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 10 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Sara Priscila S. Z. is 35 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 4 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Sara has been growing corn, rice and beans for 10 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own house and plot of land.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 22-year-old businessman who sells shoes. Besides that, he does mobile phone repairs as a part-time job for extra income. He works hard in his business so as to provide for his wife and his 7-year-old child. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances by saving his money on weekly basis. He aspires to be a successful businessman in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to add to his stock of shoes so that he may increase sales during the festive season when the demand is high.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Fanuel

texts.en: Fanuel is 42 years old, married, and blessed with two children.  He earns his living as a contractor.  He also owns a workshop where he makes furniture.   Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy tools for his construction work, thanks to his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business to other areas to increase his income.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy glass and paint.

loans.use: To buy glass and paint

loans.name: Yaseli

texts.es:
Yaseli es socia del Banco Comunal Mollecito de Covadonga, tiene 22 años, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, para damas, caballeros, niños. Yaseli tiene un puesto en el Mercado de Covadonga, lo de la venta de ropas de vestir lo aprendió de sus padres, ingresos al Banco Comunal por invitación de su mamá. Yaseli solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para surtir su mercadería.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder dar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Yaseli is a member of the Communal Bank “Mollecito de Covadonga”. She is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Yaseli sells clothing for women, men, and children. She has a stand at the Covadonga Market. Yaseli learned how to sell clothes from her parents. She joined the Communal Bank after being invited by her mother.

Yaseli is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of clothing so that she can restock her inventory. Her dreams include seeing her business grow and providing a good education for her child.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy peanuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Marelin

texts.en:
Marelin S., 42, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business.  She is separated from her husband and thus works hard to earn a living for herself and her child. She and her child live in Maricaban, Pasay City.

Running a sari-sari (variety) store is Marelin's occupation. She has run this small-scale business for two years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood when it comes to popular brands of food, shampoo, and drinks.  She also sells some children's toys, accessories, and kitchen merchandise.  Because of her expertise in this field, she earns at least Php10,000 monthly.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request a Php14,000 loan. She intends to use this loan to buy more quality merchandise to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Marelin is doing everything she can in order to see her business grow and expand. She wants to become successful in life, be it in her family life or in her business.  She prays for good health and a happy life.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim K. is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for her sister. Shamim lives in the Kisasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda, in a home that she owns; she does not have access to electricity or to piped water.

Shamim sells roasted maize. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. The main business challenge for Shamim is transportation.

Shamim has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more maize. Her goal is to do well in her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for roasting

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 26-year-old resident of Paynesville, attended school and completed seventh grade. She lives with her boyfriend and their seven-year-old child who she is proud to be sending to a local school.

For three-and-a-half years, Lucy has been making and selling donuts, a business that is not as steady as she would like it to be, with periodic losses along with the gains. Lucy, who learned how to prepare donuts from her mother, is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and coal. In the future she wants to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and coal

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline B. is from the city of P-4, Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is 26 years old. Jacqueline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a fishing business. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jacqueline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing engine purchase additional fishing net. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jacqueline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine and purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia C. Pérez, vive en coapilla estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con cuatro hijos que ya todos están casados y la apoyan con los ingreso de su hogar.

    Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos de granja, para luego  venderlo en la  misma localidad, en esta  actividad lleva diez años y dos meses, en donde nos cometa que le va bien y solicito el préstamo  para poyarse con la compra de  más pollos por reja dos veces a la semana.

   Nos comenta que  su motivos este trabajo  fue la necesidad ya que su esposo la abandono con sus hijos pequeños y busco la manera  de cómo poder trabajar, así solventar sus gastos que se generaban en su familia y gracias adiós logro sacarlo adelante.

   Lo único   que más desea es seguir trabajando y con la bendición  de Dios  continuar en el préstamo para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Julia Carballa Pérez lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She's a single mother with 4 children, all of whom are married and help her out with the household finances.

Julia earns her living buying poultry, which she later sells within her own community.  She's been in business for ten years and two months  She tells us it's going well and that she's seeking a loan so she can buy crates of chickens twice a week.

She says she's works like this because her husband abandoned her and the kids and she was looking for a way to work to pay off household expenses and, thank God, she managed to make it.

The only other thing Julia wants is to keep working and, God willing, continue to get loans so she can keep going.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens to dress and sell.

loans.name: Walter Efren

texts.es:
Walter de 27 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y tienen 2 hijos de 5 y 6 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Su actividad comercial a la venta de libros.

Trabajo como guardián y sufrió un accidente por lo cual tuvo que dejar su trabajo y un hermano tenia un negocio y se lo recomendó y así fue como empezó su actividad comercial. Labora desde las 6H00 am a 18H00 pm recorriendo por todo su sector promocionando su libros. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas materiales para sus venta (libros cristianos). En un futuro desea terminar su casa y abrir una librería cristiana y ayudar a sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Walter is 27 years old and lives in a peri-urban area of Fortín de Guayaquil.  His wife takes care of the housework and they have two children aged 5 and 6 who are studying in public elementary schools.  Walter's business activity is selling books.

Walter used to work as a security guard but he suffered an accident which meant that he had to leave his job.  One of his brothers had a business and recommended it to him.  This is how Walter started his own business.  He works from 6.00am to 6.00pm, promoting his books throughout his area.  With the help of this loan, he would like to buy more materials to sell (Christian books).  In the future, he would like to finish building his home, open a Christian bookstore and help his children until they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy Christian books

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, a 32-year-old, lives with his wife and their 5-year-old child who goes to school. Paul started his business by selling little goods such as sweets, pens and handkerchiefs. Four years ago, he was able to raise enough money and he opened a retail shop and added stock. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for financially supporting him.

Paul hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested a 60,000 KES loan to buy sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. Fayza has owned a grocery store in Ain since 15 years ago.

Fayza is a smart, hard worker; she opened her shop next to a school where she can benefit the whole school season from students and parents buying their goods from her shop. In addition to students and parents, most of her customers are relatives, neighbors and friends.

Fayza is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to increase her shop's capital through summer beverages and ice cream. The summer season is also a good season for Fayza since most of Ain's population comes back from Beirut to enjoy their summer vacation.

Fayza hopes to stay healthy and continue working and expanding her business.

loans.use: to increase her shop's capital through summer beverages and ice cream.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
She is 29 Age.  She has 5 Children.  3 are in school.

her husband is a church leader .  She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past five years, Francis has operated a tailoring business; his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. His faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Francis dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future.

Francis plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials and renovate his business premises. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve the business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She works hard to support her family. 
Corazon has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.
In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales se hallan cursando la educación secundaria. Ella se define como una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, comenta que todo lo que realiza es por el bien de sus hijos y por darles un mejor futuro.
Ella tiene una despensa hace aproximadamente 10 años. De a poco y con mucho sacrificio ha logrado ir creciendo con su negocio. Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, en especial los fines de semana, que es cuando tiene más demanda.
Trabaja de forma conjunta con su marido, por lo que el negocio es un poco más ameno. Sueña con poder seguir creciendo y poder tener una tienda más amplia donde pueda ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra carnes, lácteos, hortalizas, panificados y demás para el abastecimiento de su local de bebidas. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are finishing high school. Teresa defines herself as a determined and hardworking woman. She says that everything she does is geared toward providing for her children’s welfare and giving them a better future.

Teresa has managed a food pantry for approximately 10 years. Gradually over time and with great sacrifice, she was able to grow her business. She says that she has a good number of customers, especially on the weekends when there is more demand.

Teresa and her husband work together, which makes managing their business a bit more fun. She dreams of continuing to grow and having a larger store where her customers are more comfortable.

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy meats, dairy products, vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other items to restock her shop. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy meats, dairy products, vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year.  She is 33 years old, married to Kajiwe, and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She has been loaned KES 40,000. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow and sell the milk to the local processing farm.

In future, Susan hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a married man with 3 children. He sells new garments like trousers, shirts and shoes in Bushenyi, which is in the west of Uganda. From this business, Deus generates profits of about 300,000 UGX per month. He established this business 3 years ago. He also sells coffee which earns him additional income. Before this, Deus was involved in the sale of agricultural produce. He plans to use this Kiva loan to purchase more garments to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more garments for resale

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a truck driver at the Tavan Tolgoi LLC. Her daughter is a high school student. Her son goes to the kindergarten. 

She started her business in 2009 by selling clothes at the local market. Starting from this year, she changed her place to the Buyan market and is now selling clothes there. She has already gained several years of practical experience. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She is an open-minded person who says, "This new market is more profitable and there are many customers. I want to expand my business." 

She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to buy winter clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is from the village of Bugallon. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail store in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 18 years.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Doña  Maria tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la Aldea el Zapote y se dedica a la cria de cerdos, su negocio lo  tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, Maria desea estar preparada para la epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se venden los cerdos enteros, desea comprar cerdos para tenernos bien gorditos y asi dentro de dos meses venderlos y obtener buenas ganancias.
Maria en sus tiempos libres  visita la iglesia de su comunidad.
texts.en:
María, 41, lives in Aldea El Zapote and works raising pigs.  Her business is at her house.

María wants to be prepared for the Christmas season, which is when whole pigs are most in demand.  She wants to buy pigs to have them really fat and sell them within two months to make a good profit.

María likes to visit the church in her community in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be hardworking and determined. He operates a shoe sales business, where he sells shoes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more shoes to meet demand, especially during this festive season. His business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes.

loans.name: Adilaida

texts.en:
Adilaida is 53 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with 7 children. 
Adilaida has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
Adilaida has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and blessed with two school age children. 

For the last five years, he has sold sand to make a living.  He also rents houses to generate more income. 

Francis has been able to retain his business because he has a good reputation with his customers.  

He has employed two people.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

Francis has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sand for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sand for resale.

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOMPASSEKDE  est la représentante du groupe TONGNOOMA. Elle est mariée  et n’a pas d’enfant. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des  vêtements prêt à porter pour  femmes, filles et garçons depuis  03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10 en ville .Ses clients sont  les femmes, les filles et les enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02douzaines de hauts pour femmes et filles et 10 complets de tenus pour enfants.

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne  acquérir un motocycle et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: SOMPASSEDKE is the facilitator of the TONGNOOMA group.  She is married and has no children.  Although she does not have school-age children she financially supports one person.  She has been selling clothes for women, girls and boys for 3 years.  She buys her merchandise at the 10th district market, in town.  Her customers are women, girls and children.  She would like to buy 2 dozen tops for women and girls and 10 complete outfits for children.  She is saving her profits in order to increase the size of her business.  Her goal is to buy a motorized bicycle and to help pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy 2 dozen tops for women and girls and 10 complete outfits for children.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.  Nida has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, blouses and jeans. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Nida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: To

texts.en:
To is a 44-year-old married woman with three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To and her husband have been running a business for nearly twenty years that makes the paper ornaments that are burnt as offerings on religious and ceremonial occasions in Vietnam. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials, papers and glues to make a larger number of ornaments. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and meet the higher level of demand that occurs at the end of the year. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials, paper and glues to make ornaments

loans.name: Dagbessi Blandine

texts.fr: Dagbessi Blandine est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Soubérou. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants de Dagbessi Blandine sont scolarisés. Dagbessi Blandine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants, et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Dagbessi Blandine a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Dagbessi Blandine mène comme activité depuis cinq ans environs, la vente de boissons à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Dagbessi Blandine vend des tissus. Dagbessi Blandine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Dagbessi Blandine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédit reçu antérieurement par Dagbessi Blandine a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Dagbessi Blandine is 27 and is married to a man named Soubérou. They have 3 dependent children, 2 of whom are their own. All of Dagbessi Blandine's children go to school. Dagbessi Blandine and her husband live with their children. They both take care of the family financially. She quit school at the secondary level. To meet the financial needs of her family, Dagbessi Blandine has been selling drinks at home for about 5 years. In addition to that, she sells fabrics. Dagbessi Blandine buys her supplies from Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Dagbessi Blandine is applying for a second loan from ALIDÉ. Her previous loan has been paid back.

loans.use: to buy drinks and fabrics.

loans.name: Akol

texts.en:
Akol is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan. 

Akol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beans. She will use the extra income she generates as a result of this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Moises Walter

texts.es:
Moises tiene 36 años de edad, es un hombre que a pesar de las adversidades por las cuales ha pasado sigue luchando día a día para salir adelante, sobre todo porque con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. La vivienda de Moises se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y acogedor, asimismo  se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, entre otros.
 
Desde muy temprano por las mañanas Moises sale a trabaja en una mototaxi, ya que el ofrece sus servicios de transporte por las calles de la ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que esta saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es amable con los clientes y porque conduce de manera responsable.

Moises está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y también un reforzamiento de puertas ya que de esta manera las puertas estarán bien aseguradas y dará mas seguridad a los clientes, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Moises is 36 years old. In spite of the adversity he has passed through, he is a man that continues fighting to get ahead, day after day, above all because with the fruit of his labor he supports his parents with their living expenses. Moises's home is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having a very warm and cozy climate.  It is also an area where a lot of agriculture is developed, especially the cultivation of grapes and asparagus, among other things.
 
Moises goes out to work in a motortaxi very early in the mornings, offering his transport services in the streets of the city. He works about 8 hours a day and can attend to up to 20 clients each day; he believes that he is getting ahead with his work because he is friendly with the clients and because he drives in a responsible manner.

Moises is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their great help he will be able to perform general maintenance of his vehicle and also the reinforcement of the doors, as this way the doors will be very secure and will be safer for the clients. In this way he will be able to improve his income and keep fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: "To own his own house."

loans.use: to perform general vehicle maintenance and reinforcement of the doors.

loans.name: Mahouna Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUNA est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier et mènent des activités complémentaires. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mélanie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a très peu fréquentée l’école. Mélanie est âgée de 24 ans et vit au Bénin. Mélanie est mariée a un certain Fatai. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Mélanie vend depuis sept ans de l’amidon. Mélanie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mélanie ensemble avec les membres du  groupe MAHOUNA, sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter de l'amidon.

loans.name: Kassandra

texts.en:
Kassandra has had a small diner for over 8 years. She and her husband started off by selling “empanadas” (beef and chicken turnovers) and they progressively grew from there. Kassandra’s husband worked as an electrician and a handy man but is now fully dedicated to the restaurant. He built the grill they use to cook their meats himself and has also made other physical improvements to the location on his own.

They run their operation out of their home and offer a variety of typical Ecuadorian foods including barbecued meats. They are seeking this loan in order to invest in raw ingredients and foods. Kassandra is 27 years old and does not have any children. She aspires to make improvements to her home and the business with the extra profits.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Kassandra wants to make improvements to her small restaurant

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli is 23 year old. She has been working on her bamboo hat weaving business for a long time. However, in the past she had to borrow money to buy raw materials. With a loan from MBK, she could purchase more bamboo using cash than she can now. From MBK, she has requested $50 working capital, part of which was will be used for her hat weaving business. She will use the rest as a farming fund to plant cassava. She sells her finished products once a week to a collector that comes to her home.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to buy more bamboos

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina used to work at the local TV station. She is lively and likes to communicate with people. After her marriage, her husband did not allow her to work there anymore. Now she works at the local market and sells perfume. But Zarrina wants to work in Russia. The reason is that she cannot have children, and Zarrina is very sad due to this. She wants to save money for her health, and thinks that only in Russia can she get the right treatment. Her next loan will be used for increasing her assortment of perfumes. During this season she could make more money.

loans.use: Increase her stock of perfumes

loans.name: Romao Casimiro

texts.pt:
Romão Casimiro T. is a fisherman and a cattle farmer. He was born on January 1st 1956, in the city of CaT. in Maputo. His father was a carpenter and his mother a mais who also worked with Liquor retail. He lost his father at an early age. Romao then went to live with his uncle who was a shoe repairer. There Romao learned the trade from his uncle and made a living reparing shoes until he became interested in the selling of sodas, which were scarce in CaT.. Later, he also worked as a street vendor. In 2002, by recommendation of his friends, he began to work with frozen chicken from the neighboring country of South Africa. Romao encountered financial difficulties, he then took out a loan of 6.000,00 through Hluvuku to expand his business.

Latter he requested 3 more loans of 8.000,00, 1.250,00 and 15.000,00 which enabled him to expand and strengthen his business, stat construction of his house and buy a fishing boat. With the 6th loans he bought fishing nets. Romao currently employs 6 people. He intends to buy a motor for the fishing boat and buy more cattle.

His activities have a positive impact in his community in that it brings sea food to his community, generates employment and increases the cattle number in his community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Romão Casimiro T. Actividade: Pesca Valor do emprestimo: 30.000,00MT (1,200.00US$) Aplicação do emprestimo: Redes de pesca Início: 10/07/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Romão Casimiro T., pescador e criador de gado bovino, nasceu aos 1 de Janeiro de 1956, em CaT. Cidade de Maputo, filho de pai Carpinteiro e mãe doméstica que se dedicava també ao fabrico e comercialização de bebidas alcoolicas em pequena escala. Perdeu o pai muito cedo, facto que lhe levou a viver com um padrasto que era sapateiro, aproveitando assim a aprender um ofício que lhe ajudou a auto sustentar-se até ao momento em que interessou-se pela comercialização de refrigerantes, produtos que escasseavam na CaT. e mais tarde vendia também o açucar, embora de forma ambulante. Por influência de amigos, em 2002 iniciou o negócio de frangos congelados que adquiria na vizinha República da Africa do Sul, tendo enfrentado algumas dificuldades financeiras e recorrendo assim a um empréstimo de 6.000,00mt na Hluvuku para reforçar o seu negócio. Recoreu a mais 3 emprestimos sucessivos de 8.000,00mt, 10.250,00mte 15.000,00mt, para fortificar o seu negócio que era segundo ele bem sucedido, o que lhe permitiu acomular alguns fundos para construção da sua casa e ainda para comprar um barco e redes, iniciando assim o investimento na pesca. Com o sexto e ultimo empréstimo de 30.000,00mt comprou redes para pesca. Tem actualmente 11 pessoas na sua responsabilidade, e como perspectiva pretende comprar um motor para barco de modo a rentabilizar cada vez mais a sua actividade e ainda aumentar o numero de cabeças de gado bovino de modo a ter seu próprio cural ja que de momento deixou em no cural de um amigo. As actividades por ele abraçadas são de grande impacto pois para além de abastecer o mercado de mariscos, garantem postos de trabalho e por outro lado aumenta a população de bovinos que constituem a melhor forma de poupança para as comunidades rurais.

loans.use: To buy nets

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa is 35 years old, she completed high school, and she is the mother of 4 children. She lives in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department. Ms. Rosa was a Community Health Promoter with the Reproductive Health Project of the Manuela Ramos Movement, and she used all her persistence to form the Communal Bank "Women of the Morning" in her community. She received her first loan of approximately $96, which she used to buy some guinea pigs and chickens, and in that way she started her business raising and seliing animals. At present she raises and sells not just guinea pigs and chickens, but also pigs, sheep, and cattle. In the afternoons, she weaves sweaters, shawls, key rings, etc. - whatever is requested by her customers in the city of Trujillo.

With the loan approved by Manuela Ramos for approximately $477, she purchased sheep and pigs, because she wants to fatten them to sell during the festival of the Virgen de La Puerta in the city of Otuzco, which is celebrated in the month of December.

Ms. Rosa hopes that her children will be professionals and that she and her husband will have enough resources so that he can open a carpentry workshop.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es madre de 4 niños y vive en el distrito de Agallpampa, de la Provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Rosa fue promotora comunitaria de salud del Proyecto Reprosalud del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y puso todo el empeño para formar en su comunidad el Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Mañana”, recibió un primer préstamo de S/.300 ($ 96 aprox.) y con él compró unos cuanto cuyes y gallinas e inicia así su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Actualmente cría y vende no solo cuyes y gallinas sino también cerdos, ovejas y ganado vacuno; Por las tardes teje chompas, chalinas, llaveros, etc. De acuerdo a lo que pidan sus clientes generalmente de la ciudad de Trujillo.

Con el préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500 ($.477 aprox.) compró ovejas y cerdos porque quiere engordarlos para venderlos en la Fiesta de La Virgen de La Puerta de ciudad de Otuzco que se celebra en el mes de diciembre.

La señora Rosa sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y con tener los recursos suficiente para que su esposo pueda implementar su taller de carpintería.

loans.use: Compra de ganado (ovejas, cerdos).

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 and married with five children. Her business is a roadside produce stand. She smiles easily, has a wonderful sense of humor, and welcomes all who pass her stand, located in front of her home. She has had this stand for four years and has been a member of her lending group for ten years.

Today she is selling bunches of onions, cabbage, eggplant, chapatas, avocado, eggs and popcorn. With her loan, she will buy more produce for her stand and pay school fees for her children. Alice dreams of one day opening a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her stand and to pay school fees

loans.name: Kubirat

texts.en: Kubirat I. is happily married with four children. She is 38 years old and comes from Oshodin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells plywood. She has been in her business since 1993. She is the leader of her Union and needs the loan to buy more plywood for sale

loans.use: To buy more plywood for sale

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Team work undoubtedly is one of the keys to obtain a positive fruit at the end of the day and this is what Frida does every day when working with her loved husband who has a wonderful skill to repair devices. This has long ago turned into the main economic activity of her family. This is how Frida and her husband decided to sell second-hand gadgets. They mainly repair TV sets and radios, occasionally other devices like blenders, calculators, etc. Frida knows that sometimes sales are low but her saving skills help them for these difficult moments. Now they commercialize these goods in the streets; nevertheless their desire is to be able to establish in a place. Frida is requesting a loan to acquire a bigger quantity of non-working devices in order to repair them and to sell them to the public in general. Let's support a close family and compromised with her development.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El trabajo en equipo sin duda es una de las llaves para obtener un fruto positivo al término de la jornada y eso es lo que aplica Frida cada día en la labor diaria de su querido esposo que tiene una maravillosa habilidad para la reparación de artefactos; ésta desde hace mucho tiempo se ha convertido en la principal actividad económica de su familia, fue así que Frida y su esposo decidieron dedicarse a la venta de artefactos eléctricos de segunda. Reparan en mayor cantidad televisores y radios, ocasionalmente otros artefactos como licuadoras, calculadoras, etc. Frida es consciente que a veces las ventas son bajas pero se compensan con otras y su habilidad de ahorro le sirven para estos momentos difíciles, por el momento comercializan estos bienes de manera ambulante; sin embargo su deseo es poder establecerse en un local. Frida hace lo solicitud de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de artefactos en desuso a fin de repararlas y venderlas al público en general que solicita estos bienes. Apoyemos a una familia unida y comprometida con su desarrollo.

loans.use: Buy a bigger quantity of non-working devices in order to repair them and to sell them.

loans.name: Azis

texts.id:
Azis is a collector, his daily activity is finding used goods. He lives in Padang Sambian with a rental of 150.000 a month.
