texts.en: Mrs. Srey N., 56, who lives in Srae Kaes village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns 2.50-hectares of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Srey N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Phan Nol, shown with her in the photo, is an electronics repairman (video player, radio, television, etc) earning a small income to support his family. This couple has two children, both students, who also support their mother's farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Bikuweraki Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en:
Fortune finally knocked at her door 6 years ago when she finally took root in her retail franchise that she operates from home. Prior to that, 45-year-old M. Nulu was eking out a relatively low-level living with profits from her modest salon business. The tough experience mill she was brought to terms with whilst still running her salon business was enough to help her dispense with the naiveté of operating a business. The only reliable stock in trade she had to employ in her new business was a strong resolve to succeed and a focused, clear, and sustainable plan of action. These attributes have been her mileage in an invariably competitive retail business field. 

Her shop has an array of goods on display ranging from bags of sugar, bars of soap, and rice. In the course of time, Nulu has come to the realization that never losing sight of one’s objectives principally in operating a business is of paramount importance if one is to achieve short-term and long-term success. 

Though her business doesn’t bring in hefty profits going by the 20,000 shillings she reckons she makes in a week, she is upbeat that her prospects will only get better as long as she can continue biding her time patiently. She is high on conviction that with this loan, she will be able to buy more retail items for her shop. She is looking at buying more bags of sugar, salt, rice and bars of soap, as these are highly demanded items in her locality. She figures she will be able to earn more revenue as a result of the restocking of her shop.

loans.use: The purchase of retail items like bags of sugar,salt and rice

loans.name: Petra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petra de 59 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene una tienda de víveres desde hace 6 años cuando murió su esposo. 

Ella comenzó a vender huevos en cubetas, arroz y leche en un puestito que tenia en la calle, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo readecuar su casa y ubicar la tienda que siempre quiso, por esa buena decisión ahora ella trabaja en su propia tienda desde muy temprano, vende arroz, bebidas, lácteos, carnes etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceites para su negocio. En el futuro quiere, terminar de construir su casa y poder alquilar cuartos para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Petra, 59, lives along Guayaquil’s Perimetral Highway (in the city outskirts, surrounded by a salt marsh). She has had a grocery store for six years, since her husband died. She began to sell eggs, rice and milk from a little post that she had in the street. Little by little, with effort, she was able to readjust her house to accommodate the store that she had always wanted. Because of this good decision, she now works in her own store, beginning very early in the day, selling rice, drinks, dairy, meat, etc. With the loan, Petra wishes to buy rice, sugar and oil for her business. In the future she wishes to finish construction on her house and rent rooms in order to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Central province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a doorman in a local secondary school, and earns 200,000 MNT per month.

Tungalag operates a shoe trading business at a rented stall in her town market. She started her business in early 2010, specializing in shoes and boots retailing. She has made progress with her business for such a short period of time, and has found much success. Today her earnings are stable and her husband continues to help with her business as well. Tungalag is focused on the future and is working hard to keep up with her fast growing customer base. She is a hard working and modest woman, who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more shoes and boots at wholesale prices and resell at retail for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and boots.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: Maria Emilia tiene 58 años, su actividad es una pulpería, Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio esta oportunidad, cuando dio inicio fue con muy pocos productos, pro con el paso del tiempo es que ha incrementado su inventario y sus clientes que son sus mismo vecinos, familiares entre otros. Este crédito es para comprar pan, galletas, golosinas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Maria Emilia is 58 years old and she has a general store. For more than 14 years she has had this business. It is not the first time that she has had a loan and she has appreciated the support. When she first started out she only had a few products to sell but with time she managed to increase her inventory and she gained more clients, mostly her neighbours and her family. This loan will be used to purchases bread, cookies, snacks and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 47 years old. Leonora is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 8 years.

Leonora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Elena P. C., se dedica la venta de refrescos en el mercado la estación, inicia las 6:00 am y finaliza a la 1:00 pm, solicita este crédito para compras de semilla, cacao y productos varios el cual ella le agradece a ceprodel porque con los créditos que le ha brindado, ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo con productos populares, donde obtiene una mayor ganancia para la mantención de su hogar.
texts.en: Sra. Rosa Elena Perez C. operates a business selling cold drinks at the market in the station.  She works from 6:00 in the morning to 1:00 in the afternoon.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients for making the products she sells.  Sra. Perez is very grateful to CEPRODEL because the extra working capital she's received has allowed her to make products that her customers want and, in turn, increased her earnings.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Sidibé est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de  Bougouni.
Monsieur Adama Sidibé a fait des études, en langue Arabe, après lesquelles, il décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités  comme la vente des céréales, mais sans succès. Après une longue réflexion il finit par apprendre auprès de son ami la vente des articles divers tels les habits, chaussures, radios...
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Sa boutique de prêt à porter est située en plein cœur du grand marché de Bougouni.
Pour renforcer son activité, il décide rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, des habits, chaussures, radios et autres petits articles.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako. Il est à son deuxieme prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent ont été correctement bien remboursé.  Sa clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA
texts.en: Adama Sidibe is married, 38 years old and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.  Mr. Sidibe was educated, in the Arabic language, after which he decided to earn a living. He spent years trying different businesses, such as selling grain, but without success. After much thought, he decided to learn from a friend how to run a business selling various items such as clothes, shoes, radios ...  After more than 5 years of experience, he has mastered his business.  His ready-to-wear shop is located in the heart of Bougouni's large market.  To bolster his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy clothes, shoes, radios and other small items. He gets his supplies in Bamako. This is his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loan has been fully repaid. His clientele consists of all social classes.  He expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: :   Santos Pablo

texts.es: SANTOS PABLO R. R.,Trabaja como Higienista en Commema mercado Oriental de Managua.   es padre de familia de cinco j¡hijos dos se encuentran en el colegio, ha trabajado ocho prestamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, el prestamo solicitado  es para la compra de pliegos de zinc y madera para el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Santos Pablo R. R. works as a cleaner for Commema (Corporación Municipal de Mercados de Managua) in Managua's Mercado Oriental market.  He is the father of five children who all attend school.  He has had eight loans from CEPRODEL and they have been used to improve his house.  The loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy sheets of corrugated metal and wood for the roof of his house.

loans.use: House improvements.  Replacing his roof
